title.$t: ERR_UNKNOWN_URL_SCHEME for 'mailto:' in packaged app

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_2) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.115 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
I have attached a reduced test-case:

1. packaged app runs `chrome.app.window.create(‘webview.html’)`
2. webview.html contains a webview element `<webview id="econ-webview" partition="persist:economist-storage"></webview>`
3. the webview is navigated to a test page at http://dev.labs.ft.com/george/email/ which contains a button
4. when the button is clicked, the mailto protocol is invoked with `parent.location = "mailto:?subject=test%20email”;`

What is the expected behavior?
The 'mailto:' URL should invoke the default email client.

What went wrong?
In the affected browsers, this error is encountered:

The web page at mailto:?subject=test%20email might be temporarily down or it may have moved permanently to a new web address.
Error code: ERR_UNKNOWN_URL_SCHEME

WebStore page: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/the-economist/gebjgjhbjedcomcajgpodjgfjgkepgpl?hl=en-GB

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.115  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.10.2
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

The reduced test case fails on OS X and Windows, but seems to work fine on Chrome OS.

I believe at some stage that this was a problem on CrOS, which appears to have been fixed.

NB. this ticket has also been raised with CWS Developer Support (thread "Re: [3-9855000005947] Economist App: Email sharing button does not work on Chrome OS, works on Windows").

title.$t: [DevTools - Visual Design] New Color Picker

content.$t:
Suggested features:

- Add eye dropper button, currently many users do not discover this feature. Question: can we render the picker loupe globally (on page and Chrome/DevTools UI) like Firefox does? 
- Show editable Hex, HSL(A) and RGB(A) values
- Add color palettes and swatches: Auto (derived from colors used most frequently on page), Material Design (http://www.google.de/design/spec/style/color.html#color-color-palette) and custom user palettes
- Add support for linear and radial gradients. This would require overlaying movable color stops and lines/circles on page elements. Feasible?

Mocks: https://folio.googleplex.com/chrome-devtools/015-color-picker/2#%3Fz=fit&c=show

If everyone is fine with the suggested functionality, I'd like to hand our design over to Chrome UI review before we start implementing it.

title.$t: [WebView] - Add tests for AwContentsClient.onPage{ Commit | Finished }Visible

content.$t:
This is a reminder so that we don't forget. I have been testing them manually and I couldn't see any problems, but we need to add a couple of unit tests.

The patch https://codereview.chromium.org/922723002/ will introduce a couple of visual state callbacks, ie. onPageCommitVisible and onPageFinishedVisible. We should add a couple of tests to VisualStateTest.java for them.

title.$t: Make rare font loading failures on Mac show in Inspector console

content.$t:
There are rare occasions where loading a user-registered font, not stored in a system location might fail to load, due to the font being corrupt or the file having moved.

Currently these errors get logged as WTF_LOG_ERROR, but perhaps we can improve a content author's debugging experience by logging those cases to the inspector console.

title.$t: ValidateDrawElements doesn't cache computed index range

content.$t:
ValidateDrawElements computes the min/max index in the elementBuffer for the given draw range. An elementBuffer has an cache to store the min/max elements to avoid recomputation upon each draw call. After computing the min/max value for the draw range the value is not added to the IndexRangeCache. As a result the cache never fills up and the min/max values are computed on each draw call.

I've attached a patch which solves the issue.

title.$t: Update "extension disabled/re-enable" UI for supervised users

content.$t: Supervised user may not change (e.g. re-enable) extensions that were installed by their custodian. All UI that would allow this needs to be adapted, i.e. buttons removed/disabled, strings changed etc.

title.$t: V8 snapshot blob should be passed to Isolate::New as CreateParam.

content.$t:
Currently static methods (SetSnapshotBlob and SetNativesBlob) is used to store the snapshot blob to create isolates from. This means that
- the snapshot blob has to be provided once upfront for all isolates
- it must not change
- it's not possible to create isolates from different snapshots
- it relies on static values

To fix this, the snapshot shall be passed to v8::Isolate::New via CreateParams. The upgrade path is that if CreateParams does not provide a snapshot blob, we use the default one provided by the static method. We should migrate Chrome to always provide the blob and remove the static methods.

title.$t: VPN API needs to be extended for supporting transitions in the future

content.$t: The VPN extension API allows an extension to create VPN configurations. Enterprises prefer to create the VPN configuration by policy or ONC. The API needs to be modified to support creation of the configuration by the platform.

title.$t: Roll Clang to incorporate recent changes to BlinkGCPlugin

content.$t:
Recently I made a few changes to BlinkGCPlugin to reflect the upcoming
changes in Oilpan (Blink GC) syntax that is needed to enable a new feature
(inlined tracing). Without my changes to BlinkGCPlugin, a new feature
cannot be enabled because of compile errors from the plugin.

Specifically, we want to incorporate the BlinkGCPlugin changes up to
e5ec4fe6 (at which point I have resolved all known issues):

https://crrev.com/e5ec4fe6e30327ccff5ed9e2ee57495b24f6878a

Nico, do you have any plan to make a Clang roll soon-ish? This blocks
shipping of inlined tracing in ToT Blink, so earlier is better.

If there's any issue with the plugin, let me know.

title.$t: Regression: Able to type a single alphabet for infinite times in chrome://settings/homePageOverlay.

OS: All (Win 7 Aero-Enabled).

Steps:
1. Launch chrome and navigate to chrome://settings/homePageOverlay
2. Click on 'Open this page' and type any single alphabet continuously (for eg. 'a').
3. Observe.

Actual: Typing of the single alphabet never stops ( i.e. Able to type a single alphabet for infinite times).

Expected: Typing of any single alphabet should stop where the text box ends.

This is a regression issue broken in M-37.

Narrow Bisect:

title.$t: Hangouts autolaunching when not allowed

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64; rv:35.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/35.0

Steps to reproduce the problem:
Part 1:
1. setup Hangouts to not launch automatically on Chrome startup
2. startup Chrome
3. Hangouts app still autolaunches

Part 2
1. in Chrome extension settings, uncheck "allow in incognito" for Hangouts extension
2. launch chrome in incognito mode via right click on the taskbar

What is the expected behavior?
Part 1: no hangouts app launched
Part 2: no hangouts app laucnhed

What went wrong?
Part 1: Hangouts launched -- you can sometimes get this to work correctly, but periodically, it will lose the setting and always autolaunch. The only way to fix it is to turn it back on, close Chrome and Hangouts, start chrome up and let it autolaunch, and then turn off autolaunch with both of them started.

Part 2: Since Chrome is being launched directly in incognito mode and the extension is disable, it shouldn'd ever startup this way, regardless of the autolaunch settings.

WebStore page: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/hangouts/knipolnnllmklapflnccelgolnpehhpl

Did this work before? Yes Off and on -- accurate settings seem to be lost

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.115 (Official Build)  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.3
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

This has been going on since the Hangouts app was launched (as opposed to the extension version).

title.$t: Dropped frames in 4K YouTube videos

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.115 Safari/537.36

Example URL:

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open any YouTube video available in 4K resolution
2. Switch the playback resolution to 4K
3. 

What is the expected behavior?
Smooth 4K video playback

What went wrong?
Stuttering and dropped frames in 4K resolution option on YouTube, especially with hardware acceleration enabled

Did this work before? Yes In previous versions of Chrome

Is it a problem with Flash or HTML5? HTML5

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.115  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

The performance issue is only noticed in 4K mode and has started recently. This issue did not exist in earlier versions. There is also a significant amount of CPU usage with hardware acceleration enabled at 4K. Disabling hardware acceleration reduces both the stuttering and the CPU usage but the stuttering is still present and noticeable. The issue is not present in the Canary build or in other browsers.

title.$t: Demo: Remove obsolete extension.

content.$t:
Version: ToT
OS: Chrome OS

We should disable adlphlfdhhjenpgimjochcpelbijkich for en locale.

title.$t: RTL horizontal alignment in multiline is broken

content.$t: It always render as if it's LTR now.

title.$t: Investigate jank of BluetoothAdapterMac::PollAdapter.

content.$t:
On Chrome 43 Mac, this method janks 3 times per user hour (jank = blocking main thread for >160ms). On average, this method takes 41ms to run.

Question 1: Is this method supposed to take this long? If it's not, I can add additional instrumentation to figure out which part of the method is taking so long.

Question 2: Does this have to be on the main thread? If I'm reading this function correctly, it schedules itself to run every 500ms, and each time it runs, it blocks the main thread for 41ms. This seems less than ideal.

title.$t: Menu CSS issues > display:block, opacity:1... none keep the dropdown visible

content.$t: Chrome Version : 40.0.2214.115 (Official Build) URLs (if applicable) : http://173.199.164.72/~whitmanhomes/boatwrights-loop/ Other browsers tested: Firefox OK, Safari OK, IE OK Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 6: OK Firefox 20: OK IE 7/8/9/10: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? - go to http://173.199.164.72/~whitmanhomes/boatwrights-loop/ - scroll down a little to show the sticky header - quick navigate on the main menu ** just on the main menu, hover it. - check the css code for >> header.navbar .navbar-nav > ul > li.menu-item-has-children:hover .sub-menu { display: block; visibility: visible; opacity: 1; } The dropdown shows up then it goes away in half second. I'm not using jQuery just simple css animations and as you can see on the code inspector the dropdown is set to display:block; visibility: visible; opacity:1 but it doesn't keep live. Here's my chrome info Google Chrome 40.0.2214.115 (Official Build) Revision 831713c5c90271926c2ca70afaa969d32e4576f5-refs/branch-heads/2214@{#490} OS Mac OS X (I've tested on Chrome at Windows, same problem) What is the expected result? It should show the dropbox consistently. What happens instead? The dropdown shows up then it goes away in half second. I'm not using jQuery just css animation and on the code inspector the dropdown is set to display:block; visibility: visible; opacity:1 but it doesn't keep displaying for more than half second. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. Revision 831713c5c90271926c2ca70afaa969d32e4576f5-refs/branch-heads/2214@{#490} OS Mac OS X

title.$t: Stop using the name "App Launcher"

content.$t:
Version: 43
OS: All

There are a lot of strings everywhere that use the term "App Launcher". The new Ares experience is being re-branded as "Chrome Launcher" (or simply "Launcher" when the context is clear).

We should be changing all of these strings to avoid mentioning "App Launcher". This is tricky because we haven't launched Ares on non-ChromeOS platforms yet, and we don't really want IsExperimentalAppListEnabled() conditions everywhere. (As we currently have for the shelf tooltip "Apps" vs "Launcher" on ChromeOS.)

Probably best to just wait.

I will follow up with a list of strings.

title.$t: Reduce footprint of history log file

content.$t:
History log file is read at import startup...and parsed.
The current format is very verbose including long date strings and absolute urls to resources within the app.

This is problematic as both parsing and in-memory representation take too much space.

title.$t: Investigate jank of ProfileInfoCache::DownloadHighResAvatar.

content.$t: On Chrome Mac Canary (M43), this task janks 4.76 times per user hour (jank = block main thread for >160ms). The average run time is 19.3ms.

title.$t: ImportTask manually constructing URLs resulting in incomplete encoding of special characters in URL

content.$t:
Copy a file with a space in the name to a directory with a space in the name.

The URL of the resulting entity (returned by fileOperationUtil.copyTo) will have mixed encoding. E.g. 


(prefix removed for brevity)/drive-ebbe9ae388f1daaf9b4260a9ff64b62252e473f1/root/Chrome%20OS%20Cloud%20backup/2015-02-23/Diako Mardanbeigi8.jpg

Even though the URL for the original file had the value correctly encoded. I assume there's string concatenation involved.

(prefix removed for brevity)/removable/USB%20Drive/DCIM/Diako%20Mardanbeigi8.jpg

This is causing lookup failures in Cloud Import.

title.$t: content is zoomed when the content size is expanding

content.$t: Google Chrome 40.0.2214.109 (Official Build) Revision 81a51ff68ec7c93261bb7ff09b3b8af9d5e30cc9-refs/branch-heads/2214@{#475} OS Android 5.0.1; Nexus 9 Build/LRX22C What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. open https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/entry 2. tab keys to move the keyboard focus to 'Pri-2' 3. hit the tab key What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: a. show the selection items for 'Cr-?' b. horizontal scroll bar appears, because some of the selection items are too wide to fit in the screen What I see: a. ok b. no scroll bars, instead the entire web contents are zoomed out Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Investigate jank of SingleThreadProxy::BeginMainFrame

content.$t:
In Chrome Canary 43 Mac, this task janks 18.7 times per user hour (jank = task that took > 160ms on the main thread). 

The average run time of this task is only 1.27ms.

What do you see instead? Expected behavior: - omnibox is focused what I see: - nothing is focused Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: delta_generator: Generate a payload minor-version=2 using A to B operations

content.$t:
When using minor-version=1, delta_generator uses DeltaDiffGenerator::GenerateDeltaUpdateFile() to create the "best" operation to convert the old file to the new file. This can be leveraged to emit SOURCE_COPY and SOURCE_BSDIFF instead of MOVE and BSDIFF when generating minor-version=2.

Use this to create a payload minor-version=2 that includes only SOURCE_COPY, SOURCE_BSDIFF, REPLACE_BZ and REPLACE operations.

Don't worry about order of the operations for now.

title.$t: Support Cellular Roaming states in ONC

content.$t:
Currently Shill roaming states are translated directly to ONC and are do not take into account networks that are always in a roaming state in the getState results.

We should consolidate Shill's Device[Cellular.ProviderRequiresRoaming] property with onc.Cellular.Roamingstate to simplify any UI interested in roaming state.

title.$t: pp::Instance::RegisterMessageHandler() fails with --ppapi-in-process

content.$t: pp::Instance::RegisterMessageHandler() returns -2 for trusted plugins run with --ppapi-in-process.  This is the default flag for debugging trusted plugins with the NaCl Visual Studio plugin.

Almost certainly caused by https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/92d69f7733f4028cf8b3d5b4b97a31173e687594.

content.$t: Specifically there seems to be an issue with RegisterMessageHandler() unser --ppapi-in-process which leads me to think that this is not a well tested configuration.

title.$t: Service Worker: Master Kill Switch

content.$t:
We need a last resort Kill Switch for Service Worker.
 - in case a bad Service Worker got served for origin X
 - in case we have a major bug/regression in Service Worker that block access to a site and regular update mechanism are failing. 

Proposal:

Use Finch to serve a list of origins for which there shall not be any Service Worker. Finch also lets us scope down to specific population(s) if needed (e.g. only stable users)

All Service Workers for these origins must be unregistered (caches would be wiped out but this is fine given that it's a last resort measure).

title.$t: ARC: bogus [WARN] lines in arc_strace.txt

content.$t:
ARC runtime version: tot

It looks like the fd-to-filename mapper in arc-strace is not really thread safe. I saw bogus [WARN] lines which was very likely caused by the following scenario:

 Thread 1: Enter __wrap_open("X")
 Thread 1: Enter VFS::open("X")
 Thread 1: Exit VFS::open("X") with 3
 Thread 1: Register "X" as fd=3
 Thread 1: Exit __wrap_open("X") with 3
 Thread 1: Enter __wrap_close("X")
 Thread 1: Enter VFS::close("X")
 Thread 1: Exit VFS::close("X") with 0
 [thread switch]
 Thread 2: Enter __wrap_open("Y")
 Thread 2: Enter VFS::open("Y")
 Thread 2: Exit VFS::open("Y") with 3
 Thread 2: Register "Y" as fd=3, get "[WARN] Register the same FD twice!" warning which does not make sense
 Thread 2: Exit __wrap_open("Y") with 3
 [thread switch]
 Thread 1: Unregister fd=3, "Y" is removed from the map
 Thread 1: Exit __wrap_close("X") with 0
 [thread switch]
 Thread 2: Call write(3, ...) or whatever, get "[WARN] Unknown FD!" warning which does not make sense either

I think we should unregister the FD before entering VFS::close (or at least before releasing VFS mutex) to prevent this.

title.$t: InspectorBackend needs to be explicitly disconnected before being disposed of.

content.$t:
Right now, the websocket is disconnected in __del__(). Unfortunately, the timing of __del__ is not well defined, since it depends on the garbage collector. 

Right now, inspector_backend is created by devtools_client_backend, which keeps it in a map. When devtools_client_backend removes the inspector_backend from the map, it should also Disconnect() the websocket. 

Other consumers may have kept a reference to inspector_backend. If they attempt to use the websocket, inspector_backend should throw a UnrecoverableError exception.

title.$t: PSL usage inproperly treats wildcards as inate public suffices

content.$t:
Consider entries of

jp
*.foo.jp

We treat jp as a public suffix, meaning the public suffix for "bar.jp" and "baz.jp" is both ".jp"

However, the way the data file is setup, for "foo.jp", we treat the suffix as "foo.jp", when it should instead be "jp". However, "bar.foo.jp" and "baz.foo.jp" should both have their suffices as "bar.foo.jp" and "baz.foo.jp", respectively.

title.$t: linux-high dpi: Custom shapes

content.$t: Custom shapes for windows do not work correctly on Linux in high-dpi (e.g. hangouts bubble).

title.$t: RenderTextControlSingleLine is crazy

content.$t:
RenderTextControlSingleLine tries to center elements by reading the results of layout and modifying the style. This is not only crazy (we shouldn't be touching RenderStyle) but it's also extremely error prone as if we don't relayout, we may use the modified values from the previous layout.

I think it would be better to just move the code to http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css-align/. This would stop our modifying the style.

title.$t: Desktop/Tab Capture to support variable frame sizes

content.$t:
Currently, if the source of capture changes size (e.g., the browser window or desktop), it will be scaled and letterboxed to fit within a fixed video frame size.  This prevents use cases where it would be better for the receiving end of the video stream to perform scaling/letterboxing, if required.

The purpose of this bug is to track all changes being made to support variable frame sizing from GPU capture, all the way to hand-off of video frames to the render process.  Current plan:

1. Initial code clean-up around meaning of coded_size() versus visible_rect(), since there are currently a few hacks and misuses of both.

2. Other code clean-up, such as minor TODOs in src/content/browser/media/capture code.

3. Introduction of new concepts to the capture pipeline: max/min frame size, aspect ratio constraints, and potentially other implementation/plumbing to account for standard "getUserMedia" constraints.

4. Later work will leverage these changes to support new features like dynamic capture resolution (e.g., in response to current system performance).

title.$t: Figure out how to support printing huge documents via printerProvider API

content.$t:
Currently, the whole document is sent with onPrintRequested as an ArrayBuffer.
For documents larger than ~60MB only sending the event would crash the extension.
We have to figure out the best way to handle this (e.g. sending multiple events per document, each with a chunk of data).

title.$t: Improve test coverage for extension printer support

content.$t:
In particular, ExtensionPrinterHandler class needs some tests (especially for print requests).

PrinterProviderAPI has API tests, but it could also use few more test cases, preferably unit tests. Also, some existing tests (the ones that don't actually test custom bindings) could be converted to unit tests.

title.$t: requestAnimationFrame needs to check if elements are on screen

content.$t: Version: 40.0.2214.111 OS: any What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Visit http://greggman.com/downloads/examples/three.js/lots-o-iframes.html What is the expected output? It runs at 60fps What do you see instead? It runs slow The issue is RAF is not checking if the iframes are on the screen. Ideally RAF should check that the element in question (assuming an element was passed to RAF as the second argument) is on screen. Even without the element being passed into RAF though, when in an iframe the browser can check if that iframe is on screen. Why is this important? Because as more and more pages start using WebGL to diagram examples (pages about physics or other math, pages about graphics techniques, etc.) these issues make it compelling to NOT use WebGL. I'm personaly running into this issue on http://webglfundaments.org Many of the pages have 5 or 6 WebGL examples on them. If they are animated the examples run slow or at least jacky because of this issue. I know it's probably considered a low-pri issue but it's discouraging to have to work around this kind of issue. It feels like a platform regression because flash doesn't have this problem. not sure who to ping on this or what to tag it. It's not a WebGL issue it's a RAF issue. Is that perf or animation or ??

title.$t: ARC: L-Rebase: Failures parsing large doubles
Allow Alt-Drag to move and resize windows without selecting a handle

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; CrOS x86_64 6680.43.0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.65 Safari/537.36
Platform: 6680.43.0 (Official Build) beta-channel panther

Steps to reproduce the problem:
This is a feature request.

What is the expected behavior?

What went wrong?
In many *nix-based desktop environments (e.g., Unity, Gnome), you can move a window by holding down Alt while left-dragging from anywhere within the window. Similarly you can resize windows by right-dragging, and the type of resize is based on the closest handle to the pointer (even if that is half a window away). Not having to aim for a narrow handle makes this very quick and easy. I would like to see similar functionality in Chrome OS.

This feature is admittedly awkward to use with a touchpad, but for mouse power-users, this is a big usability improvement. I use a Chromebox with two large monitors, so I have a lot of windows to manipulate, and I regularly miss this feature from my Unity days.

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.65  Channel: beta
OS Version: 6680.43.0
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

While I'd really like this to use Alt, for consistency with other window managers, I also see this key is used to provide a right-click alternative. I think this can safely be multiplexed if care is taken.

title.$t: network_WiFi_ChannelScanDwellTime: missing beacon frames

content.$t:
network_WiFi_ChannelScanDwellTime test if failing intermittently on Intel devices due to missing large number of beacon frames. Here are couple occurrence on kip and tricky:
https://wmatrix.googleplex.com/testrun/wifi_matfunc?test_ids=177923932
https://wmatrix.googleplex.com/testrun/wifi_matfunc?test_ids=177935658

The problem is due to the fact that we ask the driver to perform a single-channel scan while it is in the middle of the scheduled scan. This results in the returned scan results to contained BSSes from both scans, which mess up the dwell time calculation.

To resolve this issue, we will disable scheduled scan before invoking the single-channel scan and reenable it after the test is completed. By disabling scheduled scan, any ongoing scheduled scan in the driver will be aborted.

It looks like we don't correctly implement justify-content when the content is bigger (in the main axis) than the flexbox.

What do you see instead? The large download should be canceled. The image instead appears to download in full. It appears that the HTML spec agrees that the original download should be cancelled. https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/embedded-content.html#the-img-element

title.$t: Transfer v8 snapshot files as file descriptors to child processes via file descriptors on Mac / Win

content.$t:
We need to transfer the v8 snapshot files to the child processes as file descriptors (or open file handles on Windows) such that the child process always uses the correct version of the snapshot even if an update happens under the hood while Chrome is still running. 

On Linux this caused a SnapshotData: CHECK(IsSane()) to fail when loading the snapshot in an unsandboxed plugin (crbug.com/457656).  It is possible that something similar might happen on other platforms.

We should probably also do the same for the ICU data file which is also opened by child processes.

Menu bar disappear after a while What do you see instead? menu bar never disappear

title.$t: Some videos do not play on Mac OS X with hardware accelerated video decode enabled

content.$t:
This bug is for collecting H.264 videos that fail to play with hardware accelerated video decode on Mac OS X. These are videos that work with the 'Disable hardware-accelerated video decode' flag but fail without it.

If you have such a video, please include the MP4 file or a public URL, as well as your Mac OS X version, GPU model, GPU driver version (for both GPUs if you have hybrid graphics), and whether playback was via. HTML5 video or Flash. Also useful are the counts from chrome://histograms/Media.VTVDA taken at least 15 seconds after the failure.

title.$t: Implement content scripts API of <webview>
Add a test to automate H264 JS video quality verification at sender and receiver ends

content.$t:
Issue 446627:	VAAPI VDA on WebRTC H264: frame drops and long pauses on the receiver side
Issue 455454:	H264 app: Loop back video not playing smoothly(stop and play)

This test should automate H264 video playback via JS and verify video quality at sender and receiver ends. This will help to avoid above mentioned regressions.

title.$t: ARC: native handle leak in pepper_file.cc

content.$t:
open(existing_file_name_in_html5_fs, O_RDONLY | O_DIRECTORY) properly returns -1 with ENOTDIR, but the open() implementation in pepper_file.cc leaks a native file handle. Because of the leak, NaCl plugin process runs out of native handle if the app calls open() in such a way ~1024 times (on a device) or ~32k times (on Z620).

I don't think this is a serious leak, but we should fix it with a test.

title.$t: SVG <use> element doesn't render with filter on both element and source, with skew transform applied

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.115 Safari/537.36

Example URL:

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Create an SVG with a graphical element such as a <rect>, and a second <use> element that references the first element
2. Attach a filter on both the <use> element and the source element
3. Apply a skew or rotate transform to the <use> element

What is the expected behavior?
The <use> element should render with the applied filter and  transform

What went wrong?
It doesn't render.  It will render if only one of the elements have a filter applied, or if the <use> element is not skewed.  Also, it seems that this is true for rotate transforms as well, but again only if both the source and <use> element have filters applied.  Translate and scale transforms do not cause this problem.

Does it occur on multiple sites: N/A

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.115  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

Attached are 2 sample SVG files that illustrate the problem.  

The UseSkewFilterBug.svg example illustrates the different configurations: 
1. Filter on both source element and <use> element with skew
2. Filter on just the source element, with skew
3. Filter on on just the <use> element, with skew
4. Filter on both source and <use> element, no skew

The UseSkewFilterBug_Simple.svg example is a bare-bones example of the bug in question.

title.$t: Connection info in the OIB is confusing and sometimes contradictory.

content.$t:
The current location for security information in Chrome is the “Connection” tab of the Origin Info Bubble (OIB). Unfortunately, strings in the OIB target both developers and regular users. The result is that the information is:
- obfuscated and incomplete for devs who need to work with details,
- too cryptic for most users, and
- sometimes contradictory.

We will not fix this directly, but we will address it by moving the info to DevTools (my current project):

Issue 445359:	DevTools: Add Security Panel
Issue 421248:	Move the Connection Tab info from the Origin Info Bubble into the Dev Tools console
Issue 420774:	[DevTools - Network Panel] Display connection info for resources in network panel

I'm creating this bug in so that we don't have lots of individual ones lying around instead.

title.$t: Ensure that GN and GYP builds build the same list of targets by default

content.$t:
We need a way to ensure that, on a given configuration, we can be sure that GN and GYP are building the same list of targets by default, i.e., that the 'all' (or 'All') targets match.

This is an important step in the GYP->GN conversion process, and it will be easy to miss changes that cause them to drift, given that GYP supports wildcard dependencies and GN does not (see bug 451558 for more discussion on that).

What do you see instead? Expected: pop-up with additional options ".org", ".net", etc Actual: no pop-up Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Can we make all media formats strict?

content.$t:
Supported containers are currently listed in the strict format_codec_mappings and common_media_types/proprietary_media_types. It would be nice to have a single (type of) list of supported containers.

It appears that the only containers in the latter that are not in the former are "audio/aac" and "video/mp2t". Do we really intend to support "audio/aac"? "video/mp2t" could probably be made strict to the same codecs as "video/mp4".

There might be some subtle behaviors here for supporting the mp3 formats with and without codecs.

We also need to ensure we handle proprietary types correctly (proprietary_media_types are removed when running layout tests to ensure we get consistent results between Chrome and Chromium).

Related question: Why is "audio/aac" listed under "MP3"?

title.$t: format_codec_mappings should use Codec enum instead of strings

content.$t:
format_codec_mappings, which is used to populate strict_format_map_, is currently a map of MIME type/container string to a string containing a list of codecs (MediaFormatStrict). It is only used to convert the codecs to an array of Codec enum values to use in strict_format_map_.

We should change it to be an array of the corresponding enum values. This will avoid confusion (i.e. why some avc1.xxxxxx values are specified) and unnecessary parsing at runtime. The CodecIDMappings arrays should be the only mapping of codec strings to Codec enum values.

title.$t: Simplify implementation of PeriodicWave

content.$t:
While looking at https://github.com/WebAudio/web-audio-api/issues/470 (FFT definition for AnalyserNode) and
https://github.com/WebAudio/web-audio-api/issues/91 (WaveTable normalization) I noticed that the current implementation of converting the PeriodicWave to a time-domain signal is slightly complicated.

Currently, the code scales the periodic wave data by the FFT size and performs an IFFT.  I believe the same results can be obtained by doing a forward FFT and just extracting the real part.

title.$t: Separate I/O and Computation Codepaths for Pre Main Message Loop Startup

We do a lot of things that require blocking I/O on the startup/UI thread for Chrome pre-main message loop.

- Extension system init

And some other less obvious candidates
- COM System Calls (could hit I/O like in parental controls).

It may be interesting to see if aggregating all I/O off of the thread helps startup.

title.$t: Separate renderers and NaCl processes with PID namespaces

content.$t:
[Background: cross-renderer interaction (and most importantly, integrity violation) is crucial to block in the Chrome security model. Beside site isolation (https://www.chromium.org/developers/design-documents/site-isolation), the fact that many renderers have very high privileges in the Chrome security model makes this necessary]

We should try and separate renderers and have each live in its own PID namespace.

Currently, we enforce renderer separation via:

1. Making renderers non dumpable (weak)
2. seccomp-bpf (issue 413855). Which is error-prone and difficult.

Having each renderer in its own PID namespace would have us rely on a semantic that the kernel understands and enforces for us, which is more robust.

title.$t: Bookmarks are restored seconds after deleting Bookmarks file even though sync turned off.

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Ubuntu Chromium/37.0.2062.120 Chrome/37.0.2062.120 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Delete ~/.config/chromium/Default/Bookmark* while chromium is not running.
2. Restart browser without signing in to Chromium.
3. Watch bookmarks reappear on the bookmarks bar within seconds.

What is the expected behavior?
The deleted bookmarks should remain deleted since I have not activated bookmark sync.

What went wrong?
I discovered this issue when I synched 2 computers over my local network "by hand" using rsync. This replaces the Bookmarks file, but Chromium then performs a merge of the old and new bookmarks, which is not what I desire. I delete Bookmarks as a diagnostic, and discovered that the bookmarks reappeared.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 37.0.2062.120  Channel: stable
OS Version: Ubuntu 12.04
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

title.$t: [WebView] - Clean up implementation of onJs{BeforeUnload|Confirm|Alert|Prompt}

content.$t:
If we have spare cycles at some point it'd be nice to clean up the implementation and documentation of onJs{BeforeUnload|Confirm|Alert|Prompt}. The current behaviour is very inconsistent (see WebViewContentsClientAdapter):

-> If a WebViewClient is not set then the default is to cancel/accept those requests.
-> If a WebViewClient is set and onJsFoo returns false then the default is to show a default JS dialog.
-> If a WebViewClient is set and onJsFoo returns true then we expect the app to show a custom JS dialog.

Discussing with Martin we had agreed that the best approach would be to change the behaviour behind and SDK and build check and get rid of the default JS dialogs and cancel/accept the requests/navigations by default.

title.$t: Refactor ProfileMetrics

content.$t:
The ProfileMetrics namespace should be made into a (singleton-style) class and have additional functionality. Specifically:

1) The data stored in the ProfileInfoCache that is specific to metrics should be stored elsewhere in LocalState and managed by ProfileMetrics. This includes:
  - ProfileIsAuthError
  - ProfileActiveTime
2) ProfileMetrics should have a timer that calls LogNumberOfProfiles every 24 hours, in place of using the GAIAInfoUpdateService to perform that function.

title.$t: Route extension script injections for frames to correct renderer

content.$t: Chrome Version: 40. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Start chrome with --site-per-process [1] 1. Have an extension with a content script that runs on all URLs on all frames (for example, the one attached) 2. Load a tab with a cross origin iframe. chrome.blogspot.com will do it. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The content script should run on every frame. In the attached extension, you will see a lot of logs of the form "running on <some URL>". Instead... well in my case, Chrome crashes, which is weird. I'd have just expected a sad tab. I swear that's what I saw on a local build. Perhaps it's a stable channel thing (that's what I have access to right now). In any case, certainly one reason we have this bug is assumptions on the renderer script injection that we can descend into cross origin iframes. This results in bugs such as bug 454917, but there will be deeper issues than just failing to find a string. Note that the example extension uses the content_scripts manifest key, but tabs.executeScript is another extension we'll need to get working. I expect that'll be a little harder, we'll at least need logic on the browser side to send IPCs to every RenderFrame, not just a single RenderView[2]. [1] And make sure you haven't enabled chrome://flags/#extension-active-script-permission [2] https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/extensions/browser/script_executor.cc&q=script_executor&sq=package:chromium&l=45

title.$t: Chrome suffers from excessive mouse 'input lag' in rAF <canvas> animations

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.115 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
Visit www.vsynctester.com and move the mouse cursor around (left to right; and back; repeat).  By default, the mouse 'input lag' detector test at vsynctester.com is turned ON (if not, click on the 'wheel'/settings and turn on the detector).  Chrome fails the input lag test, by having an 'input lag' of more than one frame.

What is the expected behavior?
There should be no more than one frame of delay in modern web browsers on modern/fast CPU/GPU systems, which should place the red dot in the vsynctester.com 'input lag' detector directly under the mouse cursor (The red dot is a prediction of where the mouse cursor will be one frame into the future, so on a browser with one frame of input delay, the two cancel out, and the red dot is placed under the mouse cursor, even when it moves fast).

Firefox actually passes this test.  So on a 60Hz display, Firefox has a 1/60 (16.66ms) input delay.

However, it appears that Chrome has a two frame input lag (in the vsynctester.com options, change the '1' to a '2' in the 'input lag' test checkbox line).  So on a 60Hz display, Chrome has a 2*1/60 (33.33ms) input delay.

What went wrong?
The delay between receiving mouse input, and acting upon that in a <canvas> requestAnimationFrame() animation, and then the user actually seeing the results on the display -- vs where the cursor now is on the display -- is too long.  The result in Chrome is a very noticeable 'input lag', where the mouse has moved on and is well ahead of the animation now displayed on the screen.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.115  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

I went back and checked Chrome 31, and it appears that Chrome 31 has an even worse three frame input delay -- so my guess is that is not a regression.

Chrome Canary 43.0.2312.0 has an incredibly strange behavior regarding input lag.  When I launch Canary, as long as it is not maximized, and I do NOT resize the application window, Canary has a ONE frame input delay.  The moment I resize the Canary app window, the input delay switches to a TWO frame input delay.  This is likely related to Canary not being VSYNC synchronized until the Canary app window is resized (see issue 422000).

Of course, this 'input delay' is tightly related to VSYNC synchronization.  There is no reason that Chrome has to be 'dumb' and always resort to a 'safe' two frame delay.  Instead, Chrome can and should be (very smartly) adaptive (in realtime), and use a one frame delay when a one frame delay is possible, and switch to a two frame delay, when a one frame delay does not work.  The decision of which mode to use is being made constantly 'on the fly', with the rate of switches between the modes rate limited to smartly adapt to running conditions.  The result would be this:  For simple animations, a one frame delay.  For complex animations, a two frame delay, because one frame would cause jank.

title.$t: skydb http server should run on localhost, not on 0.0.0.0

content.$t:
Running skydb http server binds to 0.0.0.0, which makes the server available to external connections. It should be 127.0.0.1 instead.

This requires an API change in http_server to allow to specify the full net address on which the server is to be set up.

title.$t: Rendering of buffered ranges in media controler timeline

content.$t:
Painting of buffered ranges in the media slider currently only paints the buffer that contains the current playing position. This works okay in most cases but is problematic for pipelines that throws away all buffered data that have been rendered. Even if the pipeline internally keeps these values in sync the blink interface is divided in two methods ant the internal state can change in between the calls. Depending on the timing/order of these calls interacting with the media pipeline, the current position can bee seen by blink as being outside of any buffered range even if that isn't really the case.

The algorithm in paintMediaSlider tries to handle this by requesting bufferedTimeRanges first and then currentTime which works in most cases. The case that cause troubles to our media pipeline is when the media element is in paused state and currentTime is cached in the HTMLMediaElement. This effectively changes the order of the buffered() and currentTime() calls to the platform media player. In our case we see that the buffered region disappears as soon as the player is paused an reappears when playing.

So how can this be solved? I just throw out some random thoughts to see if anything seems reasonable.
1. Stop caching currentTime when paused. I assume that the caching of current time in HTMLMediaElement has to do with spec compliance so this might not be possible because of that.
2. Change the blink interfaces to allow for synced retrieval of these values. This would mean that caching of buffered ranges when current time is cached is needed and the API might feel a bit unnatural.
3. Change the media slider rendering algorithm. I don't know what would be acceptable in this area. The implementation of paintMediaSlider says that painting all buffered ranges would be "distracting" to the user. Maybe that's true. Rendering the range, nearest to the playing position could be an alternative to the current solution or maybe extend the buffered range to include current position if it's close enough.

If we can agree on a solution I'll be happy to implement this and submit a patch.

title.$t: chrome.wallpaper.setWallpaper doesn't unload background page

content.$t:
Chrome Version       : 42.0.2305.2
OS Version: 6797.0.0

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Create a simple chrome app whose only goal is to show a window that lets you set a wallpaper with "chrome.wallpaper.setWallpaper"
2. Run the chrome app
3. Set a wallpaper
4. Open about:inspect/#extensions and look at your Chrome App background page
5. Close the app window

What is the expected result?
The generated background page should dissappear after a short period time because nothing else will happen.

What happens instead of that?
It stays there forever and consumes memory.


You might want to try it out with this simple wallpaper app https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/mhionpeefmohidemkepbndehdfakmkmf.
See https://github.com/beaufortfrancois/wallpapers-plus-chrome-app for code.

title.$t: Resource Timing - Missing PerformanceResourceTiming entries for Requests that don't receive a Response

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
http://www.co-operativeinsurance.co.uk/petinsurance/cat-insurance

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Load above URL with Devtools network panel open
2. Note http://10.64.30.186/assets/images/insurance/common/av_tick.png fails to load (TCP connection fails as href is wrong)
3. Inspect the PerformanceTimeLine entries - window.performance.getEntriesByType('resource')

What is the expected behavior?
W3C ResourceTiming spec is unclear on what the behaviour should be but my expectation would be an entry should be created for the URL in error.

FF Nightly 38.0a1 (2015-02-04) and IE 11.0.9600.17501 both create an entry in this case

What went wrong?
There is no PerformanceTimelineEntry for http://10.64.30.186/assets/images/insurance/common/av_tick.png 

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.9.5
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

Raised spec issue on W3C Perf Group mailing list

title.$t: CSS Second sibling selector not triggering a repaint/reflow

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.95 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Add a CSS line like input[type="checkbox"]:selected + label + div {background-color: red}
2. Click on the checkbox and inspect the "div" element
3. Dev Tools show the style is updated by the DOM isn't updated accordingly.

What is the expected behavior?
Usually if the Dev Tools show the style is updated, a repaint/reflow is expected to be triggered. 

What went wrong?
Chrome should trigger at least a repaint if a reflow is too expensive. If the element styling is updated, then a reflow is supposed to occur. It seems to occur only with second (or more) siblings. Something like input[type="checkbox"]:selected + label > div {background-color: red} works but input + sibling_1 + sibling_2 doesn't update the styling of sibling2.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.95  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

title.$t: Android Chrome can't save images with square brackets in their filenames

content.$t:
Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open https://t.fakku.net/images/manga/n/[Shikishiro_Konomi]_Original_Work_-_Netoraserare_-_Chapter_9/images/001.jpg in Android Chrome.
2. Tap and hold on the image to bring up the context menu

What is the expected behavior?
The "Save image" option should be present in the menu that appears.

What went wrong?
There is no "Save image" option present in the menu.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.109  Channel: stable
OS Version: 5.0.2
Flash Version: N/A

By comparison, the same menu for http://i.imgur.com/IeX5fAF.jpg does have a "Save image" option. The problem appears to be related to the "[" and "]" characters in the image's filename. If Android itself does not allow those characters in filenames, then Chrome should simply transform the filename to not include these characters when saving such images, rather than making it completely impossible for the user to save the image.

title.$t: Async popup generated with Q.js is blocked by the popup blocker while an async popup generated with jQuery is not

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_2) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.53 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. http://jsfiddle.net/suyt/0fs90oen/
2. Click on "jQuery promise", and see popup

title.$t: ARC: L-Rebase: Mark tests temporary disabled for code yellow

content.$t:
Before we enter L-rebase code yellow, we are marking failing tests so that integration tests temporarily pass and can catch regressions by buildbots (Issue 459495).

However, it is confusing to simply mark failing tests FAIL or TIMEOUT because we can't distinguish if they are expectedly failing or temporarily disabled. We need a way to mark them.

title.$t: Opening an already-mounted zip file should switch to the zip file

content.$t:
Google Chrome	41.0.2272.65 (Official Build) beta
Revision	cff2b4e5f520cd612ae84c9f242f9f1f03732fa6
Platform	6680.43.0 (Official Build) beta-channel lumpy

The user experience when downloading a zip file seems poor:

1. Click a .zip link (I downloaded logs from a feedback report). The zip file shows up in the download bar.
2. Click on the zip file in the download bar. The label updates to show that the file is being opened, and then the download bar disappears. No new window is opened.
3. Open the files app. "Downloads" is initially selected.
4. Double-click the downloaded zip file again. Instead of being opened, a notification saying "The archive is already mounted." is created.
5. Click on the mounted archive in the left pane of the app and finally see the file contents.

I think there are a couple of things that should be fixed here:

a) When I clicked on the downloaded zip file in step 2, we should've opened the files app with the mounted archive initially selected.

b) When I double-clicked the zip file in the app in step 4, we should've just switched to the mounted archive instead of scolding me in a notification and not doing what I was trying to do.

c) We shouldn't use the word "mounted" in user-visible text. It's a Unix term and probably doesn't make sense to most of our users.

title.$t: DevTools pretty printing produces wrong Javascript code
multiple Chromium instances overwrite tab histories

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.93 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. setup xdg-open to use Chromium (see below) and start two instances (observe that 'ps axf' shows two Chromium process trees running)
2. open tabs to several pages on one browser, and different ones on the other browser
3. kill the parent process for one Chromium instance
4. open a new page on the remaining instance
5. start another Chromium instance - observe that it prompts for recovery but only recovers the tabs open in the current instance, not in the one that crashed.
6. observe the browser history does not remember the crashed instances' tabs

What is the expected behavior?
History should behave properly despite multiple browser instances.  Recovery of any crashed instance should be possible.

What went wrong?
(see observations steps above)

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.93  Channel: n/a
OS Version: Arch (as of Jan 30 2015)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

Multiple instances under the same user:
$ xdg-mime default chromium.desktop x-scheme-handler/http
$ xdg-mime default chromium.desktop x-scheme-handler/https
in two xterms run:
$ xdg-open http://www.google.com

title.$t: Refactor HitTestResult to store the HitTestRequest

content.$t:
HitTestResult holds the hit test result and the original hit test location (including whether it is a rect-based test).

HitTestRequest holds just the type of request which includes whether the test should be list-based.

We should change HitTestResult to hold the HitTestRequest. This will allow for some nice cleanups such as asserting that the request type (list or not list based) matches the result's location (point-based or rect-based). This will also let us just pass around the result instead of the request and result.

title.$t: Accessible resources not available from a webview

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; CrOS x86_64 6457.94.0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.114 Safari/537.36
Platform: 6457.94.0 (Official Build) stable-channel swanky

Steps to reproduce the problem:
Create an app with a webview partition:
  "webview": {
    "partitions": [
      {
        "name": "foo",
        "accessible_resources": ["assets/*"]
      }
    ]
  }

Load the webview source from any server:
<webview src="http://localhost:8000/view.html" partition="foo"></webview>

Now view.html:
<img src="chrome-extension://lnplnihncdgjpcckaalkmlgjcelaepkb/assets/icon_128.png"></img>

Will show a broken image.  However, if you instead load view.html from the extension:
<webview src="chrome-extension://lnplnihncdgjpcckaalkmlgjcelaepkb/view.html" partition="foo"></webview>

And add view.html to the accessible_resources list, then everything works as expected.

What is the expected behavior?
Pages loaded in a webview should be able to access extension resources even if they are source from an external server.

What went wrong?
I get the error:
 Denying load of chrome-extension://lnplnihncdgjpcckaalkmlgjcelaepkb/assets/icon_128.png. Resources must be listed in the web_accessible_resources manifest key in order to be loaded by pages outside the extension.

Note that adding assets as web_accessible_resources in the manifest doesn't help.  I'm attaching an archive with the working and broken versions.

WebStore page: None

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.114  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6457.94.0
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

title.$t: New SELECT popup: <select> content corrupts when changing cursor

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2311.4 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/15217362/selectbug.html

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Visit the URL
2. Expand the <select> so its dropdown is showing
3. Move the mouse up over the red rectangle

What is the expected behavior?
Hovering the mouse over the red rectangle sets the cursor using some JS code to set an attribute on <body>. (This can of course be done with CSS but the bug only seems to repro this way.) The cursor should change and the <select> dropdown content remains identical.

What went wrong?
As soon as the cursor changes, the <select> dropdown content becomes garbled as shown in this picture: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/15217362/selectbug.png

Only non-ASCII characters get garbled, as the "This is an ASCII test item" text remains intact.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? Yes This does not reproduce in 40.0.2214.115 m (64-bit) stable.

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 42.0.2311.4  Channel: canary
OS Version: 6.3
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

Works correctly in Firefox and IE, is Chromium-only regression since v40.

title.$t: PDF scroll position lost when restarting Chrome despite using the "continue where you left off" setting

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.115 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. in settings, under "on startup", choose "continue where you left off"
2. view a pdf, and scroll partway through it, as if you are reading it.  Here's a good one to test with: http://www.cl.cam.ac.uk/~rja14/Papers/SEv2-c21.pdf
3. close and reopen the browser

What is the expected behavior?
all tabs are restored, and scrolled to their previous scroll positions.  (Of course, caveats apply about whether or not cookies were cleared when the browser is closed and if so if any login sessions were lost, or other such issues.  Assume all tabs are open to publicly viewable pages / pdfs, and there are no connectivity issues)

What went wrong?
while the scroll state is preserved for HTML pages, it is lost for PDF documents.  Which makes "continue where you left off" a bit of a lie, if you try to use chrome to read longer pdf files.

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.115  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

title.$t: Responses aren't viewable in the network tab after a page load

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.91 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. open the developer tools to the network tab, and check preserve log
2. navigate to a page
3. click a link on that page, loading another page (or do something that triggers a redirect)
4. try to view the response from a network request right before the second page loaded.

What is the expected behavior?
response data is shown

What went wrong?
the "Preview" and "Response" tabs both show "Failed to load response data".  This only happen after a page navigation occurs.

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.91  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

I've run into this in the particularly annoying case of an ajax call that, on success, loads a url contained by the response data (which is usually expected to download some content - sending a Content-Disposition: attachment header in it's response).  Since this happens pretty much instantly, it's hard to see what the ajax response was when something goes wrong and the resulting url doesn't start a download.

title.$t: Child elements with overflow: hidden; cause strange painting inside scrollable containers

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2311.4 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
https://www.wunderlist.com/webapp

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Log in/ sign up
2. Create a list with ~100 or more tasks to be scrollable.
3. Add overflow: hidden; to the .taskItem class (via inspector)
4. Scroll (down and back up)

What is the expected behavior?
Task items should be visible, and painted as you scroll.

What went wrong?
Task item painting severely lags behind the scroll position.
Task items are not visible sometimes for a second or more (this is purely chrome rendering).

Here is a screencast of the issue: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3FxY-RVNPqA

Does it occur on multiple sites: N/A

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? Yes Chrome 40.0.2214.115 (64-bit)

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 42.0.2311.4  Channel: canary
OS Version: OS X 10.9.5
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

Not happening on Chrome 40.0.2214.115 (64-bit)

I am attempting to improve scroll performance of the Wunderlist webapp by limiting/scoping repainting.  Simply adding overflow: hidden; to the task item elements works well in stable chrome.  On chrome canary it behaves completely strange.

title.$t: Vertical scrollbar appears after hitting F11 twice

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/37.0.2062.120 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Goto http://chesstempo.com/mobile (its a online chess game)
2. Press F11 to go to fullscreen (that works)
3. Press F11 multiple times (the application adjusts itself to fullscreen (works good)
4. When in fullscreen, select the button Tactics to start chesstraining (that also works like expexted)
5. Hit F11 twice, to leave fullscreen and go back into fullscreen mode again. (Now a vertical scroll bar appears with nothing to scroll)

What is the expected behavior?
After step 5. I expect to get the same result as after step 4. No scroll bars!

What went wrong?
A scroll bar appears where no scroll bar should be shown, because the webpage has the size of the screen.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 37.0.2062.120  Channel: stable
OS Version: debian 7.8
Flash Version: 

Actually there should be a commandline parameter to disable horizontal and/or vertical scrollbars at all, because many Laptop and Notebook computers have a scroll function in their touchpad and therefore do not need a scrollbar in the browser (also the cursor keys may be used to scroll the webpage). Especially devices with small screens (taskstations, kiosk systems) profit from fullscreen with no unwanted or unneeded windowdecoration. It would also be great if the browser would start in fullscreen mode already (there is a commandline parameter for that, but it does not work).

title.$t: Hiding top control is not smooth when content height is smaller than viewport including top controls

content.$t:
Example URL:
https://nid.naver.com/nidlogin.login?svctype=262144&url=http://m.naver.com/

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Go to "https://nid.naver.com/nidlogin.login?svctype=262144&url=http://m.naver.com/"
2. After a while, scroll up the page

What is the expected behavior?
Scroll and Hiding toolbar should be smooth.

What went wrong?
Content height of the site is bigger than viewport(1) height and smaller than viewport(2) height.
So the content can be scrolled. But scroll and hiding toolbar is stucked when content is scrolled up completly. And then top control is hidden by animation and chrome lets viewport resize.

* viewport(1) : state that top control is shown
* viewport(2) : state that top control is hidden that viewport height is bigger than viewport(1)'s

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? No 

Does this work in other browsers? N/A 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.63  Channel: beta
OS Version: Android 4.4.2; SM-N900S
Flash Version: NA

title.$t: Font size changes when jQuery hide / unhides overflow.

content.$t:
Example URL:
http://jsbin.com/lumeqa/

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. View http://jsbin.com/lumeqa/ with Chrome on Android
2. Click the "Read More" buttons
3. Watch the font sizes dance for no reason.
Example: http://i.imgur.com/1mxirdg.jpg

What is the expected behavior?
Expected font sizes to stay the same since they are not changed by JS or CSS.

What went wrong?
Font sizes are changing.

Does it occur on multiple sites: N/A

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.109  Channel: stable
OS Version: 
Flash Version: 

Adding <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"> to the page fixes it.
Also setting the font size in CSS probably fixes it. The font size is coming from the default size specified by the browser.

title.$t: chrome.bluetoothLowEnergy API documentation does not list supported platforms

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_2) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2305.3 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
API documentation at https://developer.chrome.com/apps/bluetoothLowEnergy

What is the expected behavior?

What went wrong?
Documentation does not list what platforms are supported. In particular, right now chrome.bluetoothLowEnergy is only supported on Chrome OS. Documentation should note the fact that only Chrome OS is supported and should link to issues to track implementation on Mac (https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=364359), Windows (https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=388016), and Linux (Any issue open yet?)

Examples of people who have been confused by documentation:
https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=430231
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/24880860/connecting-to-an-ios-device-using-the-chrome-bluetoothlowenergy-api
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/28109183/chrome-bluetooth-l2cap-protocal-is-not-supported

Did this work before? N/A

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
No way to systematically reproduce, but I'm observing the following nonsense behavior

1. I'm on a web page that has some links
2. I move the mouse cursor over a link

What is the expected behavior?
every time I move the cursor over a link, the status bar should appear at the bottom left showing the url the link points to. Always
And moving the mouse away from it, the url should disappear

What went wrong?
1) After loading the page, I move the cursor over a link X but the status bar doesn't show up at all, ever (no matter how many times I try)
2) If unmaximize and remaximize the window, or if I switch tabs and then come back to the page's tab, then I move the cursor over link X and the url DOES show up in the status bar, but then it never goes away when I move the mouse away. 
3) After this, if I move the mouse over another link, that link's url shows up as expected, but as soon as I move the mouse away from any link, link X's url shows up again, and stays forever

title.$t: DOMStringList has been removed from DOM

content.$t:
Removed in https://github.com/whatwg/dom/commit/8f73159d4a9e2e1a002f4eb1dfd4df3f645e9575

https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#domstringlist (in list of removed features)

In Blink it's used in these places:
Location's readonly attribute DOMStringList ancestorOrigins
IDBDatabase's readonly attribute DOMStringList objectStoreNames
IDBDatabase's IDBTransaction transaction((DOMString or sequence<DOMString> or DOMStringList) storeNames, optional IDBTransactionMode mode = "readonly")
IDBObjectStore's readonly attribute DOMStringList indexNames

title.$t: DOMError has been removed from DOM

content.$t:
Removed in https://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=23367

https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#domerror (in list of removed features)

In Blink it's used in these places:
interface FileError : DOMError
IDBRequest's readonly attribute DOMError error
IDBTransaction's readonly attribute DOMError error
StorageErrorCallback's void handleEvent(DOMError error)
MIDIErrorCallback's void handleEvent(DOMError error)

title.$t: Sync IDL files with specs

content.$t:
As discussed on blink-dev:
https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/forum/#!topic/blink-dev/qhoN9Ce2ji4

To summarize:

1. Add or update spec links.
2. Make interface members match spec order.
3. Annotate any differences with FIXMEs and spec bug and/or crbug links where non-trivial.

This bug is not for actually fixing every difference, although follow-up fixes are likely. Any non-standard bits found will be tracked with UseCounters.

title.$t: should sync credit card autofill data to mobile

content.$t:
Steps to reproduce the problem:

2. Add a credit card to auto fill
3. Sign in on Chrome on Android with the same account

What is the expected behavior?
Auto fill settings on Android shows my credit card details.  I can go to a web site that requires credit card payment, and it auto completes my credit card details (presumably without CVV).

What went wrong?
Credit card details are not synced to Android.  I have to re-enter my credit card details manually. :(

Did this work before? N/A

OS Version: 5.0.2
Flash Version:

title.$t: CSV files opened through the ChromeOS file manager should open in google spreadsheets

content.$t:
I'm not sure who needs to do what to make this happen, but it's pretty annoying that I can't open a CSV file from the ChromeOS file manager (and see bug 460714 for why this is especially annoying).

I know that Google Spreadsheets can open a CSV file from the drive web interface. How can we fix this locally?

From my perspective as the extensions team we could make the spreadsheets hosted app handle the .csv extension, but I don't think hosted apps have access to this API. It feels like a messy solution too. In theory there's registerContentHandler for the web but this isn't implemented in Chrome (and it has problems anyway).

CC'ing a bunch of people who might have thought about this or have experience in related areas.

title.$t: Ctrl+F doesn't scroll to where the found element is

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open Facebook 
2. Scroll down quite a bit and pick some unique string that occurs somewhere in the now-visible part of the page but (to make the test easier nowhere else). Let's say it's the word "foo"
3. scroll back to the top
4. Hit Ctrl+F and type the abovementioned string "foo"

What is the expected behavior?
1 occurrence is found, the page should scroll automatically until the found string is within the window, and it should be highlighted.

What went wrong?
The string is found (1 occurrence), but the page doesn't scroll. You're left to wonder where the hell the supposedly-found string is.
If you scroll down by yourself to where you already know it is, then you'll see it actually is highlighted, but that's pretty useless.

Also, on the scrollbar there is no yellow mark (those marks that usually appear indicating the points to which you have to scroll to find the highlighted items)

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

This may be related with the fact that the content in Facebook is loaded via Ajax.
Chrome actually has a lot of bugs when it comes to searching the page for text that has been loaded via ajax (no valid reason for that, though).

title.$t: fullscreen html5 video goes to the background

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Example URL:

Steps to reproduce the problem:
WARNING: not systematically reproducible. Happens randomly. Don't close this saying "unable to reproduce", because you won't be able to reproduce at will, you'll have to wait until it randomly happens.

1. scroll your facebook timeline until you see an embedded youtube video (may work also on Youtube itself or wherever you can find an embedded youtube video).
2. click on the fullscreen button

What is the expected behavior?
Do I need to describe it? The video should go fullscreen

What went wrong?
For a fraction of a second, the video goes fullscreen.
Then the video disappears completely and you see the WEB PAGE that contains it in fullscreen.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

No possible workaround. When this starts, there's no way to get it to work right, no matter how many times I switch windows, exit and reenter fullscreen.

NOTE: right now I'm observing it with a video that happens to be HTML5. I think I've seen the exact same issue on flash-based video as well, but I can't tell for sure.

May well be linux specific

title.$t: Enable HEVC support in HTML5 MSE on HEVC-enabled Android phones

content.$t:
Example URL:
http://www.dash-player.com/demo/streaming-server-and-encoder-support/?mpd=http://bitcdn-vix1.bitmovin.net/content/hevc/dashevc-live-2s.mpd

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open an HTML5 MSE enabled player with HEVC content like: http://www.dash-player.com/demo/streaming-server-and-encoder-support/?mpd=http://bitcdn-vix1.bitmovin.net/content/hevc/dashevc-live-2s.mpd
2. Check the console output

What is the expected behavior?
Playback of the HEVC content using the HTML5 Media Source Extentions (MSE) on HEVC-enabled smartphones like the nexus 5. Non-MSE playback in HTML5 works, e.g., using  http://www.bitmovin.net/hevc/720p.mp4

What went wrong?
The HTML5 MSE should decode and playback the HEVC content, just like the plain HTML5 video tag does (e.g. on a Nexus 5). 

Did this work before? No 

Is it a problem with Flash or HTML5? HTML5

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.64  Channel: stable
OS Version: 4.0
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

I want to use HEVC content on Chrome for Android on a Nexus 5 phone using MPEG-DASH and the HTML5 MSE.
•         Playing plain HEVC mp4 files in Chrome/Android/Nexus5 works fine, e.g. this one: http://www.bitmovin.net/hevc/720p.mp4  
•         But playing an HEVC DASH stream doesn't work, as the MSE doesn't support the content type: "NotSupportedError: Failed to execute 'addSourceBuffer' on 'MediaSource': The type provided ('video/mp4; codecs=hvc1.1.c.L93.90') is unsupported.". I'm using this stream: http://www.dash-player.com/demo/streaming-server-and-encoder-support/?mpd=http://bitcdn-vix1.bitmovin.net/content/hevc/dashevc-live-2s.mpd

Is the error caused by a wrong codec attribute or is the HTML5 MSE on Chrome for Android just not (yet) supporting HEVC on HEVC-enabled Android devices?

Thanks and best regards,
Stefan

@@@STEP_LOG_LINE@AudioRecorderTest.OutOfOrderRecordAndStopMultiple@[37612:1287:0220/165733:15514687304585:ERROR:data_pack.cc(78)] Failed to mmap datapack@@@

Steps to reproduce the problem:
As a developer, I'm very happy to have capability to setIcon in the declarativeContent API. However, when I add a shiny new PageAction icon, I'd like to compliment it with a shiny new title.

What is the expected behavior?
I'm developing a permissionless application where the action when the pageAction icon is clicked changes based on the content that the user is visiting.

To fully explain this content to the user, I'd like to change the title that appears when the PageAction item is hovered over.

What went wrong?
setIcon isn't a valid action in the declarativeContent API.

WebStore page: Google Chrome

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.115  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.3
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

On a related note, is there any timetable for releasing RequestContentScript to the stable channel?

title.$t: Sticky Keys produces bogus keyup/down events with arrow keys

content.$t: OS: Windows 7, X1 carbon 2014 laptop What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Enable Sticky Keys 2. Visit http://unixpapa.com/js/testkey.html 3. Press the arrow keys What is the expected output? What do you see instead? With sticky keys off, the output is: keydown keyCode=38 (&) which=38 (&) charCode=0 keyup keyCode=38 (&) which=38 (&) charCode=0 keydown keyCode=39 (') which=39 (') charCode=0 keyup keyCode=39 (') which=39 (') charCode=0 keydown keyCode=40 (() which=40 (() charCode=0 keyup keyCode=40 (() which=40 (() charCode=0 keydown keyCode=37 (%) which=37 (%) charCode=0 keyup keyCode=37 (%) which=37 (%) charCode=0 This is what I would expect to see. With sticky keys turned on, the output is: keydown keyCode=255 which=255 charCode=0 keydown keyCode=38 (&) which=38 (&) charCode=0 keyup keyCode=38 (&) which=38 (&) charCode=0 keyup keyCode=255 which=255 charCode=0 keydown keyCode=255 which=255 charCode=0 keydown keyCode=39 (') which=39 (') charCode=0 keyup keyCode=39 (') which=39 (') charCode=0 keyup keyCode=255 which=255 charCode=0 keydown keyCode=255 which=255 charCode=0 keydown keyCode=40 (() which=40 (() charCode=0 keyup keyCode=40 (() which=40 (() charCode=0 keyup keyCode=255 which=255 charCode=0 keydown keyCode=255 which=255 charCode=0 keydown keyCode=37 (%) which=37 (%) charCode=0 keyup keyCode=37 (%) which=37 (%) charCode=0 keyup keyCode=255 which=255 charCode=0 Internet Explorer has the same problem. From PPAPI, the additional events are interpreted as Shift modifiers. Google internal users, see also b/19417031.

title.$t: Rehome pnacl repositories from gerrit.chromium.org to GoB

content.$t:
Some (or all) of the following repositories are currently hosted on gerrit.chromium.org and mirrored to GoB repositories. The NaCl team wants to move to using GoB as the source of truth for the repositories.

native_client/pnacl	
native_client/pnacl-clang	
native_client/pnacl-compiler-rt	
native_client/pnacl-gcc	
native_client/pnacl-libcxx	
native_client/pnacl-libcxxabi	
native_client/pnacl-llvm	
native_client/pnacl-llvm-testsuite	
native_client/pnacl-newlib	
native_client/pnacl-subzero	

Not sure what process is doing the mirroring - it doesn't look like it's being mirrored by 'git_updater' (missing from the config): https://uberchromegw.corp.google.com/viewvc/chrome-golo/trunk/services/cron/git_updater/

Process should be something like:
1) Disable the mirroring service.
2) Update the GoB permissions on those repositories to:
- Set the owner and writers to appropriate NaCl team.

content.$t: Chrome Version: 42.0.2309.2 Chrome OS Version: 6811.0.0 Chrome OS Platform: Peppy Network info: Eth0 Summary: Enrollment fails on ChromeOS.(See screenshot) I see a 503 from the DM server. title.$t: Javascript keyboard events do not reflect sticky keys setting on Linux

content.$t: Version: 40.0.2214.111 (64-bit) OS: Linux What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Activate Sticky Keys (System Settings > Universal Access > Sticky Keys). 2. Visit http://unixpapa.com/js/testkey.html 3. Press and release Ctrl, then press and release A. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I would expect to see a keydown event for Ctrl, but no keyup event until after A is released. This is the behaviour on Windows and Mac. On Linux, the keyup event for Ctrl occurs when the Ctrl key is released. This makes it impossible for applications that rely on keyup/keydown events (such as Chrome Remote Desktop) to respect users' accessibility settings. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.
