title.$t: "Tab to search" suggestions silently fail if user puts a colon character in query

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.115 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open up a search with OpenSearch functionality (en.wikipedia.org in this example, but feel free to test other pages, too)
2. Make an OpenSearch query from the Omnibox and type in a search query containing a colon character (":"), for example "User:" or "Test:". Some of the resulting suggestions will actually contain colon characters (ex.: "User:!!" or "Test::More"). Notice that the latter suggestion contains even two colons.
3. If the character you enter after a colon is not yet another colon, the suggestion will silently fail and not be auto-completed.

What is the expected behavior?
As for en.wikipedia.org, the query "User:!" should at least result in "User:!!", "User:!!!!" and "User:!!!exosomelabguy".

What went wrong?
Instead, typing "User:!" doesn't show any of the suggestions that one could see for the query "User:". I could reproduce the same behavior with a simple test suggestion page on my website, not only on Wikipedia.

title.$t: Touch FW test erroneous error message for any device with id 0
Telemetry: Improve interface for Tab so that consumers can better respond to errors.

content.$t:
The Tab object exposes many methods such as Navigate() and EvaluateJavascript(). Consumers expect these methods to succeed, but since Tab represents a Chrome Browser Tab (or some other async entity), there is no guarantee that any API call on Tab that goes to the Browser will succeed.

Right now, Tab can throw a host of different legitimate exceptions. It is possible that there are more exceptions that I haven't found yet.
exceptions.DevtoolsTargetCrashException
devtools_http.DevToolsClientConnectionError
devtools_http.DevToolsClientUrlError
util.TimeoutException
error: [Errno 32] Broken pipe

Consumers of Tab really don't need this much granularity. Most methods on Tab should raise exactly 2 exceptions:
Tab.UnrecoverableError: The operation failed, and all future operations will fail. All future calls to Tab methods will raise Tab.UnrecoverableError.
Tab.RecoverableError: The operation failed, but future operations might succeed.

title.$t: Widevine key system should request media permission on Chrome OS unless distinctiveIdentifier="not-allowed"

content.$t:
The Widevine key system can enable a better user experience on Chrome OS if it has the media permission. When distinctiveIdentifier="not-allowed", we cannot request the permission, and when distinctiveIdentifier="required", we must request the permission.

When distinctiveIdentifier="optional", we have a choice. While we could prefer to not request the permission, the user will likely have a better experience if we do (and the user approves it). We can further refine this based on the requested codecs and robustness, but this should be the general direction, especially since we may not have all the information necessary to make such detailed decisions.

The current implementation (issue 446263) does not prompt for EME_FEATURE_REQUESTABLE_WITH_PERMISSION when distinctiveIdentifier="optional". The prompting decisions are in webencryptedmediaclient_impl.cc, but I don't think it has the necessary information from KeySystems.

title.$t: Add sequence numbers to clipboard contents

content.$t:
Remote desktop Chrome apps often have the need to determine if the clipboard contents have changed on the device running the app. Currently, they accomplish this by polling the clipboard contents and comparing them to the previously recorded contents. If the contents are large, e.g. a picture, this polling causes the device to hang. Adding sequence numbers to clipboard contents allows this polling to be extremely efficient.

We are implementing on ChromeOS only since:
(a) The feasibility of sequence numbers is unclear on other platforms, e.g. it would be difficult/impossible on Mac without Chrome doing its own inefficient clipboard polling and comparison; and...
(b) There is no other native app platform alternative on ChromeOS.

note: VO above is short for control-option.

title.$t: audioContext.currentTime and AudioParam automations repeat after 2^32 samples

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
http://aldel.com/audioparambug.html

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Load http://aldel.com/audioparambug.html
2. Leave tab open and computer awake for 27 hours and 3 minutes (or less if sample rate is more than 44100Hz)
3. Listen for beeps

Here is the relevant code from the demo page:

  var context = new AudioContext();
  var osc = context.createOscillator();
  var gain = context.createGain();
  gain.connect(context.destination);
  for (var i = 0; i <= 10; i++) {
    gain.gain.setValueAtTime(i & 1, i);
  } 
  osc.connect(gain);
  osc.start();

The page also contains code to display the expected time until the repeat. It's updated every minute, until 5 minutes are left, at which point it starts updating every second.

What is the expected behavior?
Five 1-second beeps are played when the page first loads. No more beeps should be played ever. context.currentTime should continue increasing.

What went wrong?
The beeps repeat after 4294967296 samples, due to the AudioParam automation events repeating. At a sample rate of 44100 Hz, this is a bit over 27 hours.

context.currentTime also resets to zero.

If the computer goes to sleep, the audio context is effectively paused, so the bug will appear that much later.

Did this work before? No 

Is it a problem with Flash or HTML5? HTML5

Does this work in other browsers? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

I don't know if k-rate parameters repeat. I guess they probably do, since currentTime resets.

Sorry the demo takes so long. I guess it could probably be done in an offline context, but this way was easy (though slow), and I don't want to put any more work into it.

I'm surprised that the sample counter is apparently only a 32-bit int, even on a 64-bit system. Seems like that should be easy to fix. It might still break when it gets to Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER, but I think it's better to break after 6472 years than 27 hours.

I discovered this by accident, because I left a tab open. It seems like it could easily happen to anyone.

title.$t: Add support for Flash Player Component updates on Linux

content.$t:
Add support for Chrome Linux to communicate the path of the component downloaded flash library to the zygote.

(A more precise description, and some additional considerations, courtesy of Julien)

PreloadPepperPlugins() in //content/zygote/zygote_main_linux.cc needs to load the latest retrieved version of Flash.

What should decide the behavior if can't load load it (for instance a no-exec homedir)?
- Flash is disabled (most secure)
- or do we silently fallback to the version installed alongside Chrome (insecure) and enable blocking (slightly more secure, but still dangerous)?

title.$t: High CPU on Stretched Canvas

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.115 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. create a 256x192 canvas
2. stretch it with style (canvas.style.width = window.innerWidth + "px"; canvas.style.height = window.innerHeight + "px")
3. start rendering animations to the canvas

What is the expected behavior?
normal CPU usage

What went wrong?
CPU usage goes sky-high on powerful machines, animation is sluggish on weak machines.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.115  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

stretching the canvas is vital to play full screen games without messing with inner game resolution

title.$t: Password Generation - changing password

content.$t: Feature description: Password Generation Test request option to change password. If you auto generate a password to say abc123 for twitter.com, then go to twitter.com and change your password to say xyz321, I should then be able to go and change the the password that chrome stores. I guess alternatively, a work around is to delete the old password, then create a new one? But the feature says "Password generation should not trigger in password fields on login or sign-in forms." which makes me think an option wouldn't be available unless you were in a "create new account" form, not one that is already present. Eng owner: rouslan Product owner: https://docs.google.com/a/google.com/document/d/16Mncd7z9I049gOfsoDNzvdl0gx1ekIL38UdIkQP-Yk4/edit?usp=sharing

title.$t: URLRequestContexts made by the Builder can't be deleted on named Chrome threads.

content.$t: URLRequestContexts currently always create their own file thread, so deleting them results in waiting on a thread merge.  As a result, they can't be deleted on, for example, the IO thread.  Simplest fix is to allow the consumer to pass in a file thread.

title.$t: Touch FW test validators choke when TIDs are reused

content.$t:
I ran into an Android device that used Mtb today but reuses TIDs frequently.  This broke a bunch of the validators and the plotter for the FW tests since ChromeOS doesn't do this and they were all designed assuming a unique tid->finger mapping.

We need to fix this to support this addition class of Mtb devices.  The MTA devices already take care of this by unique-ifying their TIDs in the state machine, which might be a good option here too.

Remote computer completely unresponsive to mouse/keyboard input

I noticed this after I checked the box to save my password...not sure if related.   I've tried from multiple computers, and Android client.  I've restarted remote computer.  I've tried unregistering my remote computer and registering it again.  Nothing seems to help.

title.$t: IndexedDB data loss rates increase when reusing leveldb manifests

content.$t: OS: Chrome OS What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. set options.reuse_logs = true; in leveldb_database.cc 2. Wait 10 days or so. 3. See corruption numbers slowly creep up. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? No significant increase in data loss. Log reuse is a new feature shipping in M41. error/corruption rates are flat for all platforms except CrOS.

title.$t: MSAA feature crashes chrome on windows

content.$t:
Run chrome on windows with --force-gpu-rasterization --gpu-rasterization-msaa-sample-count=4

It will crash immediately when it tries to wrap a texture using MSAA.

title.$t: video element with muted="true" reports el.muted === false before canplay event

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.94 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
http://jsfiddle.net/1fcx40a8/1/

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open dev console
2. Run jsfiddle
3. See that the first console output outputs false, the second true

What is the expected behavior?
In both cases the output should be true.

What went wrong?
Not entirely sure, possibly the video node does not handle all the node attributes correctly while the media is loading/before the media has loaded.

Did this work before? N/A 

Is it a problem with Flash or HTML5? HTML5

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.94  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.9.5
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

Both Firefox and Safari in their latest installments as of today handle this case as expected.

title.$t: WebGL conformance_uniforms_gl_uniform_bool is flakey on Win8 debug

content.$t:
Version: TOT (r167181)
OS: Win8

We're seeing intermittent failures of conformance_uniforms_gl_uniform_bool on Win8 debug.

I've attached a script that scrapes the build logs to find when this started happening (it is not in the flakiness dashboard). From the script, it looks like the first failure was at build 9005
http://build.chromium.org/p/chromium.gpu/builders/Win8%20Debug%20%28NVIDIA%29/builds/9005
The other failure there is a persistent one.

title.$t: When tests fail, output logcat dump in Cronet builder recipes

content.$t: To better understand/debug buildbot failures, we need to catch test exceptions and include logcat dumps in Cronet builder recipes.

title.$t: No Focus Wake from Sleep

content.$t: Google Chrome 42.0.2305.2 (Official Build) dev (64-bit) Revision 3aa1f92ad47b7402eacda2ade1ede4a42b92d847 Platform 6797.0.0 (Official Build) dev-channel panther Steps To Reproduce: 1. Let computer sleep. Wake it from sleep. Expected Result: A password field should have focus so that you can start typing in your password quickly. Actual Result: Nothing seems to have focus. You have to click into the text field to start typing. Not a bug perse, but it's super frustrating.

title.$t: wpa_supplicant: configure sched scan over dbus

content.$t: Add a DBus property to fi::w1::wpa_supplicant1::Interface DBus interface for configure sched scan in wpa_supplicant.

title.$t: It2Me Host doesn't send disconnect message to client after disconnects

content.$t:
1. Start an IT2me Session
2. Disconnect on the host side

Expected:
The client is disconnected with no error

Actual:
The host doesn't send a disconnect message to the client.
The client is timed out instead.

title.$t: Add subscribe support to chrome.gcm API

content.$t: We would like to add subscribe/unsubscribe API to chrome.gcm.

title.$t: freon: udev restart drops trackpad configuration

content.$t: Google Chrome 41.0.2272.58 (Official Build) beta Revision 6d9e9e1c3ecaf53f404d2e519b45c9018bd11200 Platform 6680.38.0 (Official Build) beta-channel What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Set up australian scrolling and whatnot 2. From the dev console, sudo restart udev What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Trackpad config should be maintained across udev restarts. Instead, australian scrolling and acceleration profiles are lost, and the settings have to be unset and reset (or the system rebooted) to get things back to a sane state.

title.$t: The broken encoding of non-latin text inside of combobox

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2305.3 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
chrome://settings/languages

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open chrome://settings/languages
2. Expand combobox
3. You should see that non-latin text is in broken encoding
4. The same issue happens on other sites.
Another way to reproduce the problem:
1. Go to http://www.rail.co.il/HE/DrivePlan/Pages/DrivePlan.aspx?DrivePlanPage=true&OriginStationId=3400&DestStationId=4250&OriginStationName=%D7%91%D7%99%D7%AA%20%D7%99%D7%94%D7%95%D7%A9%D7%A2&DestStationName=%D7%A4%D7%AA%D7%97%20%D7%AA%D7%A7%D7%95%D7%95%D7%94-%D7%A1%D7%92%D7%95%D7%9C%D7%94&HoursDeparture=22&MinutesDeparture=0&HoursReturn=22&MinutesReturn=0&GoingHourDeparture=true&ArrivalHourDeparture=false&GoingHourReturn=true&ArrivalHourReturn=false&IsReturn=false&GoingTrainCln=2015-02-20&ReturnningTrainCln=2015-02-20&IsFullURL=true
2. Expand the combobox of «יעד»
3. The text will be displayed correctly
4. Now, do mouse over the content of the combobox.
5. The text will become unreadable, with broken encoding.

What is the expected behavior?

What went wrong?
The non-latin text is broken. See attached screenshots.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? Yes ≈38…40

Does this work in other browsers? Yes

title.$t: Write automated integration tests to cover changes made to fix regression bug 457539

content.$t:
Write or update automated integration tests that would be able to catch the regression reported in bug 457539. Unidentified changes were made that broke forced installation of Extensions when Chrome Sync is disabled in the user's domain & organization.

Integration tests should be written as browsertests, if possible, so they can be run in Chrome builds. Otherwise, they may be written as AutoTest, so they can be run in the Chrome and Chrome OS BVT.

This request is prompted by the general policy that automated tests should be provided with fixes to regression bugs. This bug is to track development and provision of those test(s).

title.$t: Clean up "Date and time" Settings menu

content.$t:
Surfaced during analysis of "Timezone Autoupdate" launch.

We need to clean up the "Date and time" section of the Settings menu. More specifically,

* Remove the "Date and time set automatically" text.
* Always show a date and time picker.

title.$t: Implement Security Key support on Android

content.$t: Currently CRD supports Security Key only in the desktop client. It needs to be implemented for Android too.

title.$t: Write automated tests to cover changes made to fix regression bug 460199

content.$t:
Write or update automated integration tests that would be able to catch the regression reported in bug 460199. Unidentified changes were made that broke the behavior of the 'Apps' pop-up list on the Sign-in screen, when Kiosk Apps are specified in the Device policy.

Integration tests should be written as browsertests, if possible, so they can be run in Chrome builds. Otherwise, they may be written as AutoTest, so they can be run in the Chrome and Chrome OS BVT.

Tests should exercise all valid policy values. Tests should verify that:
1) When no valid Apps are specified, the Apps button does not appear.  This includes the case where App IDs are specified, but they are invalid and/or cannot be downloaded and installed.
2) When one valid App is specified. This includes the cases where a) there is one and only one App, and it is valid, and b) There are multiple Apps, but only one of them is valid.
3) When two or more valid Apps are specified. This includes the case where two or more are valid, and one or more Apps is invalid.

This request is prompted by the general policy that automated tests should be provided with fixes to regression bugs. This bug is to track provision of the necessary test(s).

title.$t: If input event is queued for more than 100ms, we end up not prioritizing it

content.$t:
If an input event sits in the queue for more than 100ms, we forget about it and don't prioritize it when the time comes to run it.

Repro: http://time.com/3703410/uma-thurman-face-red-carpet/

Attached is a trace with ToT and another one with a hack that bumps the input window to 1s.

I think we need to stay in compositor/input priority until the input event is processed. One way to implement this would be to post the policy update task to the compositor queue instead of the control queue.

title.$t: IndexedDB: Add UMA stat for size of persisted Blobs/Files

content.$t:
We have stats for overall sizes of files/blobs (bucketed by size in KB).

It'd be nice to have stats for files/blobs written to IndexedDB, and explicitly call out 0-length ones as well.

title.$t: Update Engine should verify a payload with Paycheck

content.$t:
We should have some unittest that runs against the current delta generator to make sure that paycheck can correctly verify a delta and a full from it. 

This should be run once per payload format version.

title.$t: "*" is read when entering OTP and when typing URL after connecting to VPN

content.$t: Version: <Kenneth,Version 42.0.2305.2 dev what is the frequency?> OS: <please tell me it's not XP> Chrome What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Enable ChromeVox 2. Navigate to the status bar> connect to VPN 3. Navigate to "OTP" text box and enter OTP and take note of what is read. 4. Connect/log in 5. Navigate to the address bar and enter URL and take note of what is read. What is the expected output? When entering OTP, the digits entered should be read and when URL is typed, the characters typed should be read. What do you see instead? "*" is read both for OTP and URL. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: [Crux/Cassandra] Replace all Iocrest adapters connected to stumpies and 3.4 kernel

content.$t:
From issue 460252 any device that has a 3.4 kernel should not be using the IOCrest.

Bindu - please inventory everything in Crux and Cassandra that includes these devices (APs and DUTs), add them here and assign to David to replace those IOcrest dongles with:
  - Monoprice dongles list in issue 460252
  - Cisco dongles
  - HP dongles

This means we can have mixed cells where the DUT is using IOcrest and the AP is using one of the above dongles.

title.$t: Chrome Remote Desktop - Failed to start remote access service.

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.115 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Install chrome browser.
2. Install chrome remote desktop browser extension.
3. Click continue when asked to authorize 
4. Click accept when asked if CRD can have offline access.
5. Click get started under my computers, then enable remote connections
6. Download chromeremotedesktophost.msi file click run
7. Enter pin when promted
8. Spinning wheel for enabling remote connections appears for about 5 secs, then message : "Failed to start remote access service" appears.  
9.  Click ok
10. Click refresh button on my computers and comupter name appears but is grayed out.  

What is the expected behavior?
Allow for establishing remote connections to the computer.  

What went wrong?
Remote access host service is not started.  

WebStore page: Chrome Remote Desktop

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.115  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

Hello all, I have been working on this and researching for about a week now with no luck.  

Here are some of the things I have tried / noticed.  
- Uninstalled chrome, chrome remote desktop, and extension and reinstalled all multiple times

- Noticed that the google folder, Chrome Remote Desktop Folder, host.json, or host_unprivileged.json files are not created in directory C:\ProgramData

- Chrome remote desktop service appear under local services with manual startup.  When trying to start the service I get and error message saying: "The Chrome Remote Desktop Service service on Local Computer started and then stopped".  

- gupdate service and gupdatem services are both present with automatic startup selected, both display the start and stop error message when manually started

- If I create a blank text file in the program data directory above and name host.json the CRD service will run, but remote destop connection extension still does not function.  

-When clicking sign out in the upper corner of the web extension the authorize dialog popup is displayed, click continue, and then accept from offline access.  Then brings you back to the extension and I am still signed in.  

- Java Script Console output during failure: see attached picture

title.$t: Insertion point flashes in text field even when window is not key (Mac)

content.$t: Version: 41.0.2272.42, and 42.0.2303.3 canary OS: OS X 10.9 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch the browser 2. Navigate to google.com and click in the page's search field 3. Create a new window, navigate to google.com, and click in that page's search field What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I expect the second window, which is frontmost and key, to show a flashing insertion point in the text field, and for there to be no flashing insertion point visible in the first window. What I see instead is a flashing insertion point in both windows. What's more, when I make another app the active app, I still see a flashing insertion point in both of the windows. I have 40.0.2214.115 on my machine, and this problem does not occur on that release.

title.$t: Hotrod: multiple jabra : no more audio after the device idle for overnight

content.$t: Google Chrome : 41.0.2272.65 (Official Build) beta Revision : cff2b4e5f520cd612ae84c9f242f9f1f03732fa6 Platform : 6680.43.0 (Official Build) beta-channel What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Recover the device, plug in Multiple Jabra speaker+ camera, Ctr-Alt-H to start hotrod registration & demo process, enable multiple jabra function 2. Enter CfM session 3. Under settings - click "Play test sound" - click Accessibility > Spoken feedback make sure it works fine 3. Leave it for overnight 4. The CfM is still in session next day 5. repeat step #3 What is the expected output? audio works What do you see instead? Audio is completed gone. Clicking "Play test sound" under settings nothing happened Spoken feedback does not play any sound if browser around Happened to both Tricky & Panther - rebooting the device, audio resumes. - Leave the device idle for 30 min, it still works.

title.$t: Two flags named --single_process and --single-process is too confusing

content.$t:
From the log message at the top of running most test suites:

--single_process (to run the test in one launcher/browser process) or
--single-process (to do the above, and also run Chrome in single-process mode).

This is confusing for people new to the project.

I propose we deprecate --single_process and rename it --single-process-test-launcher.

Running --single_process would exit with an error and explain the two flags.

Running a test suite with --single-process would print a warning at the top explaining the difference.

Any thoughts or objections before I submit a patch? If you have a different suggestion other than --single-process-test-launcher I'm not picky, I just want anything that doesn't differ only by underscores.

title.$t: Use Kasko to report SyzyASAN errors.

content.$t:
Kasko is a new crash reporting tool that permits the inclusion of custom data streams.

Use Kasko to upload SyzyASAN reports, including alloc/use/free event data in a protobuf encoded in a custom stream.

This will only affect SyzyASAN builds, and thus only Canary.

Initially, we will upload reports both via Kasko and Breakpad in order to verify the consistency of the two pipelines. A random client-generated report ID will be assigned to the two corresponding reports, in order to allow them to be correlated on the server side.

title.$t: Presubmit incorrectly telling me histograms don't exist

content.$t:
I'm getting the following message:
Some UMA_HISTOGRAM lines have been modified and the associated histogram name has no match in either metrics/histograms.
xml or the modifications of it:
   [chrome\browser\profiles\profile_metrics.cc:199] Profile.NumberOfManagedProfiles \
   [chrome\browser\profiles\profile_metrics.cc:201] Profile.PercentageOfManagedProfiles \
   [chrome\browser\profiles\profile_metrics.cc:203] Profile.NumberOfSignedInProfiles \
   [chrome\browser\profiles\profile_metrics.cc:205] Profile.NumberOfUnusedProfiles \
   [chrome\browser\profiles\profile_metrics.cc:207] Profile.NumberOfSignedInProfilesWithGAIAIcons \
   [chrome\browser\profiles\profile_metrics.cc:209] Profile.NumberOfProfilesWithAuthErrors

When trying to submit a change to profile_metrics.cc as part of CL https://codereview.chromium.org/943993004/. I've made no changes to the histograms, and doing a spot check of Profile.NumberOfSignedInProfiles and Profile.NumberOfUnused profiles shows they both exist in histograms.xml.

I think this code was introduced here:

title.$t: ARC: ndk signal emulation with blocking library calls

content.$t:
Asynchronous signal emulation in ndk is based currently on checking raised signals in the dispatcher loop. This means that signals can't be caught when thread enters some blocking library call (e.g. pthread_mutex_lock or
pthread_cond_wait).

The CL https://chrome-internal-review.googlesource.com/#/c/200365/
solves this issue for particular lib-calls by substituting them with non-blocking calls, which are invoked in loop with handling raised signals.

It looks like more lib-calls require such a support for signals. And this issue is to understand and track them.

title.$t: workers: Investigate using multiple isolates in each thread

content.$t:
Blink currently has support for a single v8::Isolate in a thread. For service-workers (and perhaps for other future projects, e.g. surface-worker), it may be useful to have multiple v8::Isolates in each thread. Some things to consider for this work:

 . There are a lot of uses of v8::Isolate::GetCurrent() in the blink code base (and also some in v8). So it is necessary to either remove these calls, and have each callsite keep track of the isolate themselves (or get to the relevant isolate some other way), or make sure the right Isolate is Enter()/Exit()ed at the right times. This latter approach is attempted at: https://codereview.chromium.org/926553003/

 . Multiple isolates in the same thread (and switching between them) may have performance implications (e.g. how costly is it to switch between isolates?). So this would be something to consider.

title.$t: Intranet Site Errors on Office Network when Built-In DNS is enabled, No Error when accessing from VPN.

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.115 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
Intranet Site

Steps to reproduce the problem:
[ Scenario 1 ]
1. Enable the Built-In DNS client for Chrome with a GPO policy.
2. Join the corporate network at a office location.
3. attempt to navigate to the page.
4. Get Error message “ERR_INVALID_AUTH_CREDENTIALS”.

[ Scenario 2 ]
1. Enable the Built-In DNS client from Chrome with a GPO policy.
2. Join the corporate network using VPN from a remote location.
3. attempt to navigate to the page.
4. No Error is seen.

[ Scenario 3 ]
1. Enable the Built-In DNS cleint from Chrome with a GPO policy.
2. Join the corporate network using VPN from a remote location.
3. Place the machine on Standby and travel to a Corporate Office Location.
4.Bring the machine out of Standby.
5.Join the corporate network from a office location.
6. attempt to navigate to the page.
4. No Error is seen.
5. Restart the machine.
6. attempt to navigate to the site.
7. Get error message “ERR_INVALID_AUTH_CREDENTIALS”.

What is the expected behavior?
Users should be able to get to the site on VPN and from a Corporate Office network.

What went wrong?
When users attempt to navigate to the site while on the Office Network the site will return a “ERR_INVALID_AUTH_CREDENTIALS” error.

Also see the three scenarios listed above for more details.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.115  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

This issue can be seen on Mac's and Windows Machines.  The Built-In DNS client was enabled to help resolve a latency issue with Video Hangouts, if we disable this setting the issue is resolved but we will have the latency issue with Video Hangouts again.  

One workaround is to add this site to Legacy Browser Support and have it open exclusively in IE which will resolve the issue for our windows machines, however there is no workaround for our Mac's at this time so that setting would have to be removed.

Additionally, Split Horizon DNS is not being used the VPN and the Corporate Office Networks use the same DNS.

title.$t: Consider restarting the hang monitor timeout, if necessary, when a widget is shown

content.$t:
Currently, when the RenderWidgetHostImpl is hidden, we explicitly stop the hang monitor timeout.

In practice, this prevents spurious timeouts due to backgrounding side-effects, but it can also hide real issues with an unresponsive renderer.  We should look into adding the necessary bookkeeping to restart the hang monitor, if necessary, when the widget is re-shown.

title.$t: For server experiments that assigned 100% to a single group, don't do expensive permuted entropy computation

content.$t:
For server experiments that assigned 100% to a single group, don't do expensive permuted entropy computation.

The permuted entropy calculation for experiments is a bit expensive (it's fast enough just to do it for one, but with many studies, it can add up).

We can avoid doing this work for experiments that are configured to 100% assignment to a single group, since there's no randomization actually need to determine the final result.

title.$t: Multiple TextTrack.addCue-calls does not re-insert the cue

content.$t: The spec say that addCue should remove the cue from any previous list before inserting the cue. This could cause a cue that's being re-inserted to change it's position in the list (due to insertion order of cues with the same timestamps.)

Version: Version 42.0.2309.2 canary (64-bit)
OS: Windows 10 preview

The original devices dropdown had two sections, "Mobile" and "Desktop". Now these are gone and everything is a single list.

Would it be possible to make option groups based on the existing device type in the schema? This way things are just a bit more organized and if a developer is looking to debug a type of device (not really caring exactly which) it is easier to find.

title.$t: Change the way search results are limited per-group

content.$t:
Version: 42

In Ares, now that our UI effectively allows 5 (or 6?) app results, and 5--6 other results, it doesn't make sense to limit the total number of search results to 6.

Instead, we should rework the limits so that we can actually fill up all the slots available in the UI. This isn't simple at the moment (so we can't rush it into M42) because we can't just remove all the limits and let the UI do the limiting (otherwise we may see, for example, 5 Omnibox results clobber any web store or people results).

If we change the system to purely score based (as I planned to do), then it makes sense to just remove all the limits and let the UI figure out how many to take from each category.

title.$t: Investigate why third-party VPN PNaCl modules do not work on ARM

content.$t:
PNaCl modules should work across all architectures. However, a VPN vendor reported that their PNaCl module runs into verification errors and fails to launch on ARM.

We need to investigate whether this is a PNaCl issue in general (and if so, prioritize and reassign accordingly) or something wrong with the VPN API (unlikely, as we expose a JS API and forward calls to PNaCl via standardized mechanisms).

title.$t: Wire up third-party VPNs in Chrome OS UI

content.$t:
A number of UI changes are needed for third-party VPNs. They include:

1. VPN network list in the ash tray bubble:
 a) Group networks by provider
 b) Also list providers that do not have any networks configured yet
 c) Add button to trigger an "add network" dialog for each provider
 d) Add a "disconnect" button
2. VPN network list in the settings UI:
 a) Same as 1.a - 1.c
3. VPN details dialog:
 a) Hide fields that are not relvant for third-party VPNs
 b) Make the "settings" button trigger the provider's settings UI
4. Error notifications (e.g. connection timeout):
 a) Make notifications that link to settings UI trigger the provider's UI

title.$t: Add RELEASE_ASSERTs to ScriptRunner to crash in a more controlled way?

content.$t:
We've had a couple of corner case bugs where some elaborately malicious script moving behavior will confuse ScriptRunner & upper layers. In those cases, a ScriptLoader is assocated w/ ScriptRunner SR1 whereas we expect it to be associated w/ ScriptRunner SR2. SR2 will never notice anything, the ScriptLoader is destroyed but SR1 still refers to it, and when SR1 is destroyed, it will cause a use-after-free when it tries to detach the ScriptLoader.

Bugs caused by this:

issue 427108 
issue 435596
issue 443115
issue 456059

All those were detected by failing asserts in ScriptRunner::notifyScriptLoadError & ScriptRunner::notifyScriptReady, but in the release builds we just go on and crash later.

Afaics, the bugs themselves have been there "forever" (moving scripts is implemented by https://codereview.chromium.org/496443008/ ). My refactoring ( https://codereview.chromium.org/669603002 ) made the cases fatal: now we actually do care that the ScriptLoader <-> ScriptRunner association is correct, previously we wouldn't crash if it wasn't.

I suggest we crash in a controlled way instead of use-after-free.

title.$t: Rewrite Point object move E2E test

content.$t:
Point Object move E2E test is already present in master. However, it has been commented out since it was failing randomly.

Since, the move operation involves a lot of calculations and unit conversions, sometimes there appears to be a difference of fraction of pixel in actual values and expected values. And hence, the test had become very sporadic and non-deterministic.

Moreover, the key contributor to the flakyness of this test is zoom scale which is generally a fractional number. This zoom scale is involved in calculating all the offsets and extents of the object. Due to its fractional nature we cannot fully rely on rounding the expected values. e.g. Math.round(12.51) is 13 whereas Math.round(12.49) is 12. This way, although there is difference of 0.02px we end up having difference of 1px.

A solution could be to re-write the test by having the zoom scale value as 1 so that the calculations will be simple enough and test would be more robust.

OS: ChromeOS

When user changes directory and it takes a time (since IO is busy), items in the list/grid should disappear immediately, breadcrumbs should be updated properly, and a spinner should show up.

http://jsfiddle.net/db5sju1b/

Display PASS

What went wrong?
Displays FAIL because the invalid selector does not cause an error to be thrown

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 42.0.2307.4 (Official Build) canary (64-bit)  Channel: canary
OS Version: OS X 10.9
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

Web standards violation. Selectors API level 1. http://www.w3.org/TR/selectors-api/#selector-string

Per the spec, Chrome should be throwing a SyntaxError, but instead pretends that the selector string was terminated with "]" and will return elements.

Saf 7: OK
Fx 35: OK
IE 11: FAIL
Chr 40/42: FAIL

1. Start Chrome for Android

What is the expected behavior?
Since this is not a valid URL and is treated like a search term, the scheme portion of it should not be highlighted since it appears that the user is at "http://19.3.5.337" and not Google

What went wrong?
A green lock appears and highlights the http portion of the search term

Did this work before? N/A

title.$t: Poor chroma upscaling on jpgs with force-enable gpu rasterization

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2309.2 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
http://i1292.photobucket.com/albums/b568/FireFreak111/9d4f09a0-3c59-4b20-a470-18239004796f_zpspvt5zln5.jpg

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Enable GPU-Rasterization Forced
2. Go to URL
3. Look at the Red Font in the jpg

What is the expected behavior?
Quality upscaling of the chroma in the jpg.

What went wrong?
The jpg looses any basic chroma upscaling on the red font, lowering its quality due to what appears to be nearest neighbour upscaling.
Upscaling without force-enabled gpu-rasterization is at least viewable and not so clearly aliased, despite its still poor upscaling.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? N/A 

Chrome version: 42.0.2309.2  Channel: canary
OS Version: 10.0
Flash Version: 

The image is a snapshot from the Plex web-interface, where every image with strong red color looses scaling quality with force-enabled rasterization.

Chrome should allow improved luma/chroma upscaling for images/video on higher-end GPUs.

title.$t: Option to "Always open with system viewer" for PDFs cannot be undone

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Download PDF
2. Click on arrow next to file in download bar to get additional options
3. Select "Always open with system viewer"
4. PDFs now open <b>immediately</b> after downloading in system viewer (in this case, Preview). Downloads bar does not appear after PDFs are downloaded so "Always open with system viewer" cannot be unchecked.

What is the expected behavior?

What went wrong?
Well, was I happy to see the "Always open with system viewer" option appear! I checked it and rejoiced! For about 2 seconds. Now, the downloads bar does not appear for pdfs anymore and <b>every single</b> pdf opens in Preview. I cannot uncheck "Always open with system viewer" because the downloads bar is not appearing for pdfs and so I cannot access the option at all. This is incredibly annoying as I often have to download multiple pdfs in one sitting and I have to keep switching apps back to Chrome. Please resolve this asap.

I believe what most people in the other threads previously dealing with this issue want is not for pdfs to open in the system viewer immediately after downloading, but if we choose to open a pdf by clicking it on the downloads bar, it should default to opening in the system viewer without us needing to take any extra actions like having to select "Open with system viewer". This used to be the case before Chrome PDF Viewer was made the default... can we just have this arrangement back please?

Posting here because all other threads I found relating to the addition of the "Always open with system viewer" option to the downloads bar were closed.

Did this work before? Yes Before Chrome defaulted to opening PDFs in Chrome PDF Viewer instead of system viewer

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: n/a
OS Version: OS X 10.8.5
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

title.$t: Form resubmission unconfirmed inside iframe

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.2; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Example URL:

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Create a page with a form. (Issue confirmed with post method form.)
2. Embed it inside another page with an iframe.
3. After submitting the form inside the iframe, right-click inside the iframe and select "Reload Frame".

What is the expected behavior?

What went wrong?
Chrome did not ask for confirmation to resubmit the form. Resubmitting a form in the top page causes a resubmission confirmation to be displayed. Firefox 34 provides a confirmation for either scenario.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 6.2 (Windows 8)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

title.$t: Determine whether to advertise support AVC level 5.2

content.$t:
AVC level 5.2 (0x34) is not "probably" supported by canPlayType() (it's not in mime_util.cc). This level was added later than the others.

We'd need to find out whether FFmpeg, Android, etc. support it.

title.$t: Translate this page interferes with a site's CSP settings

content.$t:
Described at https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=181602#c9

Translating a page will cause CSP violations, due to translate injecting content into that page. This seems related to Issue 181602, but perhaps Translate, as a built-in component, can do better.

title.$t: ARC: config_loader should load internal/**/config.py only when it is configured to do so.

content.$t:
The current logic is

>    internal = os.path.join(get_arc_root(), 'internal', 'mods')
>    if os.path.isdir(internal):
>      paths.append(internal)
>
>    return self.load_from_subdirectories(paths)

that runs internal/mods/**/config.py when it exists, but in reality it is
necessary only when ./configure'd with --internal-source-apks=internal.

Currently the internal config.py themselves are checking the configure
options, but ideally it has to be done in config_loader side.

This is causing trouble in a case like following:
1. ./configure --internal-apks-source=internal; [do your internal work]
2. [checkout old revision (for instance for bisecting main repo bugs)]
3. ./configure --internal-apks-source=prebuilt

At the step 3, it fails if internal/config.py is depending on the latest
change in the main repo. It is tedious to sync internal repo each time during
bisect when we don't need.

title.$t: Setup device rack

content.$t:
Let's setup our device rack so that all devices have their own power adapters.

Please:
  - Wrap a PDU around each of the four legs of the rack.
  - Place newer devices on the top shelf.
  - Place older devices on the middle shelf.
  - Place mobile devices on the bottom shelf.
  - Plug in all devices with power adapters.

David, please drop velcro wraps/bungee cords/zip ties at Aashutosh's desk and provide your wiring expertise if needed.

title.$t: UX is bad when trying to interact with tabs/url bar in presentation or full screen mode, ignores Fitts' law

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Get into presentation mode
2. Try to interact with any of the top chrome by moving your mouse to the top of the screen
3. Wait for the top chrome to open
4. Move your mouse to the back button
5. Try to click on the back button, while you are moving over to it it will move out from under you

What is the expected behavior?
Keep the top chrome in one place while the user is hovering over it

What went wrong?
when I am in presentation mode and I go to the top of the screen, e.g. because I want to change the url or click on a tab, use the back button etc, it opens up both the top chrome and the apple bar.
The bar only opens if my mouse is at the very top of the screen, placing the cursor necessarily on the apple bar. In order to interact with any top chrome I have to move my mouse to the element I want to interact with. By moving the mouse, the apple bar closes and my target element moves.
Worse, even if I have already reached the target element and am hovering over it, it may still move because the apple bar has timed out. This makes it incredibly frustrating nigh impossible to interact with any of the top chrome in presentation mode.

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: n/a
OS Version: OS X 10.9.5
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

title.$t: Unify CENC 'pssh' box parsing

content.$t:
We have several PSSH box-parsing needs. We should unify them.

* issue 456397 - Sanitizing initData, including PSSH boxes
* issue 459850 - Parsing 'cenc' initData for Clear Key
* issue 460359 - Working around Android MediaDrm plugin limitations
* issue 456399 - Work around PSSH v1+ issues in CDMs
* issue 456208 - Parsing CENC-containing BMFF containers

title.$t: Ensure media_drm_bridge.cc::GetPsshData() supports v1 and later PSSH boxes

content.$t:
There have been issues with v1 PSSH boxes (issue 456208, issue 456399). We should ensure that media_drm_bridge.cc::GetPsshData() handles it correctly.

Also, it's unclear why media_drm_bridge.cc::GetPsshData() supports the 'tenc' box. Chrome should never be passing that down.

title.$t: [Android WebView] WebRTC texture sharing broken

content.$t:
WebRTC uploads a yuv frame into 3 RED_8 or LUMINANCE_8 textures, which is supposed to shared across threads to be drawn by the parent compositor.

Apparently this sharing does not work, when mailbox syncing is turned on. Need to either figure out what's wrong and fix it, or revert the change to move renderer compositor to chrome gpu thread again.

title.$t: Write client-side automated integration tests for new and updated RemoteAccessHost* policies.

content.$t:
CL https://codereview.chromium.org/820133002 added 5 new policies:
- RemoteAccessHostMatchUsername
- RemoteAccessHostTokenUrl
- RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationUrl
- RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationCertificateIssuer
- RemoteAccessHostDebugOverridePolicies

and updated 8 existing policies to apply to Chrome OS:
- RemoteAccessHostFirewallTraversal
- RemoteAccessHostDomain
- RemoteAccessHostTalkGadgetPrefix
- RemoteAccessHostRequireCurtain
- RemoteAccessHostAllowClientPairing
- RemoteAccessHostAllowGnubbyAuth
- RemoteAccessHostAllowRelayedConnection
- RemoteAccessHostUdpPortRange

Write automated integration tests for these 5 new and 8 updated policies.

An integration test goes beyond a unit test in that it exercises all significant interactions between related units of code, to verify that the Chrome UI appears correct, and the browser functions/behaves correctly, regardless of changes that may later be made at the unit-level. Integration tests should be implemented in a way that obviates the need for most (if not all) manual functional testing.

If possible, write integration tests as browsertests so they can be run on the Chrome buildbots. If that's not possible, a broad set of unittests for all directly interacting units may provide adequate coverage.

The tests should exercise RemoteAccessHost* policys with a reasonable range of valid and/or invalid (error inducing) values. Exercise boolean policies with all valid values: true,  false, and unspecified (i.e., not set). Exercise string policies with not set, set null (i.e., blank), and a reasonable set of realistic non-null values.  Exercise integer values (e.g., RemoteAccessHostUdpPortRange) with a range of realistic values, including not set and blank.

If possible each policy should be tested in concert with any other related policies and values for which there are inter-dependencies (if any).

These tests should be implemented and running well on all valid platforms: Windows, Linux, Macintosh, and Chrome OS.

title.$t: Change the multi-machine framework to use isolate.py archive hashes rather than use isolate files

content.$t: The task controller shouldn't be using an isolate file to create a new task. It should be using the hash of a previous call to isolate.py archive instead.

title.$t: Need to expose bookmark order translation logic to bookmark change processor

content.$t:
Ordinal to absolute index translation happens low level at the directory layer. In order to allow the bookmark glue code to make its own positioning decisions (and also to support supplementary positioning decisions), we should try to move as much of this logic up and out into the glue layer.

I imagine something along the lines of replacing the BaseNode::GetPositionIndex with a GetPositionOrdinal might do the trick, and letting the change processor/model associator then maintain it's own ordered set.

Stan, could you take a look at this? Not super pressing, but would be good to get for M43. For reference, bookmarks are soon going to be syncing around multiple position ordinals within the specifics themselves, so ideally that logic should all be shared and performed at the change processor layer.

title.$t: net::IsLocalhost should allow queries to contain trailing dot

content.$t:
`net::IsLocalhost("localhost.")` will currently return false, but the trailing dot should probably be a valid query (indicating no suffix search).

See https://codereview.chromium.org/938093003/diff/20001/net/base/net_util.cc#newcode1021 for more context.

title.$t: network_WiFi_IBSS failed with wpa_supplicant 2.3

content.$t:
With wpa_supplicant updated to version 2.3, network_WiFi_IBSS test is failing on both marvell (daisy) and broadcom (veyron_jerry) devices. The root cause is due to wpa_supplicant failed to register auth frames to bss nl_mgmt socket on those devices, most likely not supported on those drivers:
2015-02-19T15:52:55.172215-08:00 DEBUG wpa_supplicant[26103]: nl80211: Subscribe to mgmt frames with non-AP handle 0xb782b760
2015-02-19T15:52:55.172290-08:00 DEBUG wpa_supplicant[26103]: nl80211: Register frame type=0xb0 (WLAN_FC_STYPE_AUTH) nl_handle=0xb782b760 match=
2015-02-19T15:52:55.172303-08:00 DEBUG wpa_supplicant[26103]: nl80211: Register frame command failed (type=176): ret=-22 (Invalid argument)

For reference, the older wpa_supplicant doesn't register auth frames.

title.$t: Cast should use number of buffers requested by external codec, not a hardcoded constant

content.$t:
Cast code seems to be using a hardcoded input count instead of the input buffer count requested by the external encoder:

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/media/cast/sender/external_video_encoder.cc&l=158.

title.$t: Chrome OS on freon: desktop wallpaper flashing with external display

content.$t: It looks like one of the 2 swap buffers allocated for the external display is initialized black. So during initial login there is visible flashing when we swap buffers between the "good" one and the partially uninitialized buffer. The corruption eventually goes away after moving a window around to damage all of the uninitialized area.

Click on time box to open layers panel for that trace. 3. Look at the compositing reasons. What is wrong? As a pretty average developer, the compositing reasons have very little direct meaning. What can be done to improve? A couple off-the-cuff ideas: 1) Create a documentation page listing the different compositing reasons and link to it within here. That way developers can go to learn more about what the reasons mean and what causes them. 2) Show the developer what CSS rules or JS interaction is causing the layering. Please use labels and text to provide additional information. In the attached image I've highlighted the compositing reasons area I'm describing.

title.$t: Google Chrome Interface (tabs, address bar, etc.) still uses Lucida Grande on Yosemite.

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_2) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.64 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
Not sure how the problem started, I noticed that ever since updating to the Yosemite Public Beta and all the way until now on the Public Release of Yosemite 10.10.2, Google Chrome still uses Lucida Grande instead of Helvetica Neue.

What is the expected behavior?
Google Chrome should be using Helvetica Neue as the UI font like the rest of the Yosemite UI.

What went wrong?
On OS X Yosemite, Google Chrome still uses Lucida Grande instead of Helvetica Neue. However, right-click menus and the Settings/History/Extensions page still use Helvetica.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.64  Channel: beta
OS Version: OS X 10.10.2
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

I've seen numerous screenshots of other users on Chrome for Yosemite with interfaces that correctly use Helvetica Neue on both Retina and non-Retina screens. I have once seen a MacRumors Forum post with someone bringing up the same issue as me, but on a more recent search I can't find that post anymore.

Hover over boxes under the frames view with a time within them. What is the expected output? I expect to see a tooltip indicating that clicking this will open the Layers panel. What do you see instead? No indicator as to what will happen. Please use labels and text to provide additional information. The blue circle in the attached image shows the box I want to see improved.

title.$t: Write client-side automated integration tests for EnableDeprecatedWebBasedSignin policy

content.$t:
Write automated integration tests for the EnableDeprecatedWebBasedSignin user policy, which would catch failures like the one reported in bug 457625 (per CL https://codereview.chromium.org/922253002/).

An integration test goes beyond a unit test in that it exercises all significant interactions between related units of code, to verify that the Chrome UI appears correct, and the browser functions/behaves correctly, regardless of changes that may later be made at the unit-level. Integration tests should be implemented in a way that obviates the need for most (if not all) manual functional testing.

If possible, write integration tests as browsertests so they can be run on the Chrome buildbots. If that's not possible, a broad set of unittests for all directly interacting units may provide adequate coverage.

The tests should exercise EnableDeprecatedWebBasedSignin property values = true and false, and unspecified (i.e., not set). If possible this policy should be tested in concert with any other related policies and values for which there are inter-dependencies (if any)

These tests should be implemented and running well on the Windows, Linux, and Macintosh platform.

title.$t: Security: Hang all tabs in Chrome using pushState

content.$t: VULNERABILITY DETAILS Using pushState in an infinite loop that navigates to two urls makes all tabs unresponsive (ie. you can navigate to a tab but you will see a blank screen). It is impossible to close the tab with "X" icon or keyboard shortcuts, or Chrome's task manager. It also is impossible to quit Chrome with Cmd+Q. (Only SIGKILL works). VERSION Chrome Version: 40.0.2214.115 (64-bit) stable Operating System: OSX Yosemite 10.10.2 REPRODUCTION CASE Go to a URL that serves the following html. <html> <head> <script type="text/javascript"> while(true) { history.pushState({}, '', '/a'); history.pushState({}, '', '/b'); } </script> </head> <body> </body> </html>

title.$t: PPB_VideoDecoder API may generate frames with invalid texture_size

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Feed a video stream that changes frame size in the middle to PPB_VideoDecode API. Generated PP_VideoPicture don't always contain correct texture_size. Some of them will still have old texture_size. The underlying textures are resized correctly. It's only texture_size field is not set correctly.

title.$t: workers: WorkerThread should be responsible for managing the v8::Isolate*

content.$t: As of now, the WorkerScriptController is responsible for managing the v8::Isolate. Moving the responsibility to WorkerThread instead would allow exploring uiworkers, and also with multiple workers sharing a single isolate in a thread, or each having separate isolates.

title.$t: Need a way to use a local app in kiosk mode

content.$t: For testing ARC apps (but potentially other use cases as well), it would be nice to specify a local app location with a command line and launch in kiosk mode with that app, similar to --load-extension.

title.$t: Plugin poster param metric needed

content.$t:
We should measure how often a plugin has a poster param, to watch utilization in the wild.

We should also split this by "using DETECT"/"not using DETECT" so we will find out if there is a noticeable population of plugins that somehow use the param mechanism for their own purposes.

title.$t: Tracking bug to restrict False Start to ECDHE only

content.$t:
Many servers negotiate DHE at 1024-bits (or less!)

We should consider restricting false start to only ECDHE suites. Mozilla already does this (c.f. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=952863 )

title.$t: Gtest GPU Unittests fail when running too many at a time

content.$t:
Attached is the output from our test runner (with a modified run to run tests within a certain range, shrinking until the tests do not fail; this should hopefully make it in soon. https://codereview.chromium.org/919713003/ run with:

build/android/test_runner.py gtest -s gpu_unittests --enable-platform-mode -e local --debug-range-begin GLES2FormatTest.VertexAttrib1f --debug-range-end VertexAttribManagerTest.Enable"

when it lands) and the logcat.

This seems to be the line from the logcat that is causing the crash.
F/chromium(  730): [FATAL:thread_local_storage.cc(210)] Check failed: slot_ < kThreadLocalStorageSize (256 vs. 256)
...
E/chromium(27669): [ERROR:test_suite.cc(246)] Currently running: VertexAttribManagerTest.Basic


From an email thread on this topic:

Some needed cleanup logic is not being run. Some part of the system is allocating thread local storage slots (probably for storing Chrome's notion of the current GL context) and not deallocating them. If  you're re-running the tests in the same process then something's wrong with the test harness -- it isn't providing the right setup/teardown abstractions.

title.$t: ARC: open() requires a NDK translation thunk

content.$t:
Repro steps:

1) call open(file, O_RDONLY | O_DIRECTORY) in a ARM NDK binary

Expected:

posix_translation's __wrap_open is called with O_RDONLY | O_DIRECTORY.

Actual:

posix_translation's __wrap_open is called with O_RDONLY | O_DIRECT.


Looks like we need a thunk for open(). I'm adding it.

title.$t: Data race on ChannelMojoHost::ChannelDelegate::ToWeakPtr()

content.$t:
The WeakPtrFactory inside a ChannelMojoHost::ChannelDelegate is getting used from both the main thread and the IO thread. The comment at https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch/#chromium/src/ipc/mojo/ipc_channel_mojo_host.cc&l=16 says the race is the fault of the main-thread call.

http://build.chromium.org/p/chromium.memory.fyi/builders/Linux%20TSan%20Tests/builds/45/steps/content_browsertests/logs/stdio
WARNING: ThreadSanitizer: data race (pid=23283)
Read of size 8 at 0x7d0c00026630 by main thread:

https://feedback.corp.google.com/#/Report/2497385542

title.$t: IndexedDB: Deleting a non-existent database does lots of extra work

content.$t:
Calling deleteDatabase() on a nonexistent database in a origin with no existing backing store results in multiple transactions which need to hit disk:

#1: IndexedDBBackingStore::OpenBackingStore
    => IndexedDBBackingStore::SetUpMetadata

^^^ We could early-exit if the backing store does not already exist.

#2: IndexedDBFactoryImpl::DeleteDatabase
    => IndexedDBDatabase::Create
    => IndexedDBBackingStore::CreateIDBDatabaseMetaData

^^^ We could early-exit here too...

#3: IndexedDBFactoryImpl::DeleteDatabase
    => IndexedDBDatabase::DeleteDatabase
    => IndexedDBBackingStore::DeleteDatabase

^^^ Since we then immediately delete it all here.

It seems like we could early-exit before #1 and #2.

title.$t: chrome.platformKeys API: Add a policy to allow certificate usage by extension if the user is managed.

Currently, platformKeys is effectively disabled for managed users.
As described in the design doc, a policy is required that allows the administrator to explicitly allow usage of certificates by extensions. This must not happen by default without consent of the admin.

title.$t: Convert LayoutObject::style() to return a reference

content.$t:
LayoutObject::style() is almost always never NULL and thus we should make the default be to return a reference. 

There is only a small window of opportunity for it to be NULL: between the LayoutObject creation and the first call to LayoutObject::setStyle. It should be easy to document where the LayoutStyle is expected to be NULL.

title.$t: SSLClientCertificateSelector should prevent Accept being signaled twice

content.$t:
Filing this to track the issue from this comment:

https://codereview.chromium.org/932553002/diff/170001/chrome/browser/ui/views/ssl_client_certificate_selector.cc#newcode65

The original comment was in the context of overriding a method, but the issue with DialogDelegate::Accept being called twice is in the original code:

----

This interaction with CertificateSelector::Accept() returning true is very
confusing. If we need to be able to change that, perhaps the callback should
return true/false.

Although, I'm kind of dubious of this logic to begin with. In the non-USE_NSS
case, we're re-entrantly calling Close() inside a DialogDelegate's Accept hook.
What if we select a second certificate or close the tab while
chrome::UnlockCertSlotIfNecessary is doing its thing? (I could believe the
dialog is such that this is impossible, but this is still quite fragile.)

Perhaps the dialog should close immediately and then we
chrome::UnlockCertSlotIfNecessary asynchronously before reporting back to the
callback.

Or if we really want the dialog to say open, maybe CertificateSelector tracks a
boolean for whether it's signaled anything already. If yes, even if the Accept
callback returns true, we don't signal anything else. Which means that boolean
means something slightly different on DialogDelegate and CertificateSelector. On
DialogDelegate, false means, "don't close the dialog; also I haven't accepted
this Accept(), so we can try hitting OK again". On CertificateSelector, it means
"I have accepted this Accept() but want to keep the dialog open for some reason;
don't signal me again. I'll call Close on my own later".

The first option seems simpler, though it is a slight behavior change on the UI.

title.$t: Layout metrics's AddResults implementation should not ignore timeline interaction records

content.$t:
Currently, layout metric's implementation is ignoring the timeline interaction records and compute metrics on the full range.

It should instead compute metrics for the record range only, and be migrated to TimelineBasedMeasurement instead of the ThreadTimes measurement.

title.$t: scroll-blocks-on: scroll-event doesn't affect panning during pinch

content.$t:
Load a test page like http://rbyers.net/scroll-blocks-on.html and add some synthetic jank.  Note that with 'scroll-event' enabled the red box stays perfectly lined up with the green bar.  Now pinch zoom and pan around with 2 fingers.  The box jitters around relative to the green bar, indicating that we're handling the GSU events on the impl thread, not synchronized with the scroll events being handled by JS.

It looks like there's also some bug where we can go for an extended period of time without dispatching a scroll event to JS (sometimes the box stays in the wrong spot indefinitely until I lift my fingers).

So in 'scroll-blocks-on: scroll-event' mode we should either:
1) process the pinch-update events on impl but forward the scroll-update events to main.  Or:
2) send both pinch and scroll update events to main and have main update the page scale

bokan, aelias - any preference which?

title.$t: IndexedDB: Replace two transactions on database creation with one

content.$t:
When a database is first opened, a leveldb transaction is used to initialize the metadata - IndexedDBDatabase::OpenInternal calls IndexedDBBackingStore::CreateIDBDatabaseMetaData. This transaction is committed immediately. Then the upgrade sequence is run, which creates another transaction, eventually committed.

This has the side effect that if the upgrade is aborted, the metadata is persisted on disk (see issue 395472) and must be ignored. It also means two potentially slow flushes of data to disk, which is a performance issue.

Ideally, we'd do something clever like re-use the transaction during the upgrade process, so if it aborts we don't write anything to disk.

One wrinkle: the creation process needs to allocate a new database ID. That needs to write to disk so that if two "opens" are occurring simultaneously they get correct/unique ids.

title.$t: Cull Rects are wrong for Slimming Paint

content.$t:
With Slimming Paint enabled ...

And SkRTree enabled (not yet landed in any form) ...

Text disappears or is clipped.

The cullRect associated with the SkPicture is incorrect. Verified on fast/block/float/clamped-right-float.html.

The cullRect is (-3603,8,294,17) when the bound of the text (in the SkPicture) is (-9,-16,321,4.9) positioned at (1103,22).

It would be excellent to be able to use the SkPicture bounds machinery to generate good bounds, but that does not correctly handle several important cases, such as filters and infinite bound drawing operations. The latter in particular is a problem because the bound is defined by the canvas size.

title.$t: Make chromevox_tests work with desktop automation API

content.$t:
In order to make some progress on ChromeVox Next (which is currently not enabled by default), some of the tests specific to CV Next were changed to MANUAL. The change utilizes the new chrome automation desktop API which introduces some latency. Unfortunately, this causes the tests to become flakey.

This bug will track work to:
- figure out why the tests timeout on buildbots but not on try bots (or locally).
- make necessary fixes so that performance of the desktop automatio API matches that of the tabs automation API.

title.$t: Broken `in` with Array.prototype and number vs string

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2308.0 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
Two snippets:

------
var a = ["a","b","c","d"];
(3 in a);    // true
("3" in a);  // true
------

------
Array.prototype.push("a","b","c","d");
var a = [];
(3 in a);     // false  <-- wtf?
("3" in a);   // true
------

What is the expected behavior?
The `in` operator should work the same with 3 and "3", regardless if searching the array/object itself, or something up the [[Prototype]] chain.

What went wrong?
`(3 in a)` breaks searching up the `[[Prototype]]` chain to `Array.prototype`

Did this work before? Yes Chrome 40 (at least)

Chrome version: 42.0.2308.0  Channel: n/a
OS Version: OS X 10.8.5
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

This wasn't present in Chrome 40, so it's a "recent" bug. Also not present in any tested version of FF. Confirmed with @awbjs that it's a bug, not an ES6 spec change.

**note:** node 0.10 has the older v8, so doesn't have this bug. iojs has the newer v8, and does have this bug. :(

title.$t: Unify networkingPrivate test expectations

content.$t:
Currently we maintain separate test expectations for the Chrome OS and win/mac (ServiceClient) implementations of networkingPrivate.

In order to unify these test expectations we need to do the following:

1 Fully implement the service_client API
  a Add structural support for networks beyond wifi (even if they will never be available on the platform)
  b Implement filters for GetNetworks

2 Modify the tests to use a data driven set of test network properties to populate the "fake" implementations on each platform.

title.$t: Honor @page margins on a paged overflow viewport overflow, and don't apply column-gap

content.$t:
-webkit-column-gap is a multicol property, and it's wrong to apply it for paged overflow (overflow:-webkit-paged-[xy]), but we still do apply it, assumedly because the paged overflow implementation sits on top of the multicol implementation.

Also, sadly enough, it kind of serves a purpose if you paginate the viewport. If you want some gap between the pages, column-gap comes in handy. If you paginate a regular block (e.g. a DIV), on the other hand, you can already achieve this by setting padding on the paged container.

We should honor @page margins when paged overflow is used on the viewport, and only allow column-gap when used on multicol containers.

title.$t: Chrome should lower the priority of renderers for tabs that aren't visible on Mac

content.$t:
Related to issue http://crbug.com/458594

I believe it's a matter of adding Mac-specific code to the method RenderProcessHostImpl::SetBackgrounded in content/browser/renderer_host/render_process_host_impl.cc.

title.$t: Translations for block_devmode error page in recovery installer are missing

content.$t: Issue 375775 added a new error screen to the recovery installer. Translations are still missing and need to be added. I've started an email thread to get the strings translated.

title.$t: Deprecate and (eventually remove) the webkit-prefixed properties of the Touch interface

content.$t:
We previously unprefixed radiusX, radiusY and force (based on the TouchEvent extensions note here: http://rawgit.com/w3c/touch-events/master/touchevents.html).

Left to do is:

1) unprefix rotationAngle
I originally had some concerns about usefulness (originally planning on removing it), but it's now working well on hardware that supports it (like Nexus 10) so I think we should unprefix instead.

2) deprecate webkitRadiusX, webkitRadiusY, webkitForce and webkitRotationAngle
Use counter is right at 0.03% so we should probably have a release or two with a deprecation warning before we outright remove these.

3) Remove the webkit prefixed properties
I think the web compat risk here is relatively low - few things make use of radius/force/rotation and those that do but don't update to the unprefixed fields should just fallback to behavior designed for other browsers that don't support these properties.

title.$t: Canceling CVC prompt should return user back to former state

content.$t: When a user cancels the CVC prompt (or fails CVC auth too many times), they should be returned back to the state from which they entered the prompt (i.e. form field focused, keyboard displayed, and autofill options presented).

title.$t: Endless memory consumption of "New Tab page" - maybe deeper problem with leaking content?

content.$t:
Starting a new tab page consumes easily 70MB (which seems like a lot).

However...

After 5 minutes of inactivity it goes up to 140MB (without playing the doodle flash video, and this is not linear). Waiting longer (~30 minutes) even rises it more to 170MB.

And then...

Open a new browser (keep the browser with the new tab open) and create in the new browser in short succession 5 new tabs and search in each of them quickly for things like 'aaa', 'bbb', 'ccc', .. thus navigating away. Looking now at the NewTab page memory consumption shows 340MB(!!) and it stays there. Repeating this with 3 more tabs rises it even to 390MB. And again - it stays there (roughly).

This looks like multiple problems.
1. Each new tab shares the new tab renderer - but adds its memory to it. When it navigates away, it does not release the memory which it has allocated there.
2. There must be also a memory leak since the memory consumption goes up over time (but this is not linear).

Note: I tried this earlier - without a flash doodle - and have seen a similar behavior. So this cannot be only the fault from flash.

title.$t: Web Notifications: Support setPriority() on Android

content.$t:
Android allows an app to assign a priority level to its notifications. 

Priority is an indication of how much of the user's valuable attention should be consumed by the notification. Low-priority notifications may be hidden from the user in certain situations, while the user might be interrupted for a higher-priority notification.

Acceptable values range from PRIORITY_MIN (-2) to PRIORITY_MAX (2).

See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/notifiers/notifications.html#metadata for more info.

title.$t: Web Notifications: Support setCategory() on Android

content.$t:
Android allows an app to assign a category to its notifications, which tells the system how to handle them when the device is in Priority mode (e.g. if the notification represents an incoming call, instant message, or alarm).

The following categories are supported:
CATEGORY_CALL
CATEGORY_EMAIL
CATEGORY_ERROR
CATEGORY_EVENT
CATEGORY_MESSAGE
CATEGORY_PROGRESS
CATEGORY_PROMO
CATEGORY_RECOMMENDATION
CATEGORY_SERVICE
CATEGORY_SOCIAL
CATEGORY_STATUS
CATEGORY_SYSTEM
CATEGORY_TRANSPORT

See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/notifiers/notifications.html#metadata for more info.

title.$t: Merge main thread strips on timeline overview

content.$t:
The problem:

There are three strips corresponding the main renderer thread: loading, scripting and layout/painting.
When an HTML parse event causes a long script execution, the event is shown as a wide bar on the overview, while in reality it doesn't take time. All the time was spent in the scripting.

Another example is a javascript that causes layout. The javascipt will also be shown as consuming time.

Solution is to merge all these strips into one and show only the top level activity.

title.$t: Mobile emulation UA uses obsolete Chrome version number

content.$t:
Version: 41.0.2272.58 (Official Build) beta
OS: ChromeOS

When I enable mobile emulation for a Nexus 4 or 5, it uses a User-Agent string reporting to be Chrome 18.  Nexus 7 uses Chrome 29, and Samsung Galaxy S4 uses Chrome 31.

This inconsistency is surprising and occasionally causes problems.  Eg. an engineer on the Google image search team told me they need to avoid emulating Nexus 5 because it triggers some fallback logic they have for bugs/limitations in Chrome 18.

Can we do something smarter here?  Eg. When emulating an Android device (where we're presumably still pretending to be Chrome) can we always use the actual Chrome version number rather than some hard coded value that will become obsolete?

title.$t: Allow scrolls on unscrollable pages to hide top controls

content.$t:
Currently, when a page has no scrolling (e.g. about:blank), the user can't hide the top controls. Well, they can, but they have to pinch in (if the page allows it), hide it, then pinch out.

There's cases when the user may want to hide the bar as it distracts from the content so we should allow this.

title.$t: Investigate changing linebreaking rules around replaced elements

content.$t:
The CSSWG wants to change linebreaking rules around replaced elements in general and <img> in particular to act like a ID-class character [1], so that e.g. a linebreak after is prevented when the next character is ")". This is believed to match Presto, but it is still possible that it can break Web pages. In particular, many pages use &nbsp; around <img> or <input> and may still expect a linebreak. [2][3]

So the proposal, as I understand it, is to add a new rule to UAX14, before LB12:

<replaced element> ÷ <NBSP>
<NBSP> ÷ <replaced element>

i.e. a linebreak is allowed between a replaced element and U+00A0.

We should investigate Web compat here. Maybe adding use counters. I don't have a concrete suggestion, but I think BreakingContext::handleReplaced() in LineBreaker.cpp is relevant. (There's a quirks mode thing here also but I think it shouldn't be affected. [4])

[1] http://www.w3.org/mid/54C69CCC.1030302@inkedblade.net
[2] https://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-style/2013Nov/0136.html
[3] http://logs.csswg.org/irc.w3.org/css/2015-02-08/#e520402
[4] https://quirks.spec.whatwg.org/#the-table-cell-width-calculation-quirk
