title.$t: --icf=safe affects sanitizers' report correctness

content.$t:
By default Chrome builds with --icf=safe, which allows the linker to merge identical constructors, destructors and non-address-taken functions.
These folded functions share their symbolic names and debug info (which don't necessarily match), so some of the stack traces containing one of the functions may end up having wrong names or file:line info.

As a countermeasure I propose linking sanitizer builds with --icf=none.

For the reference, the size of content_browsertests built with --icf=safe is 293567160 bytes, with --icf=none - 300716776 bytes, so the size will grow up for ~2.5%.

title.$t: ARC: L-rebase: enable boot image

content.$t:
Now boot image and AOT are supported only on Bare Metal ARM, and disabled on others.
AOT needs NaClization of codegen, and enabling it may be a little tough.
But boot image should work without AOT support and will speed up boot time drastically.

For now, HelloAndroid crashes if AOT is enabled on other platforms.
The problem is that the boot image also contains JNI methods with generated trampolines.
The trampolines are generated by art/compiler/trampolines/trampoline_comiler.cc.
Porting this to other platforms seems not difficult.

Launch Chrome and go to https://www.google.com/calendar 2. Sign in with valid credentials and click on 'Print' from More options. (Separate calendar print preview dialog will open) 3. Now end the process for Tab:Calendar Print Preview from task manager and try to reload that print preview by clicking on Reload button or pressing Ctrl+R, observe. Calendar Print Preview tab does not get reloaded once the process is killed from task manager. Calendar Print Preview tab should get reloaded once the process is killed from task manager. This is a non regression issue seen from M-20 (build no. 20.0.1132.57). Note: Issue is reproducible on latest canary chrome version: 42.0.2308.0 (Official Build) as well.

title.$t: Date and Time for Chrome OS shouldn't highlight the search

content.$t: Version: 42.0.2305.2 dev OS: Chrome OS What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Click the time in the bottom right of the home screen 2. Click the date on the bottom left of the popup 3. A Date and time window opens What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I expect a date and time window to come up with options to edit any settings with the date and time. The window has a few UI issues: 1. The title of the window is Search Results. This should be Date & Time. 2. There is random yellow highlights on the page. I realise this is the result of a search after someone else pointed it out to me 3. The search box is now useless for searching inside this page - i.e. you can't search with date and time because it's got content and changing things will rip me out of this "date and time context" and just into settings - it's weird. 4. Why does the UI only use a fraction of the width of the window? Also - is a drop down the friendliest way to select timezone on a chrome book? It feels like a map would be easier / friendlier.

title.$t: Glimpse of 'Scrollbar' is seen on 'Confirm New App' overlay while adding 'Chrome remote desktop' app

content.$t: Chrome Version : 41.0.2272.64 (Official Build) Revision 6d8fba54922d3ac39a2ac0798e27168b55f89014-refs/branch-heads/2272@{#330} - 64 bit OS : Mac What steps will reproduce the problem? 1) Launch chrome, navigate to 'https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/chrome-remote-desktop/gbchcmhmhahfdphkhkmpfmihenigjmpp?utm_source=chrome-ntp-icon' to install 'Chrome remote desktop' app. 2) Click on 'Add To Chrome', it will open 'Confirm New App' overlay, click on 'Show Details' and then 'Hide Details' several time and observe. What is the expected result? Glimpse of 'Scrollbar' should not be seen on 'Confirm New App' overlay, while switching between the 'Show Details' and 'Hide Details' link. What happens instead? Glimpse of 'Scrollbar' is seen on 'Confirm New App' overlay, while switching between the 'Show Details' and then 'Hide Details' link. This is a non regression issue, seen from M-31 series i.e. Chrome version - 31.0.1610.4 Note: Issue is not reproducible on other OS. i.e Working fine on Windows and Linux OS.

Note: Issue is more prominently observed on Mac OS.

title.$t: ARC: Tests in some suite runners are ran in an arbitrary order

content.$t:
Since not all suite runners call apply_test_ordering, tests in some suites (e.g. arc.sdktest) are ran in the order of dict.iteritems(), which is Python implementation dependent.
Test order should not affect the result of suite runner, but it would be better to call apply_test_ordering for all suites. Otherwise test order changes in an unpredictable way when new tests are added.

title.$t: Chrome doesn't validate hidden, required number fields correctly

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
http://run.plnkr.co/plunks/O7rNe0dQDrwi2NCmp43b/

Steps to reproduce the problem:
There are two forms on the page, each with their own heading, and separated by an `hr`. The first will fail these steps in Chrome, but work in Firefox and Safari; the second will work in all.

1. Select the Other option for the type field.
2. Enter an invalid value. For example, append the letter 'x' to the end.
3. Select a different option for the type field. (They just set the amount to the option selected.)
4. Click the submit button.

What is the expected behavior?
The form information definition list shows that the value of the amount field is the same as the option selected, that the amount field is valid, and there are no errors in the console.

What went wrong?
In Chrome, for the first form, this message is shown in the console:
An invalid form control with name='hidden-element-amount' is not focusable

This is despite the input element's `ValidityState` showing the element's value as valid.

If the form submission was not overridden by the submit handler on the form, the form would fail to submit.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.9.5
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

You can edit the Plunker at http://plnkr.co/edit/O7rNe0dQDrwi2NCmp43b

title.$t: Render embedded options pages offscreen with correct CSS media view-mode

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2292.0 Safari/537.36 OPR/29.0.1780.0 (Edition developer)

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. have an extension with a responsive options page
2. add a CSS max-width property for html tag

What is the expected behavior?

What went wrong?
According to developer resources, devs should "provide fixed minimum dimensions for the options page to ensure that the dialogue will find an appropriate size".
That's no solution. I want it to work no matter which size the window currently is. That's what responsive design is for!
My options page has multiple @media rules. In 2015 you shouldn't force devs to hardcode dimensions. Make sure responsive options pages look good.

Suggestion:
instead of only taking CSS width property into account when autosizing embedded page and displaying a thin strip if it isn't found, also look for a max-width property.

Solution A:
If only max-width is present, make embedded options page display as a percentage (e.g. 80%? you should determine what looks best) up to max-width

Solution B:
add a "width" parameter to "options_ui" in manifest that takes absolute as well as relative values and use that for <extensionoptions>'s width. max-width needs to be respected in addition. This solution is more flexible as devs can specify percentage of extension page's width.

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: 42.0.2292.0  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 10.0
Flash Version:

title.$t: DevTools: reimplement InjectedScriptSource.js in C++

content.$t: Most of InjectedScript is currently implemented in JavaScript (InjectedScriptSource.js) which calls into some custom bindings (InjectedScriptHost.idl). Also the script does it best to avoid failures due to calls of standard methods overwritten by inspected script (e.g. Arrray.prototype.push). All of that would be easier to implement in C++ and get rid of the custom bindings.

title.$t: ARC: L-Rebase: Unclassified failures in cts.CtsMediaTestCases

content.$t:
cts.CtsMediaTestCases has many unclassified test failures.

For classified failures in the test suite, see Issue 459915, Issue 459914, Issue 459912, Issue 459910, and Issue 449057.

Please search source code with the bug number to see the list of affected cases.

title.$t: Migrate Blink's time stamps from double to base::Time

content.$t:
Blink uses double for time stamps, e.g. in blink::currentTime(). Chromium however uses base::Time, which is based on int64. When passing time stamps between Blink and Chromium, converting between those two representations is not lossless, which can cause bugs such as issue 453298.

Ideally we would replace all occurrences of double time stamps in blink by base::Time, but that will have to wait until Blink has been merged into the Chromium repository.

title.$t: toolkit-views menu/popup buttons do not toggle consistently (or properly in some cases)

content.$t:
These menu/popup buttons all behave differently:
 - Hotdog menu
 - Bookmark Folders in the toolbar
 - browser action popups
 - App Launcher icon in ChromeOS
 - "Tray" buttons in ChromeOS (e.g. notification center/now, and the device management menu. 

Hotdog menu seems to get it right -- the menu always toggles nicely IMO.

The "Tray" buttons are also pretty good, but they open/toggle on mouseUp (or tapUp) rather than mouseDown the way the hotdog menu does. (note: hotdog also only shows on "tapUp" versus on "down" for a click).

Folders added to the bookmarks bar do not toggle when clicked a second time (they do on Mac). Clicking always "flashes" the menu attached to the bookmark folder. The "flash" is this behavior: with the menu open, mouse-down hides it temporarily, but it always re-appears on mouse-up.

However, Bookmark folders *do* seem to toggle correctly in response to touchscreen taps.

Then, browser action popups (e.g. from installing Google Cast), do sometimes toggle, but you need to click "fast". E.g. if your trackpad click is in the "down" state for longer than ~200ms the popup triggers again.

For touchscreen taps, browser action popups always flash/reappear when the button is pressed while the popup is open. But also the button never goes into a "pressed"/down state.

On ChromeOS, the AppList button works mostly like the browser-action buttons for "clicks" (except you have a bit longer -- I think for the entire "fade out" animation). For taps, you can toggle if you're quick, but quite often the app launcher just reappears like for a click.


cc-ing some smart people. Should we just try to make all these behave like the hotdog menu w.r.t. a "toggle"?

title.$t: Font rendering on Mac

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_2) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
https://db.tt/emolAObK

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Have a look at the screenshot provided

What is the expected behavior?
Fonts shoudl be rendered like on Windows machines and iOS.

What went wrong?
When I recently worked with Museo Sans Condensed from Typekit I realized that it looks very different across browsers, apps and OSes.

The biggest difference appears in Chrome and Firefox on Mac, where the font is rendered too bold. Also Sketch on Mac does the same. In Safari on the other hand the font looks "normal". I've prepared a little overview which showcases the differences with Museo Sans Condensed 900 in various environments: https://db.tt/emolAObK

If you look at the Windows browsers, or Photoshop or Affinity Designer, it looks (probably as intended) slightly less bold.

I've googled a bit and then and realized that the difference in Chrome and Mozilla on the Mac can be "switched off" by using "-webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased" and "-moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale" - then the rendering looks almost the same in all the browser, no matter if Mac over Windows. The problem in Sketch still appears however (I've already contacted their support for a statement).

So, the questions is now what the best thing to do is? Leave everything in its initial state and let every app/browser/OS render it differently? But then again, you can never be sure that the font looks the same everywhere. That's especially an issue with slightly lighter fonts, as Museo Sans 300 (not Condensed), which looks quite perfect in Sketch and in Chrome/Firefox on Mac, but is almost a little bit too thin in the rest of the world's apps.Also if you use the font on a darf background with light text. How can I design something, especially on the Mac, if things look so different here, so much different than in the wealth of all other devices, because even on iOS the font looks "normal" and not too bold. 

What would you suggest - what would be your approach? Some clarification would be really appreciated.

Does it occur on multiple sites: N/A

Is it a problem with a plugin? N/A 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.10.2
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

title.$t: Chrome browser "app" shortcut does not focus omnibox

content.$t: Version: <41.0.2272.64 beta (64-bit)> OS: <Linux Ubuntu 12.04> What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Launch chrome > Enable "App Launcher" from chrome://flags 2.Right click on the chrome app > Select "App info" and then "Create shortcut". 3.Launch the chrome shortcut from desktop and try to type some text in the Search box.Observe What is the expected output? One should be able to write search text in the Searchbox. What do you see instead? Nothing could be written in the Searchbox. This is a Non-Regression issue. Issue is not seen in Windows OS. It is working fine there.

title.$t: On Mac, BrowserAction popups do not fade out

content.$t: Chrome Version : 42.0.2308.0 OS Version: OS X 10.9.5 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. On Mac, Install a browser action popup. E.g. Google Cast or this simple resizy friend - https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/google-cast/boadgeojelhgndaghljhdicfkmllpafd?hl - https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/pnmdcoaajafdppfpioijldebfbpogopn 2. Open popup 3. Close popup What is the expected result? Popup should fade out, like on other platforms What happens instead of that? Popup just disappears, then 0.15 seconds later the action button pops back up. There's actually code that tries to do this fade-out in https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/chrome/browser/ui/cocoa/info_bubble_window.mm&l=160 , but it's old and AppKit has probably changed things out from under it. Original CL: https://codereview.chromium.org/389027

title.$t: MacViews: Port chrome_native_app_window_views to Mac.

content.$t: Should be easier than browser and app list since the app windows have fairly minimal UI. App-defined caption (draggable) regions might be tricky but are important. We might also want to support features not yet available on Mac like shape and transparency. Ultimately, it would be great to support Win8-style viewer_process so app shims can own the NSWindows.

title.$t: Files.app: Progress bar did not appear on the footer of open dialog.

content.$t: Version: ToT OS: Chrome OS What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Disabled streaming upload by force DialogActionController.shouldReturnLocalPath_ to true. 2. Clear local cache. 3. Go to drive.google.com and try to upload a big file. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Progress bar should appear on the footer, but it didn't. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: TileItemView::SetSelected(false) grabs ChromeVox focus

content.$t:
Version: 42

In app list, TileItemView::SetSelected(false) still notifies a FOCUS accessibility event, so it will grab ChromeVox highlight when being deselected.

I'm not sure if this causes any user-visible bugs right now, but I need to fix it (blocking Issue 458885).

title.$t: Files.app overlooks the case when Drive is *over* quota.

content.$t: Version: (not checked, but it should happen all version in 30-42) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Buy some storage of Google Drive for 1 month. 2. Make it full. 3. After 1 month ... What is the expected output? What do you see instead? What do we see: According to the plus post https://plus.google.com/u/0/+LewisMcGeary/posts/2TQEj5K8uyx Files.app shows that the user has 16,384PB of available space, but it is clearly overflowing (note that 16,384PB = 2^64B). Besides, I guess Files.app is missing the opportunity to show "low Drive space" warning banner in this case, since it thinks there's plenty of free spaces. Expected output: Some message warning that the user is over quota (both as a banner and in the menu item.)

title.$t: Selected items in the Mac browser UI don't show focus rings

content.$t:
Google Chrome	42.0.2292.0 (Official Build) dev (64-bit)
Revision	6c9e3b3dd185d169364657a36a176b273b38e9e5-refs/heads/master@{#313889}
OS	Mac OS X 
Blink	537.36 (@189235)

On a page, focus an input and then Shift+Tab. Eventually you end up in the browser UI at the top of the screen. The omnibox shows a focus ring, and the hotdog menu as well, but nothing else seems to. For example the tab close button, extension buttons, and other things all get focus and you can hit enter to interact, but they don't show a focus ring.

This is really annoying, it means you hit tab for a while and nothing seems to be focused. If you hit enter you might actually close the tab because the "x" in the tab was focused and you couldn't tell.

title.$t: Launcher back and mic buttons are not highlighted / read with ChromeVox

content.$t: Version: 42 OS: Chrome (Pre-emptively filing bug in anticipation of https://codereview.chromium.org/924943002/ landing.) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Activate ChromeVox (Ctrl+Alt+Z). 2. Open launcher. 3. Use Tab/Shift+Tab to select back and mic buttons. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? They should have a gold border and speak the title of the button.

title.$t: Tabindex is broken in shadow dom

content.$t:
Google Chrome	42.0.2292.0 (Official Build) dev (64-bit)
Revision	6c9e3b3dd185d169364657a36a176b273b38e9e5-refs/heads/master@{#313889}
OS	Mac OS X 
Blink	537.36 (@189235)

If you're on an element with tabindex="1" and a previous sibling component has another element with tabindex="1" and you tab backwards it doesn't work, it seems to select stuff in the browser UI.

If you're on an element that's tabindex="0" and you tab backwards it will go into the previous sibling shadow, but if you tab forward, and there's a tabindex="1" sibling it won't go there, instead it'll go to all the browser UI first, and then finally go to the tabindex="1" items in page.

This makes using tabindex impossible, half the time it seems to select stuff in the browser UI.

title.$t: Clear Key (AesDecryptor) does not properly handle 'cenc' Initialization Data Type

content.$t:
As noted in comment #5 of bug 459546, AesDecryptor doesn't parse PSSH boxes and just assumes it is the key (as is the case for 'webm' and our prefixed EME implementation).

AesDecryptor needs to:
 * Reject unsupported IDT strings in AesDecryptor.
 * For 'cenc':
   - Accept concatenated PSSH boxes
   - Find the common system ID and parse the KID(s) from its box.

We also need some good test coverage, including the example PSSH from the 'cenc' IDT spec and concatenated boxes for other system IDs.

For M42, we could just not report support for 'cenc'.

title.$t: UMA stats reports AppList_AutoLaunchCanceled too high

content.$t:
Kuscher told me that the number of AppList_AutoLaunchCanceled is too high (it would not be great to disclose the actual number publicly though).
As I quickly debugged, that's because this action is recorded almost everytime app-list is used (even closing the app-list records this action).  Essentially, the number reflects the number of users who uses app-list.

We'll reduce this to the actual cancel rate.  Or consider removing the event itself. Since our auto-launch is extremely fast now, majority of the human users don't have ability to cancel the auto launch manually.

title.$t: Font, font size, kerning, and styles displaying incorrectly

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
Any

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Visit site in Chrome 
2. Visit site in another browser
3. Compare visually

What is the expected behavior?
Proper layout and font size

What went wrong?
Last night, 02/18/2015, fonts, styles, and layouts on all webpages started looking strange.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? Yes On and off over the last 6 months

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: stable
OS Version: 8.1 (6.3?)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

This is a recurring problem. I have never found a fix except for formatting my system and reinstalling everything from scratch. It *appears* to be link to the system's DPI. When it changes, for example when I connect a second monitoring, Chrome screws up and I never get the proper formatting back until I do a full system restore. See the photos for comparisons.

title.$t: Ares: Shift+Tab from list to tile result is broken

content.$t: Version: 42 (r316975) OS: Chrome What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open ares. 2. Type 'f' (should see "Files" and hopefully a few more apps as tiles at the top). 3. Press Tab Tab Tab Tab until you get to a list result. 4. Press Shift+Tab. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: Highlights the right-most (last) tile result. Actual: Highlights the left-most (first) tile result.

title.$t: Tab capture consistently fails to capture video until GPU process is restarted

content.$t:
Chrome: 41.0.2272.53
OS: Windows 7
GPU: Radeon HD5800

A user experienced a problem in which tab capture ceases generating video frames (resulting in a freeze in visual output when casting a tab).  Subsequent attempts to cast generated only a black screen while audio progressed.  While initially the workaround was to restart Chrome, the user subsequently discovered that restarting the GPU process returns things to a working state.

Internal feedback: https://feedback.corp.google.com/product/85561/neutron?lView=rd&lReport=3968773419.

Copy of chrome://gpu on the affected system (the last line occurs thousands of times):

Graphics Feature Status
Canvas: Software only, hardware acceleration unavailable
Flash: Hardware accelerated
Flash Stage3D: Hardware accelerated
Flash Stage3D Baseline profile: Hardware accelerated
Compositing: Hardware accelerated
Multiple Raster Threads: Enabled
Rasterization: Hardware accelerated
Threaded Rasterization: Enabled
Video Decode: Hardware accelerated
Video Encode: Hardware accelerated
WebGL: Hardware accelerated
Driver Bug Workarounds
clear_uniforms_before_first_program_use
exit_on_context_lost
scalarize_vec_and_mat_constructor_args

title.$t: Clear Key (AesDecryptor) does not implement base64url special characters ('-' and '_' instead of '+' and '/')

content.$t:
All base64 encodings in EME use base64url rather than standard base64. See https://w3c.github.io/encrypted-media/#using-base64url for details.

AesDecryptor implements the no padding part of JWK but does not implement the character differences ('-' and '_' instead of '+' and '/', respectively).

Some ART integration tests need libarttest.so but we do not build it yet. Build it and enable dependent tests.

art.117-nopatchoat:Main

title.$t: ARC: L-Rebase: Support "check"/"run" scripts in ART integration tests

content.$t:
An ART integration test case has three driver scripts:
- build
- run
- check

Those three driver scripts are run in order to build and run a test binary, and check its output. If some of them are missing, default scripts under android/art/tests/etc/ are used instead.

Our ART test suite runner runs build scripts, but does not run run/check scripts. Instead, we have hard-coded logic in the suite runner that mimics default run/check scripts. It works for most cases, but several cases have customized scripts. We need to support them and enable more tests.

Affected tests:
art.004-ThreadStress:Main
art.018-stack-overflow:Main
art.103-string-append:Main
art.115-native-bridge:Main
art.119-noimage-patchoat:Main
art.304-method-tracing:Main

title.$t: ARC: L-Rebase: Support Jasmine (Java assembler) for ART integration test

content.$t:
A test case in ART integration tests need jasmin (Java assembler) to run.

Affected case:
art.097-duplicate-method:Main

title.$t: Stats for AppCache usage

content.$t:
Service Worker has shipped and we are investing a lot into extending and improving it. Ultimately, we want to deprecate AppCache.

We need usage metrics.

We should only count AppCache when it's effectively used.

For instance, Service Worker takes over AppCache (left as-is for browsers that don't support SW yet), so the mere presence of an appcache manifest should count as actual usage.

What's the best fit for this?
 - UMA (similar to the metric we have for page loads controlled by a Service Worker)
 - regular usage counter?

It would be nice to gather data as early as possible => M42?

title.$t: Pixel Built-in and Mic jack Cuts Out During Hangouts

content.$t: Chrome Version: <From about:version: Google Chrome x.x.x.x> Chrome OS Version: 40.0.2214.114 (Official Build) Chrome OS Platform: 6457.94.0 (Official Build) stable-channel link (Chromebook Pixel) Network info: at Google (on Google-A) Please specify Cr-* of the system to which this bug/feature applies (add the label below). Steps To Reproduce: 1. Join a hangout. 2. Sometime after joining the mic will cut out with no explicit action from the user. 3. A workaround (such as below) is then needed to recover mic functionality. Expected Result: Mic will listen for input at all times unless manually turned off. Actual Result: Mic will randomly cut out during a hangouts and require the various workarounds below to fix. How frequently does this problem reproduce? (Always, sometimes, hard to reproduce?) Sometimes, but can reliably reproduce. What is the impact to the user, and is there a workaround? If so, what is it? Requires user to unplug/replug headphone jack to get mic working again. Or plug in a mic if the built-in mic cuts out during a hangout. Sometimes rejoining the hangout will bring the mic back temporarily. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screen shot or log if possible. I have recovered this Pixel with a fresh image, and then provided a separate replacement Pixel (thinking this was a hardware issue) where the issue has encountered again. I'm thinking this might be a Pixel or a Hangouts issue, but wanted to know if there are any more avenues to check to determine if this is a sound hardware/Pixel issue or if I should file a bug with the Hangouts team. It takes a short amount of time, but I've been able to reproduce this reliably.

title.$t: Find an alternate clipboard serialization mechanism for <canvas>

content.$t:
Spinning this off issue 447094.

The issue is that in November, I refactored the clipboard IPC messages to use more specific types (before, clipboard IPCs did a lot of custom serialization/deserialization, since everything was sent as a vector of bytes).

Unfortunately, when you Copy as Image on a <canvas>, it tries to set a very long data: URL. IPC::ParamTraits<GURL> considers a GURL bad if it's > 2MB (see https://codereview.chromium.org/518693002/ for another instance of this), this causes the browser to kill the renderer for sending a malformed IPC.

To work around this, I've temporarily relaxed the IPC message to send the data as a std::string, but we should fix canvas so we don't tickle this check--loading very long data: URLs doesn't work anyway.

title.$t: shill: scan timer is started in dark resume

content.$t: Currently, there are several instances when WiFi::StartScanTimer() is called while in dark resume. StartScanTimer() should check if we are in dark resume, and if we are, it shoud not actually start a scan timer.

title.$t: screenshot_sync test is flaky after switch to Page.captureScreenshot

content.$t:
Version: TOT (Commit position 316491)
OS: Linux, Win

After https://codereview.chromium.org/919663002 the screenshot_sync test has started failing intermittently on the Linux and Windows tryservers. These tests are running on physical hardware with real GPUs and desktop sessions (no xvfb involved), so there is no excuse for them not behaving as reliably as on a developer's desktop machine.

All flaky occurrences:
http://chromium-try-flakes.appspot.com/all_flake_occurrences?key=ahVzfmNocm9taXVtLXRyeS1mbGFrZXNyGQsSBUZsYWtlIg5TY3JlZW5zaG90U3luYww

title.$t: Add superscript through subscript to RenderText

content.$t:
OS: Linux and Windows

The Answers-in-Suggest spec calls for text layout that is essentially superior and inferior script (similar to superscript and subscript).  Rather than making a one-off solution for AiS, it makes sense to extend RenderText to handle superscript through subscript.

title.$t: hitTestLayer should not malloc HitTestingTransformState

content.$t:
https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/third_party/WebKit/Source/core/layout/Layer.cpp&q=hitTestLayer%5C(&sq=package:chromium&type=cs&l=1732

I don't see any reason for this to be malloc'ed. It's just created on the stack and then passed down the recursion.

title.$t: It is difficult to write telemetry_unittests which check the thrown exception.

content.$t:
Currently telemetry platform is a singleton. (http://crrev.com/436873003)
telemetry.core.platform.GetHostPlatform() is using the global variable
"_host_platform".
This makes it difficult (impossible?) to write the unittest which checks the
thrown exception with "typ" library.

Typ library reuses the subprocess even if it is created for the isolated test.
Typ library retries the failed tests after the isolated tests are executed.

After Exception is raised in the a test which check the thrown exception,
the state of _host_platform is broken.
So all retried tests will fail.

https://codereview.chromium.org/884573004/#msg25

title.$t: PSL: Unclear whether wildcard domains should treat the parent domain as an eTLD

content.$t:
This came up with platform.sh's inclusion, which exists as

sh
*.platform.sh

In Chrome's current implementation, the registry length for "platform.sh" == 0 (when private domains are included), indicating it is effectively an eTLD. This has the effect of preventing cookies for being set for that domain, except that domain currently relies on cookies.

I've added remarks in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1124625#c6 to get feedback from the other PSL maintainers on it. For now, filing this bug to track platform.sh being removed from Chrome's copy of the PSL until we can resolve correct behaviour.

title.$t: Investigate memory/perf impact of 4444 (16-bit) textures on low-memory devices

content.$t:
With the changing semantics of "low-end" devices (see issue 459781), it's probably time to revisit whether our use of the 4444 texture format on low-memory devices is entirely justified. 

Getting rid of this path altogether could be a solid win if the memory bump is minimal (assuming all the necessary memory acceptance tests pass); it's poorly tested and likely has a negative perf impact.

title.$t: 74 localization-related bugs filed by the localization team

content.$t:
The L10N team did a major scrub of Chrome OS UI and found 60-70 bugs:
https://gloc-qm.appspot.com/?project=77278&p=3

Filing a bug to track these errors when we have a localization / emerging markest bug-bash

More context from the l10n team:
The Localization team is partnering with Product Excellence and PAs to conduct international journey evals in 2015. In Q1 we’re looking to pilot the process and combine feedback from multiple perspectives - e.g., linguists, in-country native speakers, and folks with usability testing experience - and in Q2 the goal is to scale to more journey evals across PAs. Ensuring a high quality experience for global users across all products does involve many challenges: from a localization perspective, it's important to think globally and invest early in best practices like proper internationalization, see goto/i18n. 

Breakdown of types of bugs:
https://drive.google.com/a/google.com/file/d/0BwWFoHDl_MbOY1hPbDBnTFYzMnN4R2VCLU5xaWptRzFpTGlZ/view?usp=sharing

title.$t: Remove surface checks from transform trees

content.$t: Currently property tree builder in AddTransformNodeIfNeeded checks has_surface, which will end up being a layering violation if building a transform tree moves up into Blink or cc bindings.  I think we should investigating removing surfaces as a reason for creating a transform node.

title.$t: Fill in RegistrationTickleType for sendDeviceSyncTickle API calls

content.$t: See title.

title.$t: Extract public interfaces into android_webview/native/public

content.$t:
The current approach for browser/ layer to call into native/ layer is to define a public interface in android_webview/browser then implement the interface in android_webview/native/.
(An example of this is BrowserViewRendererClient, which is implemented by AwContents)

We discussed this in the team a while back:
Let's do this more explicitly by putting all the public interfaces inside native/public. And allow browser/ depend on native/public while still banning browser/ from depending on native/ completely.

title.$t: cc: Reduce RasterTask thread contention in GPU raster mode.

content.$t:
Threaded GPU rasterization (crbug.com/454500) currently works only with
a single render worker thread.  Software rasterization can use 2 or more
if cores are available.

Since the worker threads may be shared between multiple compositors, and
some may be using Software, some GPU, we should support multiple threads
in all modes.

This will be important for enabling GPU rasterization on Desktops.

title.$t: Don't use Fake TLS handshake for XMPP connections

content.$t: Currently chromoting client connects to talk.google.com on port 443 and runs fake TLS handshake before proceeding with XMPP and proceeding with real TLS after <starttls>. It should be possible to start with real TLS handshake. This will reduce number of roundtrips to the server when opening XMPP connection.

title.$t: Autofill popup flashes when hiding keyboard

content.$t: If you hide the Android virtual keyboard while compositing (entered text is underlined), then the autofill popup will flash because of the "text changed" event, although the text did not change. This event is the result of the "confirm composition" event from Android virtual keyboard. There's code in WebViewImpl::setFocus(false) that disables autofill reacting to text changes when confirming composition. Maybe we can use the same logic for hiding the keyboard.

title.$t: Missing way to map touch-input in dual screen setup

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; CrOS x86_64 6783.1.0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2302.4 Safari/537.36
Platform: Plattform 6783.1.0 (Official Build) dev-channel panther

Steps to reproduce the problem:
When connecting two screens to an Acer Chromebox i3, one via HDMI and the other via DisplayPort it's not possible to map touch input to the correct screen. It's hardcoded to the HDMI monitor.

That's a problem when using a 4K main monitor (has to connect via HDMI @ 30 Hz) and a secondary (lower res) touch screen via DisplayPort.

My setup:
- Samsung U28D590  @ 1920 x 1080 (2x)  via HDMI
- Dell P2314T      @ 1920 x 1080       via DisplayPort

Dell is the one delivering touch input via USB.

What is the expected behavior?
It should be possible to select the display to use with touch input.

Or it should at least be hard-coded to the secondary display set in Display Preferences as this will usually be the one lying flat on the table for touch manipulation while the main content will go to the primary screen.

What went wrong?
The touch input coming via USB is hard-coded to the display connected via HDMI.

Thus using the touch screen results in touch events on the other (wrong) screen.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 42.0.2302.4  Channel: dev
OS Version: 6783.1.0
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

As said above I suggest to map the touch input to the secondary screen in such dual monitor setups as touch will usually get used on a smaller monitor at the side while the main screen will be manipulated using the mouse.

title.$t: Remove PushManager.hasPermission and use the Permissions API instead

content.$t: Follow-up from bug 449178: after hiding hasPermission, we should use the Permissions API to expose the Push Notifications permission then entirely remove hasPermission.

title.$t: Unsafe DEFINE_STATIC_LOCAL in SecurityPolicy.cpp

content.$t:
I'm seeing a DCHECK with the attached stack trace.

The originAccessMap() function defines a static local HashMap<>, but can be accessed by non-main threads using the SecurityPolicy::isAccessWhiteListed() method. This is what ServiceWorkerClients::openWindow() is using to check if a certain URL can be requested from within a Service Worker.

This can be triggered by calling ServiceWorkerClients.openWindow() from a "notificationclick" event having a different origin than the Service Worker itself.

Since only the main thread can write to the map, and reading from the map in SecurityPolicy::isAccessToURLWhiteListed() only happens for the given |activeOrigin| on non-main threads, it should be safe to change this to use AtomicallyInitializedStaticReference instead.

02-18 20:25:39.093 I/DEBUG   ( 1823):     #00  third_party/WebKit/Source/platform/weborigin/SecurityPolicy.cpp:49 (discriminator 5) (originAccessMap)

02-18 20:25:39.093 I/DEBUG   ( 1823):     #02  third_party/WebKit/Source/platform/weborigin/SecurityOrigin.cpp:306 (discriminator 1) (blink::SecurityOrigin::canRequest(blink::KURL const&) const)
02-18 20:25:39.093 I/DEBUG   ( 1823):     #03  third_party/WebKit/Source/modules/serviceworkers/ServiceWorkerClients.cpp:111 (discriminator 1) (blink::ServiceWorkerClients::openWindow(blink::ScriptState*, WTF::String const&))

title.$t: SerializedScriptValue deserialization can have side effects due to setters on builtin prototypes
NTP Suggestions data gets deleted on initial browser load

content.$t:
Because the history sync bit is deferred, we are assuming there's no history sync and deleting ML during the 1st NTP load.

Proposed solution is to check for the history bit setting instead of the actual history sync.

title.$t: Linux sandbox: Zygote PID is not properly discovered when using the namespace sandbox

content.$t:
With the namespace sandbox, the Zygote's true PID is not properly being discovered.

The whole process around  content/browser/zygote_host/zygote_host_impl_linux.cc:186 is not happening.

title.$t: Bunch of failures on individual devices on android

content.$t:
Some examples:

http://build.chromium.org/p/chromium.perf/builders/Android%20Nexus10%20Perf/builds/4413
http://build.chromium.org/p/chromium.perf/builders/Android%20Nexus7v2%20Perf/builds/3548
http://build.chromium.org/p/chromium.perf/builders/Android%20Nexus5%20Perf/builds/3582


Sometimes we get a run on android where there will be a dozen or so tests failing on one run, only to be green the next. A few examples above. Now that we output device affinity we can see that they seem to be clustered on the same device(s) each time.

title.$t: Obsolete ConnectionType metrics

content.$t:
The ConnectionType metrics are pretty screwy. They lump a lot of information into one histogram, so the denominator is wrong. They're also currently unowned so they don't show up in the UMA dashboard. It lumps together information on SPDY/HTTP and information on SSL version.

1. I'll claim that metric for now so it shows up again.

2. I'll add a per-connection[*] metric that only reports the SSL version.

3. Someone on SPDY/QUIC figure out what corresponding metric(s) would be best for that.

4. Obsolete the ConnectionType metrics when the new ones are in and reporting useful data.


[*] There may be something to be said for making SSL metrics be per-request instead of per-connection. But our other metrics are per-connection rather than per-request so let's be consistent for now.

title.$t: Enable client integration testing of Wallet sync

content.$t:
Example tests that we'd like:
- Client syncs down Wallet entity
- Client syncs down Wallet entity and then downloads an update

Action items for enabling these scenarios:
1) Add the ability to inject Wallet entities in the server. A factory will be needed here: https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/sync/test/fake_server/entity_builder_factory.h&sq=package:chromium&type=cs

2) Force invalidation/notification so that client(s) download Wallet changes. I think we can use https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/chrome/browser/sync/test/integration/p2p_sync_refresher.h

title.$t: mediaKeys cleared when src set, but not when set to null

content.$t: Version: Chrome stable, and a few revisions before that OS: Only tested on Linux, assumed to affect all platforms What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open the debugging console. 2. Load the attached HTML file. 3. Note that 2 of these 6 assertions in the attached example fail: 3a. Calling v.setMediaKeys(mk1) sets v.mediaKeys, as expected. 3b. Setting v.src = url does not affect v.mediaKeys, as expected. 3c. Calling v.setMediaKeys(null) does not affect v.mediaKeys. I expect it to set v.mediaKeys to null and release CDM resources. (Assertion fails, line 25.) 3d. Setting v.src = '' does set v.mediaKeys to null. 3e. Calling v.setMediaKeys(mk2) sets v.mediaKeys, as expected. 3f. Setting v.src = url unexpectedly sets v.mediaKeys to null. (Assertion fails, line 39.)

title.$t: delta_generator: Refactor graph generation operations out of the common delta_generator.

content.$t:
delta_diff_generator.{h,cc} has functions (well, static class methods) to do two kind of things:
 * Build and operate over a dependency graph.
 * Create operations and put them in a proto/payload file.

We need the second set of functions for both delta generation methods (minor version 1 and 2), but not the first one. We should factor out the first set into a different class to help reuse the others more cleanly; for example in a new file called inplace_generator.{h,cc} including all the graph related functions in the .h files. Looking at the delta_diff_generator.h looks like these methods should be moved to the new file:
ConvertGraphToDag
CreateScratchNode
SubstituteBlocks
CutEdges
CreateEdges
MoveFullOpsToBack
SortCutsByTopoOrder
NoTempBlocksRemain
ConvertCutToFullOp
GenerateReverseTopoOrderMap
AssignTempBlocks
AddInstallOpToBlocksVector

(but feel free to move others or keep some of these if you think is better).

I would be nice if the part of the GenerateDeltaUpdateFile that deal with the inplace payload generator logic are also moved to its own function as the FullUpdateGenerator::Run() does; but think about the readability of that.

title.$t: crash when starting webrtc session on chromecast engineering build

content.$t: Chromecast doesn't support media capture devices at the moment, we used to go through MEDIA_DEVICE_INVALID_STATE code path in the past, but on more recent versions of WebRTC/Chromium we are getting MEDIA_DEVICE_NOT_SUPPORTED (that was changed in Sep 2014) and since that is unhandled in the switch in UserMediaClientImpl::GetUserMediaRequestFailed, we are crashing on Eng builds when DCHECKs are enabled.

title.$t: Changing disabled attribute of text input only work once

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:35.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/35.0

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Set programmatically the disabled attribute of a text input to false after page load.
2. Set programmatically the disabled attribute of the same element to true.
3. 

What is the expected behavior?
The element is initially enabled, is rendered as so and, when accessing the disabled attribute of the element through javascript it returns false.

At step 2, the element is disabled, is rendered as so (greyed out) and, when accessing the disabled attribute of the element through javascript it returns true.

What went wrong?
At step 2, the element is not disabled, is rendered as enabled ( not greyed out ) but when accessing the disabled attribute of the element through javascript it returns true.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111 (Official Build) m  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

Changing the disabled attributes of a text input is only possible once.

Any ways of changing the attributes seems to have the same effect.
$("#limitFloorMax").attr( 'disabled', 'disabled' );
$("#limitFloorMax").prop( 'disabled', true );
$("#limitFloorMax").removeAttr( 'disabled' );
document.getElementById("limitFloorMax").removeAttribute( "disabled" );
document.getElementById("limitFloorMin").disabled = "disabled";
document.paramFormAdvanced.limitFloorMax.disabled = true;

After editing the disabled attribute for the first time, it is not possible to change it again.

It also shows up as always disabled = true in javascript after the initial editing but is always displayed as enabled when rendered in the browser.

title.$t: Better TLS fallback histograms

content.$t:
Our current fallback histograms have some issues:

1. They count if fallback was attempted, whether or not the fallback was successful. This means that we count situations where, fallback or no, no handshake could be made anyway. We should instead only sample at successful handshakes.

2. The NSS metrics are dramatically undercounting. When offering resumption, NSS clamps client_version to the session's version. This means that an intolerant server which does session resumption only contributes to the metrics for the first handshake. Windows counts for Net.ConnectionUsedSSLVersionFallback went up significantly with the BoringSSL switch. So far everything points to this being a side effect of the NSS undercounting.

The first is pretty easy to fix. For the second, we maybe should just remove that behavior from NSS because it's ridiculous. No other major SSL client library[*] does this. Or perhaps ignore the problem since soon only Linux/CrOS/iOS will be the only ones left on NSS anyway.

We'll still have noise from spurious network failures. That's less easy to quantify without adding state. One possibility is to measure fallback attempts which hit a FALLBACK_SCSV and compare those. Or hope the noise is small enough to not worry about.


[*] Excluding OpenSSL upstream, but OpenSSL is primarily used on servers and its client implementation is pretty broken here.

title.$t: Debugger source code / line numbers wrong when `//# sourceURL=` comments present

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/36.0.1985.125 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Place the attached files in the same directory.

2. Open index.html and look at the console.

3. Click the link to the file:line-number reported as containing an error.

What is the expected behavior?
Console should report error on `app.js` line 7 and link to `app.js` line 7.

What went wrong?
Console reports error on `file-6` line 7 (a non-existent line of a non-existent file) and links to line 4 of that non-existent file (because that is the last line in the "file" and is lower than the line number the error occurred on in the real source file). Sometimes the console reports the actual line number in the non-existent file (masking the line number that contains the code in the real source file).

`file-6` is a non-existent file that the debugger has generated by taking the real source file, `app.js`, and stripping the lines containing `//# sourceURL=` comments.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111 m  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 7 x64
Flash Version: 

I'm getting 2 different failure modes with respect to mangling the line numbers. Either:

1. The console reports the line number from the non-existent file, preventing you from knowing the line number in the real source file.

2. It reports the line number from the original source file, which doesn't match the line it links to in the non-existent file because the line numbers have been altered by stripping lines containing `//# sourceURL=` comments.

I first ran into failure mode 1 with a browserify bundle. I tried to create a minimal reproduction and ran into failure mode 2 (minimal reproduction for that included here). I haven't been able to isolate a difference that determines which failure mode is triggered.

This is related to #457419.

title.$t: Throw script exceptions instead of crashing the tab where possible

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.91 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
http://jsfiddle.net/o5238ok6/1/

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Go to the aforementioned URL.
2. Click on "OK Google!".

What is the expected behavior?
A JavaScript error, or a console error.

What went wrong?
The tab crashes, so it is not possible to easily debug such cases when it happens in non malicious code.

Does it occur on multiple sites: N/A

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.91  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

See https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/forum/#!topic/chromium-dev/XVCWBIKUmZU for an example for a puzzled developer who got sporadic crashes and almost no way to debug them.

I suggest to make the defense two fold -
1. Fail at the renderer level and throw a JavaScript exception or a console error, instead of bothering to even send an IPC message to the browser.
2. Fail at the browser level - kill the tab (already implemented).

title.$t: 'test_runner.py linker' crashes

content.$t: Version: master OS: Linux What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. cr shell build/android/test_runner.py linker What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The command should run linker tests, but instead throws a sequence of Python exceptions: [ RUN ] LinkerSharedRelroTest.ForRegularDevice E 10.883s 4ba9 Caught exception while trying to run test: LinkerSharedRelroTest.ForRegularDevice Traceback (most recent call last): File "build/android/pylib/linker/test_runner.py", line 89, in RunTest results = test.Run(self.device) File "build/android/pylib/linker/test_case.py", line 283, in Run status, logs = self._RunTest(device) File "build/android/pylib/linker/test_case.py", line 334, in _RunTest return _StartActivityAndWaitForLinkerTestStatus(device, timeout=30) File "build/android/pylib/linker/test_case.py", line 126, in _StartActivityAndWaitForLinkerTestStatus with device.GetLogcatMonitor(filters=_LOGCAT_FILTERS) as logmon: File "build/android/pylib/device/decorators.py", line 56, in TimeoutRetryWrapper return timeout_retry.Run(impl, timeout, retries) File "build/android/pylib/utils/timeout_retry.py", line 161, in Run thread_group.JoinAll(child_thread.GetWatcher()) File "build/android/pylib/utils/reraiser_thread.py", line 143, in JoinAll self._JoinAll(watcher) File "build/android/pylib/utils/reraiser_thread.py", line 130, in _JoinAll thread.ReraiseIfException() File "build/android/pylib/utils/reraiser_thread.py", line 76, in run self._ret = self._func(*self._args, **self._kwargs) File "build/android/pylib/utils/timeout_retry.py", line 150, in RunOnTimeoutThread ret[0] = func(*args, **kwargs) File "build/android/pylib/device/decorators.py", line 50, in impl return f(*args, **kwargs) File "build/android/pylib/device/device_utils.py", line 1329, in GetLogcatMonitor return logcat_monitor.LogcatMonitor(self.adb, *args, **kwargs) TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'filters' It seems that this might have been caused by https://codereview.chromium.org/896503002.

title.$t: ReplaceContents causes crash off main thread when flushing if message loop is not attached

content.$t:
The suggested method of using ReplaceContents is to create a new ImageData, draw to it, use it to replace the current graphics2d context, flush, then release it.

This processes is described in the ReplaceContents docs here: https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/ppapi/cpp/graphics_2d.h&l=165

I've found that this process will crash inside the call to PPB_Core.ReleaseResource (when releasing the newly-created ImageData resource) if there is no messageloop attached.

title.$t: Hosted apps that are refocused are not counted as most recently used in Launcher

content.$t:
Hosted apps are not properly counted in most recently used list in Ares when they refocus instead of relaunch. Reproduce:

1) Open GMail, Files App, Calculator - MRU = Calculator, Files, GMail
2) Tap Files - MRU = Files, Calculator, GMail
3) Tap Gmail

Expected
MRU = GMail, Files, Calculator

Actual
MRU = Files, Calculator, Gmail

seems like we ignore something when refocussing hosted apps.

content.$t:
See requirements https://docs.google.com/document/d/1T9FkndomtoLvcTJqEBgTFRCrHm39HLewr0RtIXi8clw/edit?authkey=CMPes8cO#heading=h.hjje7qohgohf

In ‘contentload’ event handler Chrome OS sends message ‘{'method': 'handshake'}’ to GAIA page.

Currently we do send empty message but let's stick to the requirements and change it to a specific message.

title.$t: Doesn't remember window minimized state on restore

content.$t:
Version:  41.0.2272.53 beta (64-bit)
OS: 10.10.2

- Create two windows with several tabs
- minimize one of them
- quit the app
- relaunch app

expected: minimized window is still minimized

title.$t: New search in search bar getting lost and being replaced by old search.

content.$t:
Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Search for 'testing' in search bar 
2. Click search bar and hit X and enter new query 'testing 2' then hit blue GO arrow.

title.$t: ARC: Whiteliest ARC Runtime for public sessions

content.$t:
ARC developers have received feedback that their apps don't work in public sessions. Even though the apps are Chrome apps (and therefore should work without a whitelist), the ARC Runtime, a required "shared module" in Chrome, is not whitelisted. Therefore, the app fails to run, which has caused the user complaints.

We need to whitelist the ARC Runtime: mfaihdlpglflfgpfjcifdjdjcckigekc

Marking this M-41 because the developers are receiving complaints on M-40, which is too far back to merge so we'll try for M-41.

I just sent a ping to @bartfab about this issue to give him more context.

title.$t: Split tunnel API for third party VPN

content.$t: Split tunnel API is currently not supported by the extension API chrome.vpnProvider for third party VPN. This needs to be supported.

title.$t: Compile-time check for inline destructor broken for "= default"

content.$t:
When writing a complex C++ class,
there is a compile error if the constructor or destructor is inlined.

That check does not work if there is an explicitly defaulted destructor. Example, in my_class.h:

~MyClass() = default;

This generates an inline destructor, but is not caught by the check.

We noticed this issue when working on CL:
https://codereview.chromium.org/917333006/diff/1/ios/chrome/browser/net/mock_image_fetcher.h

In that CL, not writing a destructor would trigger the check (as expected), but defaulting the destructor would silence the check (not expected).

- See that the corp user on system A will change its wallpaper to the other gmails user (does not always happen, but quite often).

title.$t: Create skeleton for the new OOBE UI implementation

content.$t:
Proposed structure:

ui/chromeos/
  oobe/
    DEPS
    OWNERS
    oobe_ui_export.h -- file with OOBE_UI export macro definition.
    oobe_ui.{h,cc} -- implementation of WebUIController for the "chrome://oobe-md" URL.
    oobe_ui_resouces.grd -- file with resources definitions.
    oobe_ui.gyp -- gyp file providing 'oobe_ui' and 'oobe_ui_resources' targets.
    BUILD.gn -- gn file providing 'oobe_ui' and 'oobe_ui_resources'.
    resources/ -- directory for HTML and JS resources.
      bin/ -- directory for binary resources.
    declarations/ -- directory for json files with views' declarations.
chrome/browser/chromeos/oobe -- directory containing native implementation of views, that depend on chrome/browser

To check that everything compiles and works fine, we need to define a root element in declarations/oobe.json, implement HTML and C++ parts for this element, and implement switching from the old OOBE UI to the new one by Ctrl + Alt + Shift + O shortcut (partially this was made in e1a1b72ecf).

title.$t: Implement JavaScript category and exceptions

content.$t:
The JavaScript permission is the only old-style category left on the Site Settings page. It should be converted to a new-style category (with a global toggle and list).

We should also implement the exception dialog, thereby supporting whitelisting of JavaScript sites.

title.$t: 'height: auto' property does not work in vertical-layout

content.$t:
Chrome Version:
42.0.2307.4 (Official Build) canary (64-bit)

Tests:
I will attach in next comment. 

Expected:
It is expected that there is a vertical scrollbar.

1. 'height: auto' property is set to <div>
2. <body> is horizontal layout and <div> is vertical layout. This case is Orthogonal Flows.
3. Because of 1 and 2, <div>'s physical height (inline-size) is not determined.
4. According to spec^[1], the initial containing block size is used as fallback for <div>'s physical height value when physical height (inline-size) is not determined.
5. In this test, the initial containing block size is same as viewport size.
6. Because of 4 and 5, <div>'s physical height is same as viewport height.
7. So, the page's physical height is over the viewport height because there is <p>'s height and body's margin.
8. In browser where vertical layout is implemented correctly, there is vertical-scroll-bar

[1]: http://www.w3.org/TR/css-writing-modes-3/#orthogonal-auto

Other Browsers:
Firefox 38.0a1 (2015-02-17): Passed
IE 11.0.9600.17501: Passed

title.$t: Regression: Warning message under 'Allow in incognito' not seen after second click in chrome://extensions.

content.$t:
Chrome Version: 42.0.2307.4 (Official Build) a7f3016170ea542979db9cb033f2e0ff0cf122c6-refs/branch-heads/2307@{#5} 32/64 Bit.
OS: All (Win 7 Aero-Enabled)

Steps:
1. Launch chrome and navigate to chrome://extensions/
2. Click on the checkbox of 'Allow in incognito' under any extension multiple times and observe.

Actual: The warning message is not seen after second click.

Expected: The warning message should be seen on each click.

This is a regression issue broken in M-42.

Narrow Bisect:
https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/d1aa852e6df52eaca4da775a3c40b3c1c8431008..514b36babdf0e97f32b93eebe3122b17d3cfc2c4?pretty=fuller&n=100

Please re-assign if your change is not cause for this issue.

title.$t: Regression: Default cursor focus is not seen in Password text-box on Chrome sign-in page.

content.$t: Chrome Version: 42.0.2307.4 (Official Build), Revision: a7f3016170ea542979db9cb033f2e0ff0cf122c6-refs/branch-heads/2307@{#5}-32/64 bit. OS: All (Win 7-Aero enabled) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch chrome and go to chrome sign in page i.e. chrome://chrome-signin/?source=0 2. Enter valid username and wrong password, click "Sign in" button 3. Observe the "Password" text-box Default cursor focus is not seen in Password text-box. content.$t:
Steps to reproduce:

title.$t: Rendering broken in ChromeShell on Nexus 6 (with blue tiles, eventually a DCHECK).

content.$t:
Since ~5, 6PM London time yesterday I've been unable to open ContentShell and successfully render google.com, or any other page. The page is entirely white, and when scrolling or invalidating the rendered bits using pinch-zoom I get blue tiles all around. Doing this for a while, the DCHECK slightly down hits.

This can be reproduced rather reliably, but not entirely consistent. I haven't been able to check this in Clank yet.

title.$t: Broken preview of ajax-request with html response

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Visit jsfiddle demo: http://jsfiddle.net/webdevem/vxdHs/
2. Open Inspector and switch to Network view with XHR filter.
3. Click the Run button in the jsfiddle.
4. Inspect first ajax-request.
5. Navigate to Headers tab.
6. Note that response has header "Content-Type:text/html; charset=utf-8".
7. Navigate to Preview tab.
8. Note that preview of returned html code is broken.

What is the expected behavior?
8. Preview of returned html-code shows the table.

What went wrong?
HTML was parsed as JSON?

Did this work before? Yes Month ago.

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: stable
OS Version: 3.16
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

Firefox shows preview correctly.

title.$t: SAP: iframe content scrolls up and no input field is visible

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.94 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open http://jsbin.com/xuyaruhinu/1/
2. Scroll to the bottom of the frame
3. Set the focus into the input at the bottom
4. Hit “shift+tab” to change the focus to the input at
   the top

What is the expected behavior?
The frame content does not scroll or scrolls but the focused input is still visible.

What went wrong?
The frame content scrolls up and no input field is visible anymore.

Did this work before? Yes Chrome 38.0.2125.122 (stable) (Windows Server 2008 R2)

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.94  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

Problem could be reproduced with
- Chrome 39.0.2171.71 m (stable) (Windows Server 2008 R2)
- Chrome 40.0.2214.111 m (64-bit) (stable) (Windows 7
  Enterprise SP1)
- Chrome 41.0.2272.16 beta-m (Windows Server 2008 R2)
- Chrome 42.0.2301.0 canary (Windows 7 Enterprise SP1)
- Chrome 41.0.2272.53 beta-m (Windows Server 2012
  Standard)
- Chrome 42.0.2307.4 canary (Windows 7 Enterprise SP1)

Problem could not be reproduced with
- Chrome 38.0.2125.122 (stable) (Windows Server 2008 R2)
- Firefox 35.0.1 (Windows 7)
- Internet Explorer 8-11 (Windows 7)

title.$t: pp::MouseInputEvent.GetMovement() returns incorrect values after changing text size

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Compile ppapi/examples/mouse_lock
2. Change Windows provide text size option by right click->Screen Resolution->Make text and other items larger or smaller->Select Large
3. Run mouse_lock example, lock mouse by doing a click on plugin and circularly rotate mouse multiple times. Needle has some spikes during rotation.

What is the expected behavior?
Needle should rotate smoothly and no spikes should be seen

What went wrong?
pp::MouseInputEvent.GetMovement() returns buggy values (-6, -39), (0, -38) even during slow and smooth mouse movements and those cause spikes.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

title.$t: Playback failure due to non-spec-compliant Clear Key behavior

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2307.4 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
http://media.junglecode.net/test/dash-eme-sintel/sintel.html

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Use Chrome Canary to visit test URL
2. Try the same Firefox Nightly
3. Compare results

What is the expected behavior?
Successful encrypted media playback.

What went wrong?
Error: Response is not a valid JSON Web Key Set. 

After reviewing this file:
http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome/trunk/src/media/cdm/json_web_key.cc

it looks like we're sending proper JSON per the latest spec but Chromium returns error.

Did this work before? No 

Is it a problem with Flash or HTML5? HTML5

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 42.0.2307.4  Channel: canary
OS Version: OS X 10.10.1

title.$t: [WebView] - Remove onFailure from visual state callback

content.$t:
Currently, the visual state callbacks always succeed if the FrameHostMsg_VisualStateResponse message is received, see:
https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/content/browser/frame_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc&q=InsertVisualStateCallback&sq=package:chromium&type=cs&l=1130

The only situation when they currently fail is when the RenderFrameHostImpl has been destroyed before the message is received, see:
https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/content/browser/frame_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc&q=InsertVisualStateCallback&sq=package:chromium&type=cs&l=206

However, the callback should also fail if the FrameHostMsg_VisualStateResponse message is received but swap promises are broken with states: DID_NOT_SWAP_UNKNOWN, SWAP_FAILS and COMMIT_FAILS!!

NOTE that if they promises are broken with state COMMIT_NO_UPDATE the callback should still succeed (see crbug/458577)

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Launch chrome and navigate to chrome://bookmarks 2.Click on 'imported' folder and then click on 'bookmark bar' folder (bookmarked webpages) and observe the scroll bar to the R.H.S Actual: Scroll bar gets chopped in chrome://bookmarks after step 2. title.$t: Bypass popup to grant desktop sharing by WebRTC

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Example URL:

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Share a desktop by WebRTC (https://talky.io/ can be used to reproduce the problem)
2. A popup asking for user grant to share desktop is shown

What is the expected behavior?
It would be very useful (for testing purposes) to bypass the grant popup.

What went wrong?
It is not possible to bypass the popup which appears when the desktop is shared by WebRTC. This behaviour makes impossible to perform automated tests of this kind of applications.

It would be very useful if a flag like --use-fake-ui-for-media-stream (to avoid popup granting access to the cam/micro) for desktop sharing. The closest existing flag now is --auto-select-desktop-capture-source, but this flag is only to automate the window picker.

Did this work before? N/A 

Is it a problem with Flash or HTML5? HTML5

Does this work in other browsers? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: stable
OS Version: 
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

title.$t: 100% CPU after long/continuous window resize

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_2) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Drag a window resize handle around the screen continuously for a while (30 seconds)
2. Continue holding onto the drag handle while NOT moving it (notice CPU usage remains low).
3. Release the drag handle (notice CPU goes 100% and all Chrome processes are unresponsive).

What is the expected behavior?

What went wrong?
CPU usage hits 100% on one core, and all processes become unresponsive for a short duration (a few seconds) Beachball of Doom. This only occurs after an extended marathon of window resizing, but ONLY after the resize handle is released.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.10.2
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

Tested on multiple machines (MBP and MBA) both with OSX 10.10.2. Occurs only with Chrome; e.g. does not affect Firefox or Safari.

title.$t: remove courgette version tests and add bsdiff version tests

content.$t:
Chrome always packages the latest version of courgette with the update package.

The component updater however, does not have this guarantee since:

1. An old version of Chrome might receive a new version of a patch, and it needs to understand it (This is called "backwards compatibility" of patch format).
2. A new version of Chrome might receive an old version of a patch, and it needs to handle it (:forwards compatibility: of patch format).

We should remove the courgette version compatibility tests - this will allow us to iteratively improve the courgette binary algorithm.

However, to ensure that bsdiff will always continue to work, we should add forwards and backwards bsdiff compatibility regression tests in their place to ensure component updater functionality remains.

title.$t: Guest mode: Launcher shows doodle for google.com (not localized)

content.$t: Version: 42.0.2302.4 OS: Chrome What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Log into guest mode. 2. Open the launcher. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: Doodle for user's local country. Actual: Doodle for google.com. This is because we call UIThreadSearchTermsData::GoogleBaseURLValue to get the Google URL for the user's country. If the user has no country (i.e., guest account), we just use google.com. We should attempt to find the correct Google domain (for example, if you send a request to http://www.google.com, it will 302 redirect you to google.com.au if in Australia).

title.$t: Status bar shows up even in fullscreen, and it doesn't even disappear on mouse hover

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
This is pretty easy so please take the time to try it.

1. watch some video on fullscreen for more than a few seconds
2. see as the status bar appears on the bottom-left of the screen from time to time, presumably when some data is being loaded from the page that hosts the fullscreen video.

"Status bar", is that how you call that bar that appears on the bottom left reading "waiting for foodomain.com..." and the like? I'm talking about that bar.

3. Move the mouse over it 

What is the expected behavior?
1) In fullscreen mode, that status bar shouldn't ever show up at all in the first place. That should only show up in normal window mode

2) Even assuming the ridiculous annoyance that the bar shows up, it should hide when you move the mouse cursor over it, as it DOES in normal window mode, in order to allow you to see the content behind it (which btw is often a vital part of the UI when in fullscreen).

What went wrong?
1) The status bar shows up even in fullscreen, even when watching videos in fullscreen
2) what is much worse, the status bar won't even hide when moving the mouse cursor over it (as it does in non-fullscreen mode), so not only it's annoying but also you can't get rid of it and it will prevent you from seing the part of content on the bottom-left of the screen, which is often vital video controls such as the play/pause button
(if I'm not mistaken the controls will work aniway, but you won't be able to see what you'll be clicking)

Did this work before? Yes not sure. Perhaps when the "supersmart autohide" status bar didn't even exist (and we had the old good static always-there only-in-window status bar)

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: stable
OS Version: 
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

I already reported this bug, but some retarded closed it as WontFix saying he couldn't reproduce it. Which is both nonsense ("WontFix" means you aknowledge the issue but decide not to fix it for a reason, so it makes no sense to close as WontFix an issue that you cannot reproduce) AND bullshit (it's TRIVIAL to reproduce, so the person stating it clearly didn't even spend a few seconds trying).

Since then, I commented on the issue and provided a lot of screenshots, but apparently once an issue gets closed nobody even cares to reply, let alone reopen it.
So I'm reporting it again and I attach a handfull of screenshots.

  benwells@chromium.org - Change bookmark app menu from Add to Dock... to Add to Applications... - cd5910ec61c424fd0f719a2e7d53241e8d617e5d

title.$t: DriCursor::MoveCursorTo is laggy

content.$t: Version: 42.0.2307.0 (64 bit) Platform: 6376.0.0 (Official build) dev channel link_freon test Firmware Google_Link 2695.1.155 What steps will reproduce the problem? On Chrome OS (Link_freon) 1. Install the Chrome remote desktop app. 2. Launch the Chrome Remote Desktop app. 3. Click on Share. 4. A confirm prompt will be up, click on Share again. On your linux machine 5. Install the Chrome remote desktop app. 6. Launch the Chrome Remote Desktop app. 7. Click on Access 8. Copy the access code from 4 into the textfield and click connect 9. Once connected, move the mouse around on the linux machine What is the expected output? The cursor is moved on the chrome os machine as the mouse is moving on the linux machine. What do you see instead? Mouse events are firing as hover effects are updated, but the cursor is lagging behind. See video https://drive.google.com/a/chromium.org/file/d/0B3a7uKJpDfM5YmdVUFRRNkxYeDA/view?usp=sharing

title.$t: Support chrome_style from options_ui.chrome_style in other extension view types
[Peppy] Display glitch when you hit Ctrl+D on the "OS Verification is OFF screen"

content.$t:
I can't believe we missed this :(

1. Take a peppy (if it's not on dev mode, put it on dev more) running a freon build.
2. Reboot it.
3. On the "OS Verification is OFF screen" press Ctrl+D

Expected:
Transition to dark screen then to Chrome logo.

Seen:
A noticeable glitch on the dark screen before going to the Chrome logo.

It is possible that this bug is related to 431456 and/or and might be fixed by that. Copying all folks in 431456.

Can we know more? Tagging as rb until more information is available.

So far I see this on peppy but not link. Haven't yet tried other freons.

content.$t: Version: 42.0.2305.3 DEV OS: MAC What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to webstore url 2. Attempt to install any chrome app 3. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Installation succeeds Please use labels and text to provide additional information. The item behaves for a few seconds as if it was been installed, but then the browser will shut down. This issue does not repro for extensions or themes, only chrome apps. Also, it is not OS dependent. This issue does not repro on previous dev chrome versions.

Version: 316493

smoothness.*.polymer benchmarks got a lot faster as of around r316493, but
this is unexpected.

I suspect the following change has disabled page interactions on these
benchmarks: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/05140bce74b348034509f87b672ce9710f129af5

title.$t: Chrome-based video test should check for HW histograms *after* the test and test initialization failures

content.$t:
We should audit and modify all Chrome-based tests for HW decode and encode to test HW histograms *after* the test is finished.

We should also in addition to successes check that there ware *exactly 0* failure histograms.

This is because we may fall back to SW somewhere in the middle of the test. So we have to make sure this never happened during the entire test.

title.$t: ARC: NDK Code style -- pass non-const pointers rather than refs.

content.$t:
These were picked up as lint errors during roll of depot_tools, which picked up a new cpplint.py version.

In https://chrome-internal-review.googlesource.com/#/c/199369, I added dozens of "// NOLINT(runtime/references)" comments to ignore the style violation to src/ndk_translation/intrinsics.cc and src/ndk_translation/vector_intrinsics_impl.h

title.$t: pp::VideoDecoder renderer does not cope with odd widths or heights correctly

content.$t: Version: Chrome 42.0.2302.4 dev (64-bit), Web-app 42.0.2290.1 OS: ChromeOS Panther What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Connect Chromoting client to a Linux host w/ resize-to-fit support. 2. Resize so that the desktop width and/or height are odd. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expect that the desktop is rendered normally. Instead, if the width is uneven then there is a line of white pixels to the right of the desktop, and a line of missing pixels somewhere in the middle of the desktop. Similar issue applies for odd heights.

title.$t: Chromium does not mark QUIC proxies as bad

content.$t:
If a QUIC proxy is unreachable, it should be marked as bad.

Steps to reproduce:
(1) Set up access point that blocks UDP destination port 443 packets.
(2) adb shell echo "chrome --enable-quic --proxy-server=http=quic://www.google.com:443,direct://" > /data/local/chrome-command-line
(3) Load http://www.gstatic.com/chat/hangouts/bg/davec.jpg in broswer
(4) Observed: ERR_QUIC_PROTOCOL_ERR. 
Expected: Chromium should mark quic://www.google.com:443 as bad proxy and fallback to direct://.

Doing the same with https://www.google.com:443 as the primary proxy, instead of quic (with TCP port 443 blocked on access point), leads to Chromium marking https://www.google.com:443 as bad proxy and successfully falling back to direct://

Netlogs attached for both SPDY blocked and QUIC blocked.

title.$t: video_VideoSeek doesn't verify HW decode

content.$t:
video_VideoSeek should test if it's using HW decode via histograms.

More importantly, it should check *after* the test if there were *exactly 0* samples for failed HW decode.

This is because on seek we may get a resolution change and reinitialization of decoder, and we can even fall back to SW decode in the middle of the test if there is an error.

The only way to ensure this is not happening is check histograms *after* the test and verify there were exactly 0 failed initializations (checking for successes only is not enough).
