title.$t: Report 'localhost' as an eTLD+1 in Rappor

content.$t: When we report eTLD+1 via Rappor for sites triggering various events (interstitials, mixed-content warnings, etc), "localhost" will show up as empty string.  Instead, we should report localhost explicitly since that is a useful signal.

title.$t: Client.postMessage should go to navigator.serviceWorker.onmessage rather than window.onmessage

content.$t:
As per https://github.com/slightlyoff/ServiceWorker/issues/609#issuecomment-74714928

This is a web-facing change so it should go through the intent to ship process.

title.$t: Kernel should pass information from EC about whether USB PD device is dual-role or not
Animation::cancelAnimationOnCompositor re-adds player to CompositorPending list

content.$t:
Animation::cancelAnimationOnCompositor re-adds player to CompositorPending list.

We don't need that in the following cases:
1) CompositorAnimations::cancelIncompatibleAnimationsOnCompositor
2) AnimationPlayer::preCommit

title.$t: ☂ bug for VP9 decode issues

content.$t: There are duplicate bugs related to VP9 decode in YouTube. This is an umbrella bug to capture all of them related and tie in to run some experiments to get a better understanding of the video performance issues.

title.$t: Provide a disable VP9 decode in chrome://flags

content.$t:
Provide a chrome://flags option to disable VP9 decode for future experiments. 

VP9 decode is great for YouTube. YouTube has published multiple times how it is a better experience overall for users as it reduces bandwidth requirements, provides a better streaming experience, and lowers the requirements for HD. 

However, we have are getting increasing reports on poor VP9 decode performance, especially in low power notebooks for HD @ 60fps. To better understand real world decode performance we want to add a chrome://flags "Disable VP9 decode" to run experiments across different architecture, network and battery conditions. 

Additionally, this also allows power users an escape hatch if they have a preference on codecs supported by Chrome.

title.$t: No visual indicator after using "Cut"

content.$t: If you "Cut" a couple files, there's no visual indication that they've been cut. Fading the icons or something would be good feedback. Sebastien, Jenn, what do you think would look good? Not needed for M42.

title.$t: Pending download IDs in SharedPreferences are not cleared when restarting the app

content.$t:
When restarting the app, the pending download IDs are actually not cleared.

I can still retrieve the pending download IDs after restarting the app several times.

title.$t: "Delete" icon disappears after clicking

content.$t:
1) Select two or more files
2) Click the trash can icon in the action bar. Notice that the icon disappears.
3) Click "cancel" in the dialog. Notice that the icon reappears after a second.

The icon should just be there until after the files are deleted.

title.$t: Only apply Widevine-specific logic in MediaDrmBridge to the Widevine key system.

content.$t: MediaDrmBridge and related code, such as BrowserCdmFactoryAndroid and MediaDrmCredentialManager, contain code specific to Widevine. This code should not be used for other key systems. Ideally, this logic would be extracted, but we should at least avoid running it for other key systems.

title.$t: GCC 4.9.2: Firmware testing for minor compiler upgrade

content.$t:
We want to upgrade to GCC 4.9.2 early next week (or as soon thereafter as possible).  Please test the firmware for us, for this upgrade.

To obtain/use GCC 4.9.2 in your chroot you need to emerge the version of gcc appropriate for your board, passing USE="next_gcc" to the emerge command.  For example, to get GCC 4.9.2 for a 64-bit Intel board, do:


 $ sudo USE="next_gcc" emerge cross-x86_64-cros-linux-gnu/gcc

The various versions of gcc that you can emerge for the boards are:

  cross-arm-none-eabi/gcc
  cross-armv7a-cros-linux-gnueabi/gcc
  cross-x86_64-cros-linux-gnu/gcc
  cross-i686-pc-linux-gnu/gcc


To make sure you have the right version of GCC emerged, invoke GCC with the --version flag, e.g.

$ x86_64-cros-linux-gnu-gcc --version

It should give you an answer such as:

x86_64-cros-linux-gnu-gcc.real (4.9.2_cos_gg... ) 4.9.x-google 20140827 (prerelease)

Please make sure it says 4.9.2 in the version string


After you have the correct version of GCC, build your stuff with it.  If you call build_packages, pass the flag --skip_toolchain_update, to make sure it doesn't re-emerge a different version of GCC.

title.$t: WebAudio: Give hint on the type of number for exponentialRampToValue

content.$t: OS: All What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Run this c = new AudioContext(); g = c.createGain(); g.gain.exponentialRampToValue(1e-60,1) See also http://stackoverflow.com/questions/28476180/whats-the-smallest-float-allowable-for-exponentialramptovalueattime What is the expected output? What do you see instead? This example produces an error: DOMException: Failed to execute 'exponentialRampToValueAtTime' on 'AudioParam': Target value must be a finite positive number: 0 While it is true that exponentialRampToValue must throw an error if the value not positive, it's a bit confusing because the argument (1e-60) is definitely positive. This happens because the value 1e-60 is converted internally to a single precision float value, which is an underflow to 0. Changing these methods to use doubles probably causes some performance degradation so this probably shouldn't be done. But we should also give a more informative error message since the user specified 1e-60, but the error message kind of implies 0.

any movie with sound on www.youtube.com

1. Open more than just a couple of tabs
2. Try to play video on youtube (or any other content with sound)

What is the expected behavior?
Sound should be playing normally.

What went wrong?
After opening more than 2-3 tabs, sound in flash (or html5 for youtube) content won't be played.

Did this work before? N/A 

Is it a problem with Flash or HTML5? Both

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

I'm sure it happens with flash or html5 player on youtube, not sure about html5 on other websites. Problem occurs with most flash content with sound (not only youtube).
Sometimes I can open 20+ "light" sites and I can hear sound on youtube (but then 2 or more YT tabs and sound is gone), but sometimes even 4 or 5 tabs are enough to mute Chrome. Sometimes spamming refresh helps, but it's unreliable workaround.

title.$t: delta_generator: Add new operation codes for a to b operations

content.$t:
The MOVE and BSDIFF version of the operations that read from the old partition and write to the new partition should be distinguished from the ones that read and write from the same place.

Since the semantics is quite different for overlapping src and dst extents, I'd prefer a new opcode instead of adding a field in the operation message that tells if the src is the "old" or "new" partition.

Here are some suggestions for the name, feel free to come up with better names:
* COPY_FROM_OLD
* MOVE_FROM_OLD
* MOVE_ATOB

Don? Other better ideas?

title.$t: sandbox: ProcUtil.HasOpenDirectory test may fail on android

content.$t:
The tests ProcUtil.HasOpenDirectory & ProcUtil.HasOpenDirectoryWithFD may fail on later versions of Android due to SELinux policy.

When I run this test on a 5.0.1 L device I get SELinux denies when opening /dev and the test fails.

That's running as the shell context though, the bots may use a different SELinux context when running the test and I'm not sure they run the latest version of L so you might not of been caught yet...

Might be worth picking a different folder for your test on android.

title.$t: shill: in_dark_resume_ not reset at all exit points

content.$t: Currently, the |in_dark_resume_| flag is not reset when shill exits the dark resume state early in WakeOnWiFi::BeforeSuspendActions (when the NIC does not need to be programmed) and WakeOnWiFi::OnDarkResume (when we disable wake on WiFi because of excessive wakes). This can cause problems when the device next wakes in dark resume and functions that use this flag are executed before WakeOnWiFi::OnDarkResume (where the flag is set).

title.$t: create a shill service state visualization

content.$t:
Building on the text-based shill log processor, add functionality to track scans and suspend/resume start and stop times.  Use this new state + the service state transitions to create a visualization in the log processor summary page.

Details:

The visualization will consist of a line graph with each line representing an active service for a manager.  The x-axis is time from the start of that manager (elapsed ms) while the y-axis is the service state.  Each active service (any services that are in states other than IDLE at some point in the log) will have a representing line in the graph.  Since log files may cover long periods of time, a "context" graph will appear below the main graph.  This context graph allows the user to select a subset of the graph to zoom in on details.

The graph additionally depicts scans and suspend/resume events.  Scans are represented by green areas the height of the graph.  If both the start and end of the scan are in the log, a detailed scan area is shown.  If only a stop (or start) of a scan is shown, a partial scan is shown in a different color and the width is a default (just to make sure it appears on the graph).

Suspend/resume events are also included as gray text areas.  These also cover the entire suspend time (when this is known from the logs).  Partial information is depicted with a generic suspend and is again a default width.

title.$t: TouchView: usb keyboards cannot repeat keys when held

content.$t:
1. Enter touchView mode and plug in USB keyboard (tried several different ones).
2. Keyboard is now primary input - VirtualKeyboard does not display thanks to Smart deploy feature.
3. Go to url bar and press-and-hold "a".

Expect that multiple "a"s appear, but instead there is only one.  Holding other keys reveals the same problem.

The same keyboard in normal mode works as expected.  The on-board keyboard in normal mode works as expected.  The Virtual Keyboard, both TouchView and a11y work as expected.

title.$t: Unify GestureRecognizer::AckAsyncTouchEvent and AckSyncTouchEvent

content.$t:
We don't need to have a separate method for sync and async acks, we can just use the unique touch event identifier to uniquely determine which event should be acked.

This will prevent bugs where the wrong method is used, and simplify the GR interface.

title.$t: Add pkgconfig file to vboot_host

content.$t: libvboot_host.a is going to be linked against libmtdutils.a. It would be nice for the downstream packages to query for this additional dependency.

title.$t: chrome should be able to run without disk write access

content.$t:
Currently, we hit a hard CHECK when trying to create a profile in a write-only user data directory.  Even if I remove the check and let the profile be created, we hit DCHECKs in other places.

Initially reported by tc

title.$t: libchromeos: Add https trusted root CA list and enable by default

content.$t: Currently libchromeos does not have a list of trusted root CAs for https clients. It should. And it should be enabled by default when the http classes are used.

title.$t: Use extension's manifest['short_name'] in collapsed toolbar list

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_2) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Drag omnibar edge to hide extension icons in the toolbar
2. Click the chevron button to show the extensions
3. Notice that the names are too long and different from the context menu

What is the expected behavior?
The list should contain an item for "1Password", just like the context menu if you right click on the page.

title.$t: High resolution in WebGL makes for bad performance

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
http://kajos.net/voxel/

Steps to reproduce the problem:
I have an application created with LibGDX. I can run the application on the desktop and it runs at 90 fps @1080p.

On Firefox it runs at 40-50 fps @1080p (maximized window).

On Chrome it runs at 30 fps @1080p (maximized window).

However on Chrome, if I lower the resolution, the performance doubles (to 60fps). On Firefox this does not happen. What can be the cause of this?

I am using webkitRequestAnimationFrame.

As shown, I know my PC can handle the resolution fine.

Edit

I'm trying to apply the tips below, although they seem aimed at mobile GPUs mostly.

Source: https://wiki.mozilla.org/Platform/GFX/MobileGPUs#Memory_Bandwidth

Always call glClear immediately after glBindFramebuffer

See the Adreno 200 document, section 3.2.1: "it is imperative to (a) use clears when switching Frame Buffer Objects (FBOs) to avoid having the driver tries to save/restore GMEM contents, and (b) always clear the depth-buffer at the start of a frame."

That makes sense, so we should always do it. Concretely, this means that we should do a glClear after every glBindFramebuffer call, ideally right after it, or at least before any draw-call.

Framebuffer bindings are expensive

Changing the framebuffer binding forces immediately resolving the rendering of the current framebuffer. Therefore it is important to sort rendering to minimize framebuffer bindings. The Adreno 200 document, Section 3.2.4, has a useful explanation.

Edit

The above did not make a notable difference.

Edit

I have a feeling this problem arises due to the GLSL compiler. I don't have a lot of knowledge on the subject, but I believe GLSL for OpenGL ES is compiled to regular GLSL, with some browser specific code. It could be that Chrome compiles less than optimal and causes fragment shading to slow the program down at higher resolutions.

If someone has some tips on how to make sure that this compilation is optimalized, I could try that out and see if it fixes the problem.

Edit

The problem doesn't seem prevalent in Chrome on Windows with a Intel HD graphics 4000+ chipset. Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111 m. Low resolution: 45fps~. High resolution: 30 fps steady.

My original test case was with Chrome on Ubuntu with a GTX 650. Chrome version will be added later.

Edit

Version of Chrome which displays this problem: 40.0.2214.111 (64-bit) on Ubuntu on a GTX 650 graphics card.

Edit

On the same PC with GTX 650, under Windows 7, the same application runs at 60fps steady under Chrome. Since under Ubuntu the application compiled to Java runs fine at 90fps, I believe it can't be a Linux driver issue, but rather is an issue with the Linux version of Chrome.

What is the expected behavior?
60 fps steadily.

What went wrong?
It runs at 30fps barely.

Does it occur on multiple sites: N/A

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: stable
OS Version: Ubuntu
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

title.$t: Drag-and-dropping a renamed file from the downloads bar silently fails

content.$t: Google Chrome 40.0.2214.114 (Official Build) Revision 9f86a7bbfc2fddc858b75b00dc57661850dd7dc0 Platform 6457.94.0 (Official Build) stable-channel link What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Download a file, and leave the downloads bar open. 2. Rename the file. 3. Drag and drop the file from the downloads bar to a page that accepts that (e.g. Google Drive). What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I expect one of: 1. The rename is tracked and followed, and it uploads the renamed file. 2. The rename is tracked and causes the file to disappear from the downloads bar. 3. The rename isn't tracked, but Chrome notices that it's gone when I try to drag and drop it and presents an error. What I get is no indication that something's gone wrong at all. Drive behaves as if I didn't drag and drop anything, and Chrome behaves as if I dropped it and it worked.

title.$t: Optofidelity Touchbot: Refactor system package and provide test coverage

content.$t:
The codebase needs an overall refactoring to modularize between packages and provide clear separation of responsibilities.

The systems package is first and should provide a clean front-facing API to navigate DUTs, perform gestures on them and record the interaction with a high speed camera. 

The system should be testable without physical access to the robot using a fake backend implementation.

Enter 3+3 (or other calculator question) in the omnibox What is the expected output? 3+3 = 6 It would also be clearer if the calculator result had an icon the informed the user that it was not a normal search result. What do you see instead? = 6 The current icon used shows a search result magnifying glass.

title.$t: TestSessionStateDelegate incorrectly tracking active user session

content.$t:
TestSessionStateDelegate is incorrectly tracking active_user_session_started_.

This flag tracks both the SessionState transition, along with is a user session is blocked (IsUserSessionBlocked).

During an initial login a SessionState can be active, while IsUserSessionBlocked is still true. As the session is blocked until the UI is fully ready.

This does not allow for proper state testing of login.

TestSessionStateDelegate needs to be updated to eliminate this flag, and to properly track the two states.

title.$t: ARC: Display density and fps limit should be part of RenderParams structure.

content.$t: hwcomposer requires the fps limit and display density in order to configure the hwc device.  Right now, it pulls this information directly from either property_get or arc::Options.  However, this information should really come from the renderer's RenderParams structure (in the same way that width/height do).

title.$t: VpnService::CreateConfiguration should probably not use NetworkConfigurationHandler directly.

content.$t: Instead it should probably use ManagedNetworkConfigurationHandler.

title.$t: Use networkIcon Polymer component in existing network settings UI

content.$t:
Currently we pass network state icons as encoded url strings from Chrome to the network UI.

This has a couple of disadvantages:
* It is expensive / slow
* It requires a C++ / JS dependency for what should be View/Controller code

We are developing a network icon element which displays an icon based on network state. We should use that in the current settings UI (as well as the new settings UI).

title.$t: Web Notifications on Android should use default system vibration, sound and light

content.$t:
Web Notifications on Android are currently silent, don't produce a vibration and don't flash the light indicator when present.

Until align with the Web Notification specification and grant authors control over the sound (Issue 442131), vibration (Issue 442132) and whether it should be silent completely (Issue 442134), using the user's settings seems like the right thing to do.

This is a very simple fix, I'll send out a patch soon.

title.$t: Reasonably consistent OOM on Nexus 5 w/ TalkBack when receiving a push message

content.$t:
Taking the following steps:
- Enable TalkBack on Android.
- Open Chrome. I used https://johnme-gcm.appspot.com/chat/.
- Pick a username, accept the permission request.
- Send a message to the chat, observe that an Android system notification is being shown. Keep Chrome in the foreground.

(Note that sending a message sometimes crashes due to Issue 459257.)

The Android system notification is being shown through an incoming push message. We start a background service to send an event in a Service Worker.

Apparently the combined memory pressure of TalkBack, Chrome in the foreground and receiving a push message kills Chromium with an OOM. The Nexus 5 has 2GBs of ram :-(.

title.$t: URL auto complete duplicates the completed text

content.$t:
Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Have enough history to auto complete a URL or search
2. Begin typing the url, for example "gm"
3. Very shortly after typing a character,  and when the highlighted text is visible, tap on the URL bar in the whitespace following the text

What is the expected behavior?
The highlighted text would disappear

What went wrong?
A portion of the highlighted text duplicates

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 38.0.2125.114  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 4.4.4
Flash Version: 

The timing on tapping the URL seems to be around half of a second or less to get the duplication.

title.$t: NaCl: Remove the need for Chromium to call the "start_module" SRPC method
Extension State (aka StateStore) isn't cleared on extension removal.

content.$t:
"Extension State" in the user profile directory stores data per extension.
If an extension is removed, the data associated with this extension isn't removed from that store.

This prevents the user from bringing the system into a clean state by removing/re-installing extensions.

It seems that the right hook is missing in DataDeleter.
